A texture filter.
Gets the minification filter used when the pixel being textured maps to an area less than or equal to one texel.
Gets the magnification filter used when the pixel being textured maps to an area greater than one texel.
Gets the texture wrap for the s direction.
Gets the texture wrap for the t direction.
Gets a texture filter with the following properties: MinificationFilter: Nearest, MagnificationFilter: Nearest, WrapS: ClampToEdge, WrapT: ClampToEdge
Gets a texture filter with the following properties: MinificationFilter: Nearest, MagnificationFilter: Nearest, WrapS: Repeat, WrapT: Repeat
Gets a texture filter with the following properties: MinificationFilter: Linear, MagnificationFilter: Linear, WrapS: ClampToEdge, WrapT: ClampToEdge
Gets a texture filter with the following properties: MinificationFilter: Linear, MagnificationFilter: Linear, WrapS: Repeat, WrapT: Repeat
The filter used when the pixel being textured maps to an area greater than one texel.
Use the texel that is closest to the center of the pixel being textured.
Use the weighted average of the four (for 2D textures, two for 1D textures) texels that are closest to the center of the pixel being textured.
Use the mipmap that most closely matches the size of the pixel being textured. Then use the texel from that mipmap that is closest to the center of the pixel being textured.

Use the mipmap that most closely matches the size of the pixel being textured. Then use the weighted average of the four (for 2D textures, two for 1D textures) texels from that mipmap that are closest to the center of the pixel being textured.

Use the two mipmaps that most closely match the size of the pixel being textured. Determine the texel that is closest to the center of the pixel being textured in each mipmap. The final texture value is a weighted average of these two texels.

Use the two mipmaps that most closely match the size of the pixel being textured. Determine the weighted average of the four (for 2D textures, two for 1D textures) texels that are closest to the center of the pixel being textured in each mipmap. The final texture value is a weighted average of these two texels.
The filter used when the pixel being textured maps to an area less than or equal to one texel.

Use the texel that is closest to the center of the pixel being textured. This usually faster than
Linear but can produce images with sharper edges.
Use the weighted average of the four texels that are closest to the center of the pixel being textured.

Determine how to handle textures coordinates that fall outside of the range
[0, 1].

Clamp the texture coordinate to the range
[0, 1].

Clamp the texture coordinate to the range
[-1/2N, 1 + 1/2N], where
N is the size the texture in the direction of clamping.

Clamp the texture coordinate to the range
[1/2N, 1 - 1/2N], where
N is the size the texture in the direction of clamping.
If the integer part of the texture coordinate is even, use the fractional part of the texture coordinate. Otherwise, use one minus the fractional part of the texture coordinate.
Ignore the integer part of the texture coordinate.

summary.para: A IAgStkGraphicsScene provides properties and functionality that are reflected in the rendering of the globe control that it is associated with. An globe control's IAgStkGraphicsScene is available from the Scene property. Any changes that are made to a IAgStkGraphicsScene will only affect the rendering of the particular globe control it is associated with. The static IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager class provides global properties and functionality that apply to all IAgStkGraphicsScene and thus affect the rendering of every globe control. A IAgStkGraphicsScene has a IAgStkGraphicsCamera, and various properties for changing the visual state of the scene and its IAgStkGraphicsScene.CentralBodies, including changes to IAgStkGraphicsLighting. To render a particular IAgStkGraphicsScene, use the IAgStkGraphicsScene.Render method. To render all Scenes, use use the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Render method.
Renders the scene. To render all the scenes within an application, use the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Render method.

Executes a pick at the given x, y and returns a depth sorted collection of IAgStkGraphicsPickResult. The coordinate origin is top, left. To pick IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay, use the IAgStkGraphicsScene.PickScreenOverlays method.

param.name: X
param.para: The x coordinate of the globe control.

param.name: Y
param.para: The y coordinate of the globe control.

summary.para: Executes a pick in the given rectangular region and returns a depth sorted collection of IAgStkGraphicsPickResult. The coordinate origin is top, left. To pick IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay, use the IAgStkGraphicsScene.PickScreenOverlays method.

param.name: Left
param.para: The left x coordinate of the rectangle in the globe control.

param.name: Bottom
param.para: The bottom y coordinate of the rectangle in the globe control.

param.name: Right
param.para: The right x coordinate of the rectangle in the globe control.

param.name: Top
param.para: The top y coordinate of the rectangle in the globe control.

summary.para: Executes a pick on IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay at the given x, y and returns a front to back sorted collection of IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayPickResult. The coordinate origin is top, left. To pick other objects in the scene, use the IAgStkGraphicsScene.Pick method.

param.name: X
param.para: The x coordinate of the globe control.

param.name: Y
param.para: The y coordinate of the globe control.

Gets or sets whether sunshine is rendered by the Sun Central Body. Sunshine renders a halo effect around the sun when it is viewed in the scene.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics for a specified Central Body.
Gets or sets the background color of the scene.

Gets or sets whether the sky will be shaded based on IAgStkGraphicsCamera altitude. When IAgStkGraphicsScene.ShadeSkyBasedOnAltitude is set to true, the sky will become more blue as the Camera gets closer to the surface of the Central Body.
Gets or sets whether stars are shown or hidden in the scene.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsSceneGlobeOverlaySettings for the scene.

summary.para: Converts a Cartographic position to a pixel coordinate relative to the globe control. This method can throw an exception. Returns an array containing the pixel coordinate (in the order x, y) of the Cartographic position relative to the globe control. The coordinate can be fractional.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the Cartographic position to convert, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para: Converts a Cartographic position to a pixel coordinate relative to the globe control. This method does not throw an exception.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the Cartographic position to convert, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para: Converts a pixel coordinate relative to the globe control to a Cartographic position. For speed, terrain is not considered; if the pixel coordinate does not intersect the ellipsoid, an exception is thrown. Returns the Cartographic position. The array contains the elements of the position in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the pixel coordinate (in the order x, y) to convert.

summary.para: Converts a pixel coordinate relative to the globe control to a Cartographic position. For speed, terrain is not considered. This method does not throw an exception.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the pixel coordinate (in the order x, y) to convert.

summary.para: Zoom to a central body and use the specified axes for rotation. The reference point is set to the center of the central body and the camera's position is set so the entire central body is visible.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body to be viewed.

param.name: Axes
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes of rotation. IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes will be set to this.

summary.para: Zooms to a Cartographic Extent on the centralBody. The camera will be looking straight down at the extent, with the up vector pointing toward local north. The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes is set to an east-north-up axes at the center of extent.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body that the extent is on.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent to be viewed. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

summary.para: Zooms to a rectangular extent composed of west, south, east, north on the centralBody. The camera will be looking straight down at the extent, with the up vector pointing toward local north. The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes is set to an east-north-up axes at the center of the extent.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body that the extent is on.

param.name: West
param.para: The west longitude of the extent.

param.name: South
param.para: The south latitude of the extent.

param.name: East
param.para: The east longitude of the extent.

param.name: North
param.para: The north latitude of the extent.

summary.para: Gets or sets the position of the camera. The array contains the components of the position arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the reference point of the camera. The array contains the components of the reference point arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the direction of the camera in IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes. The array contains the components of the direction arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the up direction of the camera in IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes. The array contains the components of the direction arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the distance the camera position is from the reference point.
Gets or sets camera's axes of rotation.
Gets or sets the axis to constrain the up vector to.
Gets or sets whether the camera can rotate over the constrained up axis. For example, if true the camera would be able to flip over the North Pole and view the globe upside down.
Gets or sets whether the camera's direction is locked.

Gets or sets field of view in radians. The field of view is applied to the larger of the window dimensions. For example, if the window width was 640 and the height was 480, the field of view applies to the horizontal. Use IAgStkGraphicsCamera.HorizontalFieldOfView and IAgStkGraphicsCamera.VerticalFieldOfView to get the horizontal and vertical field of views. Wide fields of views generally show more objects but can look distorted as compared to narrower ones.
Gets the horizontal field of view in radians.
Gets the vertical field of view in radians.
Gets or sets the distance in meters from the camera to the near plane.
Gets or sets the distance in meters from the camera to the far plane.

Gets or sets the value that is used to compute subdivisions of the viewing frustum. A large value will be faster but lose z-value precision. A small value will have better precision but perform slower. The default value of 1000 achieves a good balance between speed and accuracy.

Returns the distance that the Camera's Position should be from the ReferencePoint in order to ensure that a sphere with a 1 meter radius centered at the ReferencePoint fits entirely in the view frustum.
Gets the camera snapshot settings.
Gets the camera video recorder.

Gets the approximate number of meters covered by a pixel that is
1 meter away from the camera. This is commonly multiplied by the distance from the camera to an object to compute the approximate number of meters covered by a pixel of the object.
Gets the Reference Frame that the IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Position is returned in. This Reference Frame is composed of the camera's from Point and the IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes.
Gets the Reference Frame that the IAgStkGraphicsCamera.ReferencePoint is returned in. This Reference Frame is composed of the camera's to Point and the IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes.
When setting the IAgStkGraphicsCamera's IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes, this defines which axis of the axes is up in screen space, where up is from the bottom to the top of the screen.
The X axis is constrained.
The Y axis is constrained.
The Z axis is constrained.
The negative X axis is constrained.
The negative Y axis is constrained.
The negative Z axis is constrained.
No axis is contained.
Takes snapshots of the 3D window.
Saves a snapshot of the 3D window to the filename with the specified format.

param.name: Filename
param.para: The filename of the snapshot.

A raster dataset. A raster consists of one or more AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand, or sets of values, which are most commonly associated with colors when the raster represents an image. For instance, a typical color image contains three sets of values, or bands (red, green, and blue) which define the color of pixels within the image. The following raster image formats can be read by the raster class: BMP, ECW, IMG, JP2, NTF, NITF, PNG, SID, TIF, TIFF, JPG, JPEG, PPM, PGM, CLDS, and TGA. To create a texture from a raster, pass it to the IAgStkGraphicsTexture2DFactory.FromRaster method.
Flips the raster along the given axis.

param.name: Axis
param.para: The axis along which the raster will be flipped.

summary.para: Rotates the raster by the given angle.

param.name: Angle
param.para: The angle in degrees by which the raster is rotated.

summary.para: Applies a IAgStkGraphicsRasterFilter to the raster and returns a new raster with the results of the filtering. The current raster is not modified.

param.name: Filter
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsRasterFilter to apply.

summary.para: Applies a IAgStkGraphicsRasterFilter to the raster. The current raster will contain the results of the filtering.

param.name: Filter

summary.para: Extracts the band of raster data associated with the given AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand.

summary.para: Extracts the bands of raster data associated with the given AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat.

param.name: Format
param.para: The AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat associated with the bands to be extracted.

summary.para: Copies the data associated with the given IAgStkGraphicsRaster into this raster.

summary.para: Gets the IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes that define the raster data.
Gets the width of the raster in pixels.
Gets the height of the raster in pixels.

The attributes describing a IAgStkGraphicsRaster dataset. IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes define the memory layout of a IAgStkGraphicsRaster, and includes properties defining the order of each AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand that the raster contains, as specified by the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat. It also describes the type of data, or AgEStkGraphicsRasterType of the contained bands, the IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes.Height and IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes.Width of the raster in pixels, the IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes.RowAlignment of the raster, and other relevant properties.
Gets whether the raster contains the given band.

param.name: Band
param.para: The AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand to test.

summary.para: Gets the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat associated with the attributes.
Gets the AgEStkGraphicsRasterType associated with the attributes.
Gets the AgEStkGraphicsRasterOrientation associated with the attributes.
Gets the size of the raster data in bytes.
Gets the width of the raster in pixels.
Gets the height of the raster in pixels.
Gets the pixel aspect ratio of the raster.
Gets the row alignment of the raster data in bytes.
Gets the number of bands comprising the raster.
Gets the stride or scan/row width in bytes of the raster data.

Common AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand layouts that may be contained within a IAgStkGraphicsRaster dataset. Each pixel of the raster will contain the bands defined by the layout in the specified order. A typical color raster image will have an AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat.
The format of the IAgStkGraphicsRaster is a single band consisting of red values.
The format of the IAgStkGraphicsRaster is a single band consisting of green values.
The format of the IAgStkGraphicsRaster is a single band consisting of blue values.
The format of the IAgStkGraphicsRaster is a single band consisting of alpha values.
The format of the IAgStkGraphicsRaster is three bands consisting of red, green, and blue values.
The format of the IAgStkGraphicsRaster is three bands consisting of blue, green, and red values.
The format of the IAgStkGraphicsRaster is four bands consisting of red, green, blue, and alpha values.
The format of the IAgStkGraphicsRaster is four bands consisting of blue, green, red, and alpha values.
The format of the IAgStkGraphicsRaster is a single band consisting of luminance values.
The format of the IAgStkGraphicsRaster is two bands consisting of luminance and alpha values.
The type of data contained within each band of a IAgStkGraphicsRaster dataset.
Each value contained within a band can be represented with an unsigned byte.
Each value contained within a band can be represented with a byte.
Each value contained within a band can be represented with an unsigned short.
Each value contained within a band can be represented with a short.
Each value contained within a band can be represented with an unsigned int.
Each value contained within a band can be represented with an int.
Each value contained within a band can be represented with a float.
Each value contained within a band can be represented with a double.
The vertical orientation of the raster.
The raster has a top to bottom orientation.
The raster has a bottom to top orientation.

Common band types that may be contained within a IAgStkGraphicsRaster dataset. Each band can be thought of as a set of values, which are most commonly associated with colors when the raster represents an image. For instance, a typical color image contains three sets of values, or bands (red, green, and blue) which define the color of pixels within the image.
A band containing red values.
A band containing green values.
A band containing blue values.
A band containing alpha values.
A band containing luminance values.
The axis on which a raster will be flipped.
The horizontal axis.
The vertical axis.

A filter for processing IAgStkGraphicsRaster datasets. RasterFilter is the base class for all raster filters. A filter applies a transformation to a source raster either by modifying that raster directly, or returning a new instance of that raster that has the filter applied to it. To apply a filter to a raster, use the IAgStkGraphicsRaster.Apply or IAgStkGraphicsRaster.ApplyInPlace methods. Common filters include color transformations, like IAgStkGraphicsBrightnessFilter and IAgStkGraphicsGammaCorrectionFilter, and IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter based filters like IAgStkGraphicsSharpenFilter and IAgStkGraphicsEdgeDetectFilter.
Records the 3D window to either a movie file or to consecutively ordered image files each time the IAgStkGraphicsScene is rendered.
Starts recording a file in the WMV format at the specified bit and frame rate.

param.name: WmvFilename
param.para: The filename of the WMV file.

param.name: VideoBitRate
param.para: A higher value will create larger files with better visual quality than a lower value that will create smaller files with poorer visual quality. A value of 5000 is a good starting point to judge the file size to visual quality trade-off.

param.name: VideoFrameRate
param.para: The frame rate of the video in frames per second. A value of 30 is typical.

summary.para: Starts recording a frame stack. Each frame is saved as a separate image file. The filename of each frame is defined by a prefix followed by a frame number.

param.para: The directory in which each frame will be saved.

param.para: Used to create the filename of each saved frame.

param.name: CameraSnapshotFileFormat
param.para: The file format of each saved frame.

param.name: StartingFrameNumber
param.para: The number of the first frame

param.name: NumberOfFrameDigits
param.para: The maximum number of digits available for defining the frame number

summary.para: Stops recording.

An indexer into the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics for a particular Central Body, which provides graphical properties such as IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Show the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene, and working with IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Terrain and IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery for the specified Central Body.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphicsIndexer.Item
member.summary: Gets the central body graphics for the specified central body.

summary.para: The graphical properties associated with a particular Central Body. Changing the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics will affect how the associated Central Body is rendered in a IAgStkGraphicsScene. For instance, to show or hide the Central Body, use the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Show property. IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics also contains the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Terrain and IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery for the associated Central Body.
Gets or sets the Color of the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene.
Gets or sets the specular Color of the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The specular color is associated with the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.SpecularOverlay.

Gets or sets the shininess of the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The shininess affects the size and brightness of specular reflection associated with the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.SpecularOverlay.
Gets or sets whether the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery for Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene is shown or hidden.
Gets or sets whether the Central Body is shown or hidden in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. This only affects the Central Body itself, not the IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive that are associated with it.
Gets or sets whether a label with the name of the Central Body should be rendered in the IAgStkGraphicsScene when the IAgStkGraphicsCamera is at certain distance away from the Central Body.

Gets or sets the altitude, in meters, that all IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Terrain and IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery will be offset from the surface of the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene.

Gets or sets the base IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.BaseOverlay is always rendered before any other IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery. By default, the Earth, Sun, and Moon Central Body will have a default IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.BaseOverlay image is loaded by STK Engine when the IAgStkGraphicsScene is created.

Gets or sets the night IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.NightOverlay is displayed only on parts of the Central Body that are not in sun light. The intensity of the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.NightOverlay for all scenes can be adjusted with the scene's IAgStkGraphicsLighting.NightLightsIntensity property.

Gets or sets the specular IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.SpecularOverlay is displayed only in the specular highlight of the Central Body.
Gets the collection of IAgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene.
Gets the collection of IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene.
A IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay that shows an image.
Gets or sets the translucency value for the image. The translucency is between 0 and 1, where 0 is fully opaque and 1 is invisible.

Gets or sets whether to use altitude to determine the translucency value for the image or not. If false, the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.Translucency value is used. If true, the translucency will be determined by the values of IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerTranslucency, IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperTranslucency, IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude, and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude.

Gets or sets the lower translucency value for the image when IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.UseAltitudeBasedTranslucency is set to true. When the altitude of the viewer is at or below IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude, the image will have the translucency specified by this property, and will be linearly interpolated at altitude values between IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude.

Gets or sets the upper translucency value for the image when IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.UseAltitudeBasedTranslucency is set to true. When the altitude of the viewer is at or above IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude, the image will have the translucency specified by this property, and will be linearly interpolated at altitude values between IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude.

Gets or sets the lower altitude bound used to calculate translucency for the image when IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.UseAltitudeBasedTranslucency is set to true. When the altitude of the viewer is at or below this value, the image will have the translucency specified by IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerTranslucency, and will be linearly interpolated at altitude values between IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude.

Gets or sets the upper altitude bound used to calculate translucency for the image when IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.UseAltitudeBasedTranslucency is set to true. When the altitude of the viewer is at or above this value, the image will have the translucency specified by IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperTranslucency, and will be linearly interpolated at altitude values between IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude.
Gets whether or not the video card allows for more than one image globe overlay IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay to be added.

Gets or sets the reference frame this primitive is defined and rendered in.
Gets or sets the bounding sphere that encompasses the primitive. The center is defined in the primitive's Reference Frame.
Gets or sets if the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsBoundingSphere is automatically computed.

Gets or sets the display condition that determines if the primitive should be rendered. Both this and IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Display must evaluate to
true for the primitive to be rendered.

Gets or sets if the primitive should be rendered. Both this and IAgStkGraphicsDisplayCondition must evaluate to
true for the primitive to be rendered.
Gets or sets the primitive's color.

Gets or sets the primitive's translucency.
Translucency is between
0 and
1, where
0 is opaque and
1 is transparent.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom value associated with this primitive.

summary.para: When assigned to objects, such as primitives or globe overlays, display conditions are evaluated to determine if the object should be rendered.

Represents an individual item index that is associated with a batch primitive. Provides the Index of the individual item and the Primitive that contains that index. When the PerItemPickingEnabled property is set to true for a batch primitive, the PickResults returned from Scene.Pick will contain BatchPrimitiveIndex types referencing particular indices within that batch.
The index of the item contained by the Primitive.
The Primitive that contains the item at the Index specified.

Factory creates texture filters.
Factory creates bounding spheres.
Factory creates path points.

Triangulates a box. It is recommended to visualize the box using a IAgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive. Although, if only the fill is desired for visualization, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.RenderBackThenFrontFaces set to
true can be used. Likewise, if only the outline is desired, a IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used.
Computes the triangulation for a box of the specified size, centered at the origin.

param.name: Size
param.para: An array containing the size along each axis of the box. The sizes are expected in the order x, y, z to correspond to the respective axis.

summary.para:
The result from a triangulation of a solid: a triangle mesh defined using an indexed triangle list and positions outlining the solid. It is recommended to visualize the solid using a IAgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive. Although, if only the fill is desired for visualization, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.RenderBackThenFrontFaces set to
true can be used. Likewise, if only the outline is desired, a IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used.

Gets indices into Positions that define the positions outlining the solid. The indices returned consider the three components of a position (x, y, and z) as a single array element. Multiply the index by 3 to get the location of the x component in Positions.
Gets the positions outlining the solid. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.
Gets the AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType of IAgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResult.OutlineIndices and IAgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResult.OutlinePositions.
Gets whether the solid is closed. For example, a box with six faces is closed. If one face is removed, the box is open.
Describes how to interpret positions defining a polyline.
Every two positions define a line segment. Line segments are not required to be connected to each other.
After the first position, each additional position defines a line segment from the previous position to the current position.

Triangulates a cylinder. It is recommended to visualize the cylinder using a IAgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive. Although, if only the fill is desired for visualization, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.RenderBackThenFrontFaces set to
true can be used. Likewise, if only the outline is desired, a IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used.
Computes the triangulation for a cylinder centered at the origin.

param.name: Length
param.para: The length, in meters, of the cylinder along the z axis.

param.name: Radius
param.para: The radius, in meters, of the cylinder.

summary.para: Computes the triangulation for a cylinder centered at the origin.

param.name: Length
param.para: The length, in meters, of the cylinder along the z axis.

param.name: BottomRadius
param.para: The radius, in meters, of the cylinder's bottom cap.

param.name: TopRadius
param.para: The radius, in meters, of the cylinder's top cap.

param.name: Slices
param.para: The number of slices around the z axis.

param.name: CylinderFill
param.para:
Flags enumeration indicating what cylinder faces should be filled. Values can be logically
ored together.

summary.para: Cylinder faces that can be filled.
Fill the cylinder's wall.
Fill the cylinder's bottom cap.
Fill the cylinder's top cap.
Completely fill the cylinder, including its wall, bottom, and top cap.

Triangulates an ellipsoid. It is recommended to visualize the ellipsoid using a IAgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive. Although, if only the fill is desired for visualization, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.RenderBackThenFrontFaces set to
true can be used. Likewise, if only the outline is desired, a IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used.
Computes the triangulation for an ellipsoid with the specified radii, centered at the origin, using 32 slices and 16 stacks.

param.name: Radii
param.para: The radii of the ellipsoid along each of its axes. The sizes are expected in the order x, y, z to correspond to the respective axis.

summary.para: Computes the triangulation for an ellipsoid with the specified radii, centered at the origin.

param.name: Radii
param.para: The radii of the ellipsoid along each of its axes. The sizes are expected in the order x, y, z to correspond to the respective axis.

param.name: Slices
param.para: The number of slices around the z axis.

param.name: Stacks
param.para: The number of stacks along the z axis.

summary.para: Triangulates a polyline into an extrusion with bottom and top boundaries.

Computes an extrusion between bottomPositions and topPositions on the specified centralBody. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorInitializer with a
positionsWindingOrder of AgEStkGraphicsWindingOrder.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: BottomPositions
param.para: An array containing bottom positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

param.name: TopPositions
param.para: An array containing top positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

summary.para: Computes an extrusion between bottomPositions and topPositions on the specified centralBody.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: BottomPositions
param.para: An array containing bottom positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

param.name: TopPositions
param.para: An array containing top positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

param.name: PositionsWindingOrder
param.para: The winding order of bottomPositions and topPositions.

summary.para: For convenience. Computes an extrusion between bottomPositions and topPositions on the specified centralBody using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in bottomPositions and topPositions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorInitializer

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: BottomPositions
param.para: An array containing bottom positions, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: TopPositions
param.para: An array containing top positions, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para: For convenience. Computes an extrusion between bottomPositions and topPositions on the specified centralBody using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in bottomPositions and topPositions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorInitializer

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: BottomPositions
param.para: An array containing bottom positions, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: TopPositions
param.para: An array containing top positions, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: PositionsWindingOrder
param.para: The winding order of bottomPositions and topPositions.

summary.para:
Computes an extrusion of positions on the specified centralBody with a constant bottomAltitude and topAltitude. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorInitializer with a
positionsWindingOrder of AgEStkGraphicsWindingOrder.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the polyline positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame, that should be extruded.

param.name: BottomAltitude
param.para: The extrusion's bottom altitude, in meters, above the ellipsoid.

param.name: TopAltitude
param.para: The extrusion's top altitude, in meters, above the ellipsoid.

summary.para: Computes an extrusion of positions on the specified centralBody with a constant bottomAltitude and topAltitude.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the polyline positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame, that should be extruded.

param.name: BottomAltitude
param.para: The extrusion's bottom altitude, in meters, above the ellipsoid.

param.name: TopAltitude
param.para: The extrusion's top altitude, in meters, above the ellipsoid.

param.name: PositionsWindingOrder
param.para: The winding order of positions.

summary.para: For convenience. Computes an extrusion of positions on the specified centralBody with a constant bottomAltitude and topAltitude using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorInitializer

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the polyline positions that should be extruded, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: BottomAltitude
param.para: The extrusion's bottom altitude, in meters, above the ellipsoid.

param.name: TopAltitude
param.para: The extrusion's top altitude, in meters, above the ellipsoid.

summary.para: For convenience. Computes an extrusion of positions on the specified centralBody with a constant bottomAltitude and topAltitude using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorInitializer

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the polyline positions that should be extruded, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: BottomAltitude
param.para: The extrusion's bottom altitude, in meters, above the ellipsoid.

param.name: TopAltitude
param.para: The extrusion's top altitude, in meters, above the ellipsoid.

param.name: PositionsWindingOrder
param.para: The winding order of positions.

summary.para:
Computes an extrusion of positions on the specified centralBody. One side of the extrusion has a constant altitude and the other has the original altitudes from positions. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorInitializer with a
positionsWindingOrder of AgEStkGraphicsWindingOrder.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the polyline positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame, that should be extruded.

param.name: Altitude
param.para: The extrusion's constant altitude, in meters, above the ellipsoid.

summary.para: Computes an extrusion of positions on the specified centralBody. One side of the extrusion has a constant altitude and the other has the original altitudes from positions.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the polyline positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame, that should be extruded.

param.name: Altitude
param.para: The extrusion's constant altitude, in meters, above the ellipsoid.

param.name: PositionsWindingOrder
param.para: The winding order of positions.

summary.para: For convenience. Computes an extrusion of positions on the specified centralBody using Cartographic positions. One side of the extrusion has a constant altitude and the other has the original altitudes from positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorInitializer

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the polyline positions that should be extruded, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: Altitude
param.para: The extrusion's constant altitude, in meters, above the ellipsoid.

summary.para: For convenience. Computes an extrusion of positions on the specified centralBody using Cartographic positions. One side of the extrusion has a constant altitude and the other has the original altitudes from positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorInitializer

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the polyline positions that should be extruded, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: Altitude
param.para: The extrusion's constant altitude, in meters, above the ellipsoid.

param.name: PositionsWindingOrder
param.para: The winding order of positions.

summary.para: The result from extruded polyline triangulation: a triangle mesh defined using an indexed triangle list with top and bottom boundary positions. The mesh is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive. The boundaries are commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.
Gets the boundary positions along the top of the extrusion. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.
Gets the boundary positions along the bottom of the extrusion. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.
Gets the winding order of IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResult.TopBoundaryPositions and IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResult.BottomBoundaryPositions.
Specifies the order for positions or front facing triangles. Winding order is important for triangulation and backface culling.
Positions or triangles are defined in counter-clockwise order.
Positions or triangles are defined in clockwise order.
The winding order is unknown and should be computed. For best performance, only use this value if you do not know the actual winding order.

Triangulates an extent on a central body into a triangle mesh and a surrounding boundary. The mesh is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive. The boundary is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.

Computes a triangulation on the specified centralBody for the specified extent. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceExtentTriangulatorInitializer with an
altitude of
0 and a
granularity of
1 degree.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent to compute the triangulation for. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

summary.para: Computes a triangulation on the specified centralBody for the specified extent.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent to compute the triangulation for. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

param.name: Altitude
param.para:
The altitude of the triangulation. When
0, the mesh is computed to conform to the ellipsoid.

param.name: Granularity
param.para: The angular separation, in radians, of triangles in the triangulation. Lower granularities are more precise but create more triangles.

summary.para: The result from a triangulation on the surface of a central body: a triangle mesh defined using an indexed triangle list and boundary positions surrounding the mesh. The mesh is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive. The boundary are commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.
Gets the granularity, in radians, used when the triangulation was computed. Lower granularities are more precise but create more triangles.

Gets indices into Positions that define the boundary positions that surround the mesh. The indices returned consider the three components of a position (x, y, and z) as a single array element. Multiply the index by 3 to get the location of the x component in Positions.
Gets the boundary positions that surround the mesh. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.
Gets the winding order of IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceTriangulatorResult.BoundaryPositions.
Gets the AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType of IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceTriangulatorResult.BoundaryPositions.

Triangulates a polygon, with an optional hole, on a central body, into a triangle mesh and a surrounding boundary. The mesh is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive. The boundary is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.

Computes the triangulation on the specified centralBody for a polygon whose boundary is defined by the specified positions. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfacePolygonTriangulatorInitializer with an
altitude of
0, a
granularity of
1 degree, and a
positionsWindingOrder of AgEStkGraphicsWindingOrder.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) defining the boundary of the polygon, in the centralBody's fixed reference frame, to triangulate.

summary.para: For convenience. Computes the triangulation on the specified centralBody for a polygon whose boundary is defined by the specified Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfacePolygonTriangulatorInitializer

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions defining the boundary of the polygon to triangulate, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para:
Computes the triangulation on the specified centralBody for a polygon whose boundary is defined by the specified positions with a hole specified by holePositions. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfacePolygonTriangulatorInitializer with an
altitude of
0 and a
granularity of
1 degree.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) defining the boundary of the polygon, in the centralBody's fixed reference frame, to triangulate.

param.name: HolePositions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) defining the hole in the polygon, in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

summary.para: Computes the triangulation on the specified centralBody for a polygon whose boundary is defined by the specified positions with a hole specified by holePositions.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) defining the boundary of the polygon, in the centralBody's fixed reference frame, to triangulate.

param.name: HolePositions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) defining the hole in the polygon, in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

param.name: Altitude
param.para:
The altitude of the triangulation. When
0, the mesh is computed to conform to the ellipsoid.

param.name: Granularity
param.para: The angular separation, in radians, of positions in the triangulation. Lower granularities are more precise but create more triangles.

summary.para: Computes the triangulation on the specified centralBody for a polygon whose boundary is defined by the specified positions.

param.name: Altitude
param.para:
The altitude of the triangulation. When
0, the mesh is computed to conform to the ellipsoid.

param.name: Granularity
param.para: The angular separation, in radians, of positions in the triangulation. Lower granularities are more precise but create more triangles.

param.name: PositionsWindingOrder
param.para: The winding order of positions.

summary.para: For convenience. Computes the triangulation on the specified centralBody for a polygon whose boundary is defined by the specified Cartographic positions. A IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay which IAgStkGraphicsProjection a IAgStkGraphicsRaster onto the IAgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay or surface of the Central Body. You can also enable projection onto IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive by setting IAgStkGraphicsSceneGlobeOverlaySettings.ProjectedRasterModelProjection to true for a Scene. The IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay can also be used with IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream and IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream to stream IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream and other raster data to a IAgStkGraphicsProjection that moves with time.
Initializes a new instance.

param.name: Raster
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsRaster to be projected with projection.

param.name: Projection
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection that will project the raster.

summary.para: Gets whether or not the video card supports the IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.

A IAgStkGraphicsProjection represents a simplified camera with a IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Position, IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Orientation, and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewHorizontal and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewVertical. Unlike a real world camera, IAgStkGraphicsProjection has a nearest and farthest viewing distance, as defined by the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.NearPlane and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FarPlane properties. For example, IAgStkGraphicsProjection can be used to represent a UAV's camera, to allow for projecting video onto terrain. See the Raster and Projection Streams Overview for such an example.

Gets or sets the Cartesian defining the position of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection in the central body's fixed reference frame. The array contains the components of the position arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the Unit Quaternion defining the orientation of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection in the central body's fixed reference frame.
Gets or sets the horizontal field of view associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.
Gets or sets the vertical field of view associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.
Gets or sets the near plane associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.
Gets or sets the far plane associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

A IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay which IAgStkGraphicsProjection a IAgStkGraphicsRaster onto the IAgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay or surface of the Central Body. You can also enable projection onto IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive by setting IAgStkGraphicsSceneGlobeOverlaySettings.ProjectedRasterModelProjection to true for a Scene. The IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay can also be used with IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream and IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream to stream IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream and other raster data to a IAgStkGraphicsProjection that moves with time.
Gets or sets the IAgStkGraphicsRaster that is IAgStkGraphicsProjection
Gets or sets the IAgStkGraphicsProjection that projects the IAgStkGraphicsRaster

Gets or sets whether to show shadows or not. When set to true, the IAgStkGraphicsRaster will only be projected onto parts of the terrain visible from the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's position. When false, the IAgStkGraphicsRaster will project onto any terrain inside the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's view frustum. Shadows are more realistic, but are slower to render.
Gets or sets whether to show the frustum of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.
Gets or sets whether to show the far plane of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection. If this is set to true, you will see the projected IAgStkGraphicsRaster even when it does not intersect terrain.
Gets or sets the color of the projected IAgStkGraphicsRaster.
Gets or sets the color of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's frustum.
Gets or sets the color of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's far plane.
Gets or sets the color of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's shadow.
Gets or sets the color of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's border.
Gets or sets the width of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's border.
Gets or sets the translucency of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's frustum.
Gets or sets the translucency of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's far plane.
Gets or sets the translucency of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's shadow.
Gets or sets the translucency of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's border.
Gets or sets whether IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.TransparentColor should be used.
Gets or sets the Color that will become transparent.

Gets the direction vectors in the central body's fixed reference frame that define the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's frustum. The collection contains the direction vector down the center of the projection, and the bottom left, bottom right, upper right, and upper left corner direction vectors, in that order. If no direction can be calculated, Cartesian.Zero is returned. Each vector is represented in the array as its individual components in the order x, y, z.
Gets whether or not the video card supports the IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.

A IAgStkGraphicsProjection represents a simplified camera with a IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Position, IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Orientation, and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewHorizontal and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewVertical. Unlike a real world camera, IAgStkGraphicsProjection has a nearest and farthest viewing distance, as defined by the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.NearPlane and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FarPlane properties. For example, IAgStkGraphicsProjection can be used to represent a UAV's camera, to allow for projecting video onto terrain. See the Raster and Projection Streams Overview for such an example.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance.

param.name: FieldOfViewVertical
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewVertical associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

param.name: NearPlane

param.name: FarPlane
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FarPlane associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive altitude interval, in meters, that determines when an object is rendered based on the camera's altitude relative to a Central Body.
Initializes a default altitude display condition. With this constructor, an object is always rendered regardless of the camera's altitude.

Initializes an altitude display condition with the inclusive altitude interval [minimumAltitude, maximumAltitude]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the camera's altitude, relative to the Central Body, is within the interval.

param.name: MinimumAltitude
param.para:
The minimum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MinValue to ignore checking the minimum altitude.

param.name: MaximumAltitude
param.para:
The maximum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum altitude.

summary.para: Initializes an altitude display condition with the inclusive altitude interval [minimumAltitude, maximumAltitude]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the camera's altitude, relative to the centralBody, is within the interval.

param.para: The Central Body to which the altitude is relative.

param.name: MinimumAltitude
param.para:
The minimum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MinValue to ignore checking the minimum altitude.

param.name: MaximumAltitude
param.para:
The maximum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum altitude.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive altitude interval, in meters, that determines when an object is rendered based on the camera's altitude relative to a Central Body.

Gets or sets the maximum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum altitude.
Gets or sets the Central Body to which the altitude is relative.

A composite of display conditions combined using a AgEStkGraphicsBinaryLogicOperation. For example, several IAgStkGraphicsTimeIntervalDisplayCondition objects can be added to a composite. The composite can then be assigned to an object so the object is only rendered when the current animation time is within one of the time intervals.
Initializes an empty composite display condition.

A composite of display conditions combined using a AgEStkGraphicsBinaryLogicOperation. For example, several IAgStkGraphicsTimeIntervalDisplayCondition objects can be added to a composite. The composite can then be assigned to an object so the object is only rendered when the current animation time is within one of the time intervals.

Requests enough memory for the composite to contain at least count display conditions. IAgStkGraphicsCompositeDisplayCondition.Count will not be affected but IAgStkGraphicsCompositeDisplayCondition.Capacity may be.

param.name: Count
param.para: The number of display conditions to request memory for.

When true, a logical

An empty composite display condition evaluates to
true, so when an empty composite is assigned to an object, the object is always rendered.

summary.para:
Determines if a logical
not operation is applied to a display condition in the composite.

remarks.para: Display conditions can be in more than one composite at a time. Each composite may or may not negate the display condition. So a display condition that is negated in one composite is not necessarily negated in another.

A primitive that is composed of multiple other primitives. Since composites can contain other composites, they are commonly used to build hierarchies of primitives to efficiently evaluate display conditions.

member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection. The order of the primitives is not guaranteed to be the order that the primitives were added.

summary.para: The order in which primitives are sorted before rendering.
Primitives are sorted by their internal state before rendering. This provides good performance but can lead to blending artifacts with translucent primitives along the same line of sight.

Primitives are sorted in back to front order before rendering. For translucent primitives, this enables correct blending results. This may not perform as well as
PrimitivesSortOrderByState since the CPU has to sort the primitives before rendering.
Primitives are sorted by their internal state before rendering. This provides good performance but can lead to blending artifacts with translucent primitives along the same line of sight.

Primitives are sorted in back to front order before rendering. For translucent primitives, this enables correct blending results. This may not perform as well as
PrimitivesSortOrderByState since the CPU has to sort the primitives before rendering.

A display condition that evaluates to a user-defined value. This is commonly used to hide primitives by assigning to a primitive a display condition that always returns
false.

Initializes a default constant display condition. IAgStkGraphicsConstantDisplayCondition.Display is set to
false so when this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is not rendered.
Initializes a constant display condition with the value the display condition evaluates to.

param.name: Display
param.para: The value the display condition evaluates to. If true, when this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is always rendered. If false, the object is never rendered.

summary.para:
A display condition that evaluates to a user-defined value. This is commonly used to hide primitives by assigning to a primitive a display condition that always returns
false.
Gets or sets the value the display condition evaluates to.
Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to the object.

Initializes a default distance display condition. IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition.MinimumDistance is set to
0 and IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition.MaximumDistance is set to
Double.MaxValue. With this interval, an object is always rendered regardless of its distance to the camera.

Initializes a distance display condition with the inclusive distance interval [minimumDistance, maximumDistance]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the distance, in meters, from the camera to the object is within the interval.

param.name: MinimumDistance
param.para: The minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

param.name: MaximumDistance
param.para:
The maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to the object.
Gets or sets the minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

Gets or sets the maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.
Gets the squared minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.
Gets the squared maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay. This is different from IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition because it is based on the camera's distance to a specified IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay, rather than the camera's distance to the object that uses this display condition.
Initializes a default distance to globe overlay display condition. With this constructor, an object is always rendered regardless of the camera's distance to the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay.

Initializes a distance display condition with the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay and the inclusive distance interval [minimumDistance, maximumDistance]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the distance, in meters, from the camera to the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay is within the interval.

param.name: GlobeOverlay
param.para: The globe overlay associated with this instance.

param.name: MinimumDistance
param.para: The minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

param.name: MaximumDistance
param.para:
The maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay. This is different from IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition because it is based on the camera's distance to a specified IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay, rather than the camera's distance to the object that uses this display condition.
Gets or sets the globe overlay associated with this instance.
Gets or sets the minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.
Gets the squared minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

Gets or sets the maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.
Gets the squared maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.
The base class of all IAgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay objects.
Gets the Central Body that the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay is displayed on. It will return null if the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay hasn't been added to a Central Body.

Gets the Cartographic Extent that represents the area covered by the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay. The array elements are arranged in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.
Gets the AgEStkGraphicsGlobeOverlayRole of the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay.
Gets the absolute URI specifying the location of the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay.
Gets whether or not the overlay is valid. It can be invalid because of a missing file, corrupt file, unlicensed file, or a file on the incorrect Central Body.
Gets or sets the IAgStkGraphicsDisplayCondition that controls whether or not the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay is displayed.
The role of a IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay.
The IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay is a base image.
The IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay is a base image that is only displayed on the area of the Central Body that is not lit by the sun.
The IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay is a base image that shows the glint of the sun on the Central Body.
The IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay is a normal overlay without a special role.
The role of the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay isn't set.

Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to a position defined in the given Reference Frame.

Initializes a default distance to position display condition. With this constructor, an object is always rendered regardless of the camera's distance to the IAgStkGraphicsDistanceToPositionDisplayCondition.Position.

Initializes a distance display condition with the inclusive distance interval [minimumDistance, maximumDistance]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the distance, in meters, from the camera to the position is within the interval.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the position (in the order x, y, z) used to compute the distance from the camera.

param.name: MinimumDistance
param.para: The minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

param.name: MaximumDistance
param.para:
The maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

summary.para: Initializes a distance display condition with the inclusive distance interval [minimumDistance, maximumDistance]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the distance, in meters, from the camera to the position is within the interval.

param.para: The reference frame of the position.

param.para: An array containing the position (in the order x, y, z) used to compute the distance from the camera.

param.para: The minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

param.name: MaximumDistance
param.para:
The maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

Gets or sets the position used to compute the distance from the camera. The array contains the components of the position arranged in the order x, y, z.

Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a screen overlay, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to the IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive. This is different from IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition because it is based on the camera's distance to a specified IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive, rather than the camera's distance to the object that uses this display condition.
Initializes a default distance to primitive display condition. With this constructor, an object is always rendered regardless of the camera's distance to the IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.

Initializes a distance to primitive display condition with the inclusive distance interval [minimumDistance, maximumDistance]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a screen overlay, the object is only rendered when the distance, in meters, from the camera to the IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive, is within the interval.

param.name: Primitive
param.para: The primitive associated with this instance.

param.name: MinimumDistance
param.para: The minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

param.name: MaximumDistance
param.para:
The maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a screen overlay, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to the IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive. This is different from IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition because it is based on the camera's distance to a specified IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive, rather than the camera's distance to the object that uses this display condition.
Gets or sets the primitive associated with this instance.
Gets or sets the minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.
Gets the squared minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

Gets or sets the maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.
