IAgStkGraphicsPathPrimitive update policy that removes points from IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.RemoveLocation after a given IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.Duration.

Constructs a default update policy. This is equivalent to constructing a policy with IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.Duration set to 0 and a IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.RemoveLocation of
Front.
Initializes a policy with the specified duration and removeLocation.

param.name: Duration
param.para: Sets the amount of time that a point at IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.RemoveLocation will be on the path.

param.name: RemoveLocation
param.para: Sets the remove location to the front or back of the path.

summary.para: IAgStkGraphicsPathPrimitive update policy that removes points from IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.RemoveLocation after a given IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.Duration.
Gets or sets the maximum duration that a point will lie on the line.
Gets or sets where the positions on the path are removed from.
Represents the location of a point to be removed.
Remove from the front of the line.
Remove from the back of the line.
A IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay that shows an image.
Gets whether or not the video card allows for more than one image globe overlay IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay to be added.

A font that is suitable for use with the IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive. For best performance, avoid creating duplicate font objects. Instead assign the same font object to several text batch primitives.
Initializes a graphics font with the given arguments.

param.name: Name
param.para: The typeface name of the font.

param.name: Size
param.para: The size of the font.

param.name: FontStyle
param.para:
The style of the font. AgEStkGraphicsFontStyle enumeration values can be logically
ored together to apply more than one style.

param.name: Outline
param.para:
true if the font should be created with an outline around its characters; otherwise,
false.

summary.para: Initializes a graphics font with the typeface name and size.

param.name: Name
param.para: The typeface name of the font.

param.name: Size
param.para: The size of the font.

summary.para: Font styles.
Regular font.
Bold font.
Italic font.
Underlined font.
Strike-out style.

A font that is suitable for use with the IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive. For best performance, avoid creating duplicate font objects. Instead assign the same font object to several text batch primitives.
Gets the typeface name of the font.
Gets the size of the font.
Gets a value that indicates whether this font is bold.
Gets a value that indicates whether this font is italic.
Gets a value that indicates whether this font is underlined.
Gets a value that indicates whether this font has a horizontal line through its characters.
Gets a value that indicates whether this font has an outline around its characters.
Gets the AgEStkGraphicsFontStyle enumeration that contains the style for this font. This does not include the IAgStkGraphicsGraphicsFont.Outline property.
The great arc interpolator computes interpolated positions along a great arc. A great arc is the shortest path between two positions on an ellipsoid.

Initializes a default great arc interpolator. This is equivalent to constructing a great arc interpolator with a IAgStkGraphicsGreatArcInterpolator.CentralBody equal to an instance of Earth Central Body and a IAgStkGraphicsGreatArcInterpolator.Granularity of
1 degree.

Initializes a great arc interpolator with the specified centralBody and a IAgStkGraphicsGreatArcInterpolator.Granularity of
1 degree.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body used when interpolating with Interpolate.

summary.para: Initializes a great arc interpolator with the specified centralBody and granularity.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body used when interpolating with Interpolate.

param.name: Granularity
param.para: The granularity, in radians, used when interpolating with Interpolate.

summary.para: The great arc interpolator computes interpolated positions along a great arc. A great arc is the shortest path between two positions on an ellipsoid.
Gets or sets the central body used when interpolating with IAgStkGraphicsGreatArcInterpolator.Interpolate.
Gets or sets the granularity, in radians, used when interpolating with IAgStkGraphicsGreatArcInterpolator.Interpolate. Lower granularities are more precise but create more positions.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster derived from the luminance of the raster's color bands.
Initializes a new instance.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster derived from the luminance of the raster's color bands.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster based on the value of its first pixel. All pixels in the source raster that are the same color as the first pixel will be made transparent.
Initializes a new instance.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster based on the value of its first pixel. All pixels in the source raster that are the same color as the first pixel will be made transparent.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster derived from the color bands or alpha of another raster. This filter can be used to apply an alpha mask to the source raster.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with the raster that the source raster will use to derive an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band.

param.name: Raster
param.para: The raster the source raster will use to derive an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band.

summary.para: Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster derived from the color bands or alpha of another raster. This filter can be used to apply an alpha mask to the source raster.
Gets or sets the raster that the source raster will use to derive an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band.
Extracts a band or set of bands from the source raster. The IAgStkGraphicsBandExtractFilter.ExtractFormat property specifies the bands and the order of the bands that will be extracted.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with the AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand to be extracted from the source raster.

param.name: RasterBand
param.para: The AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand to be extracted from the source raster.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance with the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat containing the bands to be extracted from the source raster.

param.name: RasterFormat
param.para: The AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat containing the bands to be extracted from the source raster.

summary.para: Extracts a band or set of bands from the source raster. The IAgStkGraphicsBandExtractFilter.ExtractFormat property specifies the bands and the order of the bands that will be extracted.
Gets or sets the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat containing the bands and the order of the bands that will be extracted.

Reorders or swizzles the bands of the source raster to match the band order of the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat specified by the IAgStkGraphicsBandOrderFilter.BandOrder property. When IAgStkGraphicsBandOrderFilter.MaintainRasterFormat is true, the source raster's format is maintained after swizzling.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with a AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat indicating the desired order of the bands in the source raster.

param.name: BandOrder
param.para: The AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat indicating the desired order of the bands in the source raster.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance with a AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat indicating the desired order of the bands in the source raster, and whether to maintain the source raster's format after swizzling.

param.name: BandOrder
param.para: The AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat indicating the desired order of the bands in the source raster.

param.name: MaintainImageFormat
param.para: true to maintain the source raster's format after swizzling; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Reorders or swizzles the bands of the source raster to match the band order of the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat specified by the IAgStkGraphicsBandOrderFilter.BandOrder property. When IAgStkGraphicsBandOrderFilter.MaintainRasterFormat is true, the source raster's format is maintained after swizzling.
Gets or sets the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat indicating the desired order of the bands in the source raster.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to maintain the source raster's format after the filter is applied. When true, the source raster's format is maintained after swizzling.
Applies a IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter to blur or smooth the source raster. Can be used to reduce noise in the raster.

param.para: Method used to blur the source raster.

summary.para: Applies a IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter to blur or smooth the source raster. Can be used to reduce noise in the raster.

The method used to blur or smooth a raster.
Provides smoothing and noise reduction through mean filtering.
Provides basic blurring.
Adjusts the brightness of the source raster's color bands. The IAgStkGraphicsBrightnessFilter.Adjustment to brightness is a value between -1 and 1, corresponding to least bright to most bright.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with the IAgStkGraphicsBrightnessFilter.Adjustment to brightness.

param.name: Adjustment
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsBrightnessFilter.Adjustment to brightness.

summary.para: Adjusts the brightness of the source raster's color bands. The IAgStkGraphicsBrightnessFilter.Adjustment to brightness is a value between -1 and 1, corresponding to least bright to most bright.
Gets or sets the brightness adjustment value for the filter. The value must be between -1 and 1, corresponding to least bright to most bright.
Extracts a AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band derived from the color bands of the source raster.
Initializes a new instance.
Extracts a AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band derived from the color bands of the source raster.
Adjusts the contrast of the source raster. The IAgStkGraphicsContrastFilter.Adjustment to contrast is a value between -1 and 1, corresponding to least contrast to most contrast.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with the IAgStkGraphicsContrastFilter.Adjustment to contrast.

param.name: Adjustment
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsContrastFilter.Adjustment to contrast.

summary.para: Adjusts the contrast of the source raster. The IAgStkGraphicsContrastFilter.Adjustment to contrast is a value between -1 and 1, corresponding to least contrast to most contrast.
Gets or sets the contrast adjustment value for the filter. The value must be between -1 and 1, corresponding to least contrast to most contrast.

Applies convolution to the source raster. Convolution is the modification of a pixel's value based on the values of its surrounding pixels. The IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel is the numerical matrix that is applied to each pixel in this process. The convolution operation is discussed in more detail in numerous texts on image processing and useful convolution kernels are widely available from various sources.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with the specified IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel.

param.name: Kernel
param.para: An array containing the 9 elements of the IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel of the convolution matrix. The elements should be provided as the entire first row, followed by the entire second row, followed by the entire third row, each from left to right.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance with the specified IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel and IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Divisor.

param.name: Kernel
param.para: An array containing the 9 elements of the IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel of the convolution matrix. The elements should be provided as the entire first row, followed by the entire second row, followed by the entire third row, each from left to right.

param.name: Divisor
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Divisor of the convolution.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance with the specified IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel, IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Divisor, and IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Offset.

param.name: Kernel
param.para: An array containing the 9 elements of the IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel of the convolution matrix. The elements should be provided as the entire first row, followed by the entire second row, followed by the entire third row, each from left to right.

param.name: Divisor
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Divisor of the convolution.

param.name: Offset
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Offset of the convolution.

summary.para: Applies convolution to the source raster. Convolution is the modification of a pixel's value based on the values of its surrounding pixels. The IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel is the numerical matrix that is applied to each pixel in this process. The convolution operation is discussed in more detail in numerous texts on image processing and useful convolution kernels are widely available from various sources.
Gets or sets the divisor for the result of the convolution kernel operation.
Gets or sets the offset for the result of the convolution kernel operation. The value is added to the result of the operation.

Gets or sets the convolution kernel of the filter. The array contains the 9 elements of the IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel of the convolution matrix. The elements are provided as the entire first row, followed by the entire second row, followed by the entire third row, each from left to right.
Applies a IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter to detect edges in the source raster.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with the specified AgEStkGraphicsEdgeDetectMethod.

param.name: Method
param.para: Method used to detect edges in the source raster.

summary.para: Applies a IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter to detect edges in the source raster.
Gets or sets the method used to detect edges in the source raster.
The method used to detect edges in a raster.
Detects vertical edges.
Detects horizontal edges.
Detects left diagonal edges.
Detects right diagonal edges.
Detects edges using the Laplacian method.
Detects edges using the Prewitt-Laplacian method.
Detects vertical edges using the Sobel method.
Detects horizontal edges using the Sobel method.
A class decorator for applying a IAgStkGraphicsRasterFilter to each update of a IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream. Can be used to apply filters to videos and other raster streams as they are updated.
Initializes a new instance with a IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream and the IAgStkGraphicsRasterFilter that will be applied to each update of that stream.

param.name: RasterStream
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream that will have the IAgStkGraphicsRasterFilter applied on each update.

param.name: Filter
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsRasterFilter to apply to each update of the IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.

summary.para: A raster, the data of which, is updated dynamically at the specified IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.UpdateDelta. The class can be used to stream video and other dynamic raster data to textures and other IAgStkGraphicsRaster clients. Note to Implementers: When implementing a derived class of RasterStream, you must provide an implementation for the IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.Update method. The IAgStkGraphicsRaster.Attributes property of the Raster should be set in the constructor of the derived class.

When overridden in a derived class, updates the raster data associated with the raster stream at the specified time. When the IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.Update method is called, the raster stream contains a raster data buffer defined by the current IAgStkGraphicsRaster.Attributes of the stream for updating the raster data. The time parameter provides the current and next IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time. Return true if the raster data was updated, otherwise return false.

param.name: Time
param.para: The current IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time.

param.name: NextTime
param.para: The next IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time.

summary.para: Gets or sets the update delta of the raster stream in seconds. The IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.UpdateDelta defines the interval at which the IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.Update method will be called. The default IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.UpdateDelta is 0, which will call the IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.Update method every time the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time changes. When animating, this means the IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.Update method would be called on every animation step.
A class decorator for applying a IAgStkGraphicsRasterFilter to each update of a IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream. Can be used to apply filters to videos and other raster streams as they are updated.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsRasterFilter that will be applied to the IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream on each update.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream that will have the IAgStkGraphicsRasterFilter applied on each update.

Converts an image, such as a BMP, to a GeoJP2 file that can be used as an image globe overlay.
Converts an image, such as a BMP, to a GeoJP2 file that can be used as an image globe overlay. The extent of the image must be in the image, as in a GeoTIFF.

param.name: ImageUri
param.para: The image filename to be converted. Only file URIs are supported.

param.name: CompressionProfile
param.para: The compression profile.

param.name: CompressionRate
param.para: A higher compression rate results in smaller JPEG 2000 files. Use 1 for no compression. Valid values are 1 to 65535.

param.name: Jpeg2000Uri
param.para: The JPEG 2000 filename. Only file URIs are supported.

param.name: OverwriteExistingFile
param.para: If true and the JPEG 2000 file already exists, the file will be overwritten during the conversion.

summary.para: Converts an image, such as a BMP, to a GeoJP2 file that can be used as an image globe overlay. The extent of the image can be defined as an input parameter if necessary.

param.name: ImageUri
param.para: The image filename to be converted. Only file URIs are supported.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent of the image. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude. The extent can be null if the image defines the extent as with a GeoTIFF image.

param.name: CompressionProfile
param.para: The compression profile.

param.name: CompressionRate
param.para: A higher compression rate results in smaller JPEG 2000 files. Use 1 for no compression. Valid values are 1 to 65535.

param.name: Jpeg2000Uri
param.para: The JPEG 2000 filename. Only file URIs are supported.

param.name: OverwriteExistingFile
param.para: If true and the JPEG 2000 file already exists, the file will be overwritten during the conversion.

summary.para: Converts an image, such as a BMP, to a GeoJP2 file that can be used as an image globe overlay. The extent of the image can be defined as an input parameter if necessary.

param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent of the image. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude. The extent can be null if the image defines the extent as with a GeoTIFF image.

param.name: SubExtent
param.para: If a sub-extent is specified, only part of the image defined by the sub-extent is converted. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

param.para: The compression profile.

summary.para: Defines the profile used when encoding a JPEG 2000 file.
This is the default profile, which is recommended for those unfamiliar with the others.
This profile is designed for U.S. and NATO military applications.

This profile is designed for U.S. and NATO military applications. Based on NPJE, the profile is used for image exploitation, and improves image read times for lower resolutions in large images as compared to NPJE.

The Activator class provides methods to load COM plugins that implement projection and raster streaming. For more information about the projection and raster plugins, see the STK Programming Interface.
Initializes a new instance of the Activator type.

The Activator class provides methods to load COM plugins that implement projection and raster streaming. For more information about the projection and raster plugins, see the STK Programming Interface.
Loads a projection/raster COM plugin associated with the specified display name and returns a proxy object that allows accessing the raster and projection streams implemented by the plugin.

param.name: DisplayName
param.para: A valid COM display name associated with existing COM plugin.

summary.para: Gets a list of available projection/raster plugins' Display Names (Programmatic Identifiers).
A proxy class provides access to the raster and projection streams implemented by a plugin. Proxies are instantiated using Projection Raster Stream Plugin Activator.
Returns a raster stream.
Returns a projection stream.
Returns true if the raster streaming is supported.
Returns true if the projection streaming is supported.
Returns a pointer to plugin object's IUnknown interface.

A IAgStkGraphicsProjection that is updated dynamically at the specified IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.UpdateDelta. The class can be used to stream projection data to IAgStkGraphicsProjection clients, like IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay. Note to Implementers: When implementing a derived class of ProjectionStream, you must provide an implementation for the Update method.

When overridden in a derived class, updates the projection data associated with the projection stream at the specified time. When the Update method is called, the projection stream contains the current projection data. The time parameter provides the current and next IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time. Return true if the projection data was updated, otherwise return false.

param.name: Time
param.para: The current IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time.

param.name: NextTime
param.para: The next IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time.

summary.para: Gets or sets the update delta of the projection stream in seconds. The IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.UpdateDelta defines the interval at which the IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.Update method will be called. The default IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.UpdateDelta is 0, which will call the IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.Update method every time the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time changes. When animating, this means the IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.Update method would be called on every animation step.

A raster dataset. A raster consists of one or more AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand, or sets of values, which are most commonly associated with colors when the raster represents an image. For instance, a typical color image contains three sets of values, or bands (red, green, and blue) which define the color of pixels within the image. The following raster image formats can be read by the raster class: BMP, ECW, IMG, JP2, NTF, NITF, PNG, SID, TIF, TIFF, JPG, JPEG, PPM, PGM, CLDS, and TGA. To create a texture from a raster, pass it to the IAgStkGraphicsTexture2DFactory.FromRaster method.
Initializes a raster from a Uri, which can be a file, HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP source. See IAgStkGraphicsRaster for a list of supported formats.

summary.para: The attributes describing a IAgStkGraphicsRaster dataset. IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes define the memory layout of a IAgStkGraphicsRaster, and includes properties defining the order of each AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand that the raster contains, as specified by the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat. It also describes the type of data, or AgEStkGraphicsRasterType of the contained bands, the IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes.Height and IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes.Width of the raster in pixels, the IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes.RowAlignment of the raster, and other relevant properties.

A raster stream that streams from a video. The video can be read from a file, or streamed from an HTTP, RTP, UDP, or TCP source. See the Video Streams Overview for a list of supported video formats and Uri usage.
Initializes the video stream from a Uri, which can be a file, HTTP, RTP, UDP, or TCP source. See the Video Streams Overview for a list of supported video formats and Uri usage.

param.name: Uri
param.para: The Uri of the video.

summary.para: A raster stream that streams from a video. The video can be read from a file, or streamed from an HTTP, RTP, UDP, or TCP source. See the Video Streams Overview for a list of supported video formats and Uri usage.
Reinitializes the video stream from a Uri, which can be a file, HTTP, RTP, UDP, or TCP source. See the Video Streams Overview for a list of supported video formats and Uri usage.

param.name: Uri
param.para: The Uri of the video.

summary.para: Begins playing the video when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback.
Pauses the video when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback.

Stops the video when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback. Stopping the video will seek to the first frame and pause playback. Use the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Play method to begin playing the video again.
Seeks the video to its first frame and begins playing the video when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback.

member.name: M:AGI.STKGraphics.IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Close
member.summary: Closes the video stream and any associated resources.

summary.para: Gets the Uri of the video.
Gets or sets the AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback mode of the video.

Gets or sets the frame rate of the video when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback. If this property is not set, the internal framerate of the video is used.
Gets or sets the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time at which the video will begin playing when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback.
Gets or sets the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time at which the video will stop playing when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback.

Gets or sets the start time of the video in seconds. Changing the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.StartTime property also changes the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.StartFrame property to the frame in the video that corresponds to the specified time.

Gets or sets the end time of the video in seconds. Changing the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.EndTime property also changes the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.EndFrame property to the frame in the video that corresponds to the specified time.

Gets or sets the start frame of the video. Changing the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.StartFrame property also changes the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.StartTime property to the time in the video that corresponds to the specified frame.

Gets or sets the end frame of the video. Changing the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.EndFrame property also changes the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.EndTime property to the time in the video that corresponds to the specified frame.
Gets or sets whether the video will loop when it reaches its last frame when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback.

Gets whether or not the video is playing. Use the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Play, IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Pause, IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Stop, and IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Reset methods to control the playback of the video when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback.

Gets or sets the thread processing yield time for asynchronous streaming of video over common protocols like udp. Setting a high value may increase performance, but may cause frames or packets to drop, effecting visual quality. A lower value will ensure high priority processing of the stream, and thus less visual degradation, but may affect performance.

Gets or sets a value indicating the buffering limit for packets when processing a video stream. Increasing this value will provide more buffering of the video stream when frame processing cannot keep up, but has memory implications and may result in the video falling behind, or eventual visual degradation, if the frame processing load is not lessened.

Gets or sets a value indicating if frames should be dropped if video processing can not keep up with a video stream. If this is set to false, the video quality may degrade when the processing load is too high. Alternatively, when set to true, frames will be dropped, but each frame that is processed should have an improved visual quality.

Specifies how the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream will playback. When the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback, the video will playback in real time. When the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback, the video will seek to the frame that corresponds linearly to the current IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time within the interval defined by IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.IntervalStartTime and IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.IntervalEndTime. For instance, if the video contains 60 frames and the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.IntervalStartTime and IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.IntervalEndTime specify a 60 minute interval, the first frame of the video will be displayed when the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time is equal to IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.IntervalStartTime. Similarly, when IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time is equal to IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.IntervalEndTime, the last frame of the video will be displayed. Intermediate times within that interval are mapped linearly to the frames in the video.
The video will playback in realtime.

The video will playback in coincidence with the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time within the interval defined by IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.IntervalStartTime and IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.IntervalEndTime.
Renders one or more markers in the 3D scene. Markers are 2D images that always face the viewer which can be sized in pixels or meters. Markers are also referred to as sprites or billboards.
For best performance, avoid creating lots of batches with only a few markers each. See the Batching Performance Overview.

Initializes a default marker batch primitive. This is equivalent to constructing a marker batch with a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSizeSource of
FromTexture, a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSortOrder of
ByTexture, a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent, and a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchRenderingMethod of
Automatic.

Initializes a marker batch primitive with the specified setHint. This is equivalent to constructing a marker batch with a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSizeSource of
FromTexture, a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSortOrder of
ByTexture, the specified setHint, and a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchRenderingMethod of
Automatic.

Initializes a marker batch primitive with the specified sizeSource. This is equivalent to constructing a marker batch with the specified sizeSource, a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSortOrder of
ByTexture, a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent, and a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchRenderingMethod of
Automatic.

param.name: SizeSource
param.para: Determines the source used for the size of markers in the batch.

summary.para:
Initializes a marker batch primitive with the specified sizeSource and sortOrder. This is equivalent to constructing a marker batch with the specified sizeSource, the specified sortOrder, a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent, and a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchRenderingMethod of
Automatic.

Defines the positions of markers in a marker batch. The markers are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions (in the order x, y, z) for markers in the marker batch.

summary.para: Defines the positions and optional per-marker parameters of markers in a marker batch. The markers are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous markers. To update a subset of markers, use IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.SetPartial.

When a per-marker parameter is not specified in optionalParameters, its corresponding per-batch value is used. For example, if optionalParameters did not have a texture array defined with IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters.SetTextures, each marker uses the batch's IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Texture.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions (in the order x, y, z) for markers in the marker batch.

param.name: OptionalParameters
param.para: Optional per-marker parameters corresponding to positions. Each per-marker parameter must have the same number of elements as positions.

summary.para: Defines the positions and optional per-marker parameters of markers in a marker batch. The markers are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame. renderPassHint is provided for efficiency.

remarks.para:
Calling this method with a renderPassHint of
Unknown is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Set with just positions and optionalParameters. When a more specific renderPassHint is used, this method can be more efficient.
See IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: Indices
param.para: An array of integers containing the indices into positions. A set of latitude, longitude, and altitude elements is considered a single index.

summary.para: For convenience. Updates a subset of positions and/or optional per-marker parameters of markers in a marker batch using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. renderPassHint is provided for efficiency. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.SetPartial.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions used to update a subset of positions in the marker batch, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: OptionalParameters
param.para: Optional per-marker parameters corresponding to positions. Each per-marker parameter must have the same number of elements as positions.

param.name: Indices
param.para: An array of integers containing the indices into positions. A set of latitude, longitude, and altitude elements is considered a single index.

param.name: RenderPassHint
param.para: An optimization hint indicating the AgEStkGraphicsRenderPass implied by per-marker colors defined in optionalParameters.

summary.para: Determines whether or not the video card supports the marker batch primitive with the given renderingMethod.

param.name: RenderingMethod
param.para: The rendering method to check support for.

summary.para: Gets the source used for the size of markers in the batch.
Gets the order in which markers in the marker batch are sorted before rendering.
Gets the primitive's AgEStkGraphicsSetHint. See the Set Hint Performance Overview for selecting an appropriate value to construct the primitive with.
Gets the rendering method used to render the marker batch.
Gets or sets the pass during which the marker batch is rendered.
Gets or sets the scale applied to the radius of this primitive's bounding sphere.

Gets or sets a IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition that is evaluated per marker in the marker batch during rendering. This is different than IAgStkGraphicsDisplayCondition, which is evaluated once for the entire marker batch. When
DistanceDisplayConditionPerMarker is
null, no per marker display condition is evaluated.
Gets or sets the per-batch texture, which is applied to each marker in the batch.
Gets or sets the unit that each marker's size is defined in.
Gets or sets the per-batch size, which is applied to each marker in the batch. The array contains one width followed by one height.
Gets or sets the per-batch origin, which is applied to each marker in the batch.
Gets or sets the per-batch pixel offset, which is applied to each marker in the batch. The array contains one x pixel offset followed by one y pixel offset.
Gets or sets the per-batch eye offset, which is applied to each marker in the batch. The array contains the components of the eye offset in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the per-batch rotation angle, in radians, which is applied to each marker in the batch.
Gets or sets the per-batch texture coordinate, which is applied to each marker in the batch. The array contains the texture coordinates arranged in the order s, t, p, q.
Gets or sets whether the screen space position of each marker is aligned to a pixel.
Gets or sets whether the primitive is rendered in wireframe. This is useful for debugging.

Gets or sets whether individual marker indices will be included in the IAgStkGraphicsPickResult returned from the IAgStkGraphicsScene's
Pick method. Each marker index that is picked will be returned as a IAgStkGraphicsBatchPrimitiveIndex.
Gets or sets the filter used for per-marker or per-batch textures.
Determines which marker batch property is used to size each marker in a marker batch.
The size of each marker is the same as the size of its texture. If the marker is not textured, the user defined size is used instead.

The size of each marker in the marker batch is user defined. Either all markers have the same size (IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Size) or each marker has a user defined size (IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters.SetSizes).
The order in which markers in a marker batch are sorted before rendering.

The markers are sorted in back to front order before rendering. For overlapping translucent markers, this enables correct blending results. This may not perform as well as
ByTexture since the CPU has to sort the markers when the camera moves or a marker changes position.

The markers are sorted in front to back order before rendering. For overlapping opaque markers, this can enable the GPU to quickly eliminate markers that are hidden behind other markers. In many cases, this may not perform as well as
ByTexture since the CPU has to sort the markers when the camera moves or a marker changes position.
The markers are sorted by texture. This minimizes costly texture changes during rendering and does not require resorting when the camera moves or a marker changes position.
An optimization hint optionally provided to primitives to enhance performance for static or dynamic primitives. See the Set Hint Performance Overview for selecting an appropriate value.

Rendering is optimized for static geometry. The primitive's vertices are not going to be updated with Set() or SetPartial() calls. Calls to SetPartial() will fail. Calls to Set() are allowed but may not be as efficient as SetHintFrequent.
Rendering is optimized for dynamic geometry. The primitive's vertices are expected to be updated with SetPartial() - some or all of the vertices will change but the number of vertices will not.

Rendering is optimized for streaming geometry. The primitive's vertices are expected to be updated with Set() - all the vertices will change and/or the number of vertices will change. Calls to SetPartial() will fail.

Rendering methods available for use by the marker batch primitive. Different methods may have different performance characteristics and require different video card support. When in doubt, use
Automatic.
Render the marker batch using a geometry shader. Requires OpenGL 3.0 or 2.0 with the ARB_geometry_shader4 extension.

member.name: F:AGI.STKGraphics.AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchRenderingMethod.eStkGraphicsMarkerBatchRenderingMethodVertexShader
member.summary: Render the marker batch using a vertex shader. Requires OpenGL 2.0 or 1.5 with the following extensions:

summary.para: Render the marker batch using an automatically selected method based on the capabilities of the video card.
Render the marker batch using the fixed function pipeline. Generally, this is the slowest method but it supports all video cards.
The pass during which the marker batch is rendered.
The marker batch contains all opaque textures and therefore should be rendered using the AgEStkGraphicsRenderPass pass.

The marker batch contains textures with translucency and therefore should be rendered using the AgEStkGraphicsRenderPass pass. For correct blending of overlapping textures, also consider using AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSortOrder.

The marker batch render pass should be determined based on the marker batch's translucency. This includes the translucency set per marker when IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters.SetColors is used.
The unit for marker sizes in a marker batch.
The size of a marker is defined in pixels. As the camera zooms in and out the size of the marker doesn't change.
The size of a marker is defined in meters.
Vertical and horizontal origin.
The object's origin is its bottom, left corner.
The object's origin is its bottom, center point.
The object's origin is its bottom, right corner.
The object's origin is its center, left point.
The object's origin is its center.
The object's origin is its center, right point.
The object's origin is its top, left corner.
The object's origin is its top, center point.
The object's origin is its top, right corner.

Optional per-marker parameters for IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive that overrides the marker batch's per-batch parameters. Define per-marker parameters by creating an instance of
MarkerBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then calling the desired methods to define per-marker parameters, and finally passing the object to the marker batch's
Set or
SetPartial method.
Defines a collection of textures, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para: Per-marker textures override the per-batch texture. Therefore, when per-marker textures are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Texture is not used.

param.name: Textures
param.para:
An array containing a Texture 2D for each marker in the batch. There must be one texture for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of sizes, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para: To use user-defined per-marker sizes, the marker batch must be initialized with AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSizeSource, otherwise each marker's size is it's texture's size.
The size may be interpreted to be pixels or meters depending on IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.SizeUnit.
Per-marker sizes override the per-batch size. Therefore, when per-marker sizes are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Size is not used.

param.name: Sizes
param.para:
An array containing the size (in the order width, height) for each marker in the batch. There must be one width followed by one height for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of colors, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para:
If per-marker or per-batch textures are used, the texture is modulated with the per-marker color defined with
SetColors.
Per-marker colors override the per-batch color. Therefore, when per-marker colors are defined with this method, the marker batch's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Color property is ignored.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of the color for each marker in the batch. There must be one color for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method. In .NET a Color should be translated a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: Defines a collection of origins, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para: The origin defines where the marker is placed relative to its position.
Per-marker origins override the per-batch origin. Therefore, when per-marker origins are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Origin is not used.

param.name: Origins
param.para:
An array containing a AgEStkGraphicsOrigin element for each marker in the batch. There must be one origin for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of pixel offsets, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para:
The pixel offset defines a screen-space translation for a marker from its position. Positive
x values translate to the right and positive
y values translate up. This is commonly used when more than one primitive is located at the same position. For example, if a marker in a marker batch and a point in a point batch have the same position, the marker may have a pixel offset applied to it so it doesn't overlap the point.
Per-marker pixel offsets override the per-batch pixel offset. Therefore, when per-marker pixel offsets are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.PixelOffset is not used.

param.name: PixelOffsets
param.para:
An array containing a x pixel offset and a y pixel offset for each marker in the batch. There must be one x pixel offset followed by one y pixel offset for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of eye offsets, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para:
Eye offsets define an eye-space translation in meters. In eye-space, the
x axis points to the right, the
y axis points up, and the
z axis points into the screen. Eye offsets are commonly used when more than one primitive is located at the same position. For example, if a marker in a marker batch is located at the same position as a model primitive, an eye offset in the positive
y direction can be applied to the marker so it appears a specified number of meters above the model.
Per-marker eye offsets override the per-batch eye offset. Therefore, when per-marker eye offsets are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.EyeOffset is not used.

param.name: EyeOffsets
param.para:
An array containing the eye offsets (in the order x, y, z) for each marker in the batch. There must be one x eye offset, followed by one y eye offset, follow by one z eye offset for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of rotation angles in radians, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para: Positive rotation angles rotate counter-clockwise in screen-space.
Per-marker rotation angles override the per-batch rotation angle. Therefore, when per-marker rotation angles are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Rotation is not used.

param.name: RotationAngles
param.para:
An array containing a rotation angle for each marker in the batch. There must be one rotation angle for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of texture coordinates, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para:
Each texture coordinate component is in the range
[0, 1]. The
s and
t components define the bottom left corner and the
p and
q components define the upper right corner. When a marker uses an entire texture, the texture coordinates are
[s, t, p, q] = [0, 0, 1, 1].

Per-marker texture coordinates are used to implement a technique called a texture atlas. Instead of creating several small textures and assigning each texture to markers using per-marker textures, one large texture containing all the images is made. This texture is assigned to the marker batch and each marker is given texture coordinates that index the correct part of the texture. This can lead to better performance due to the reduced number of costly texture changes during rendering.

Per-marker texture coordinates override the per-batch texture coordinate. Therefore, when per-marker texture coordinates are defined with this method, the marker batch's IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.TextureCoordinate property is ignored.

param.name: TextureCoordinates
param.para:
An array containing the texture coordinates (in the order s, t, p, q) for each marker in the batch. There must be one s texture coordinate, followed by one t texture coordinate, followed by one p texture coordinate, followed by one q texture coordinate for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para:
An optimization hint optionally provided to a primitive's
Set method to enhance performance when per-position colors are used.
The collection of Color contains only opaque colors. This implies that each color's alpha component is 255.
The collection of Color contains translucent colors. This implies that at least one color has an alpha component that is not 255.
It is unknown if the collection of Color contains opaque or translucent colors.

An optimization hint optionally provided to a primitive's
SetPartial method to enhance performance.

The
indices passed to
SetPartial are not sorted. Therefore, the primitive may sort them to improve performance of writing its geometry to video memory.

The
indices passed to
SetPartial are sorted in ascending order. Therefore, the primitive does not need to sort them. It is recommended to only use
SortedAscending if it is easy and efficient for you to provide the
indices in ascending order. For example, do not use a standard sorting algorithm to sort your indices so you can use
SortedAscending. Instead use
NotSorted and let the primitive decide what is most efficient.

MarkerBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then calling the desired methods to define per-marker parameters, and finally passing the object to the marker batch's
Set or
SetPartial method.
Initializes default marker batch primitive optional parameters. All per-marker parameters are initially empty.

For convenience. Loads a COLLADA (DAE) or AGI MDL (MDL) model using a file path.

remarks.para: If the model includes articulations, they can be accessed using IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Articulations.

If the model's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.AutomaticallyComputeBoundingSphere property is
true, IAgStkGraphicsBoundingSphere is set to fit around the model. Otherwise, it is the caller's responsibility to update the model's IAgStkGraphicsBoundingSphere to a sphere that encompasses the model.
Loading a new model does not change the model's IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Position, IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Orientation, or IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Scale.

Changing the IAgStkGraphicsModelTransformation.CurrentValue property of the transformation will also change the geometry associated with its articulation. The type of transformation that will be applied is indicated by the IAgStkGraphicsModelTransformation.Type property.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive interval, in pixels, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the number of pixels the object's bounding sphere (or in the case of screen overlays, bounding rectangle) covers on the screen. This is commonly used to implement level of detail algorithms that take into account the field of view.

Initializes a default pixel size display condition. IAgStkGraphicsPixelSizeDisplayCondition.MinimumPixelSize is set to
0 and IAgStkGraphicsPixelSizeDisplayCondition.MaximumPixelSize is set to
Int32.MaxValue. With this interval, an object is always rendered regardless of how many pixels its bounding sphere or rectangle covers.

Initializes a pixel size display condition with the inclusive interval [minimumPixelSize, maximumPixelSize]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the number of pixels consumed by the object's bounding sphere, projected onto the screen, (or in the case of screen overlays, the area of its bounding rectangle) is within the interval.

param.name: MinimumPixelSize
param.para: The minimum pixel size of the inclusive interval.

param.name: MaximumPixelSize
param.para:
The maximum pixel size of the inclusive interval. Use
Int32.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum pixel size.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive interval, in pixels, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the number of pixels the object's bounding sphere (or in the case of screen overlays, bounding rectangle) covers on the screen. This is commonly used to implement level of detail algorithms that take into account the field of view.
Gets or sets the minimum pixel size of the inclusive distance interval.

Gets or sets the maximum pixel size of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Int32.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

Renders one or more points in the 3D scene. Each point in the batch has a unique position and an optional color. All points in the batch share the same pixel size. For best performance, avoid creating lots of batches with only a few points each. See the Batching Performance Overview.

Initializes a default point batch primitive. This is equivalent to constructing a point batch with a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent.
Initializes a new instance of a point batch primitive with the specified AgEStkGraphicsSetHint.
Gets the minimum pixel size supported by the video card.
Gets the maximum pixel size supported by the video card.

Renders one or more points in the 3D scene. Each point in the batch has a unique position and an optional color. All points in the batch share the same pixel size. For best performance, avoid creating lots of batches with only a few points each. See the Batching Performance Overview.
Defines the positions of points in a point batch. The points are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous positions and per-position colors. To update a subset of positions, use Set Partial.
Each point is rendered with the same color and translucency, which is defined by the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Color and IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Translucency properties.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions (in the order x, y, z) for the point batch.

summary.para: Defines the positions and colors of points in a point batch. The points are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous positions and per-position colors. To update a subset of positions and colors, use Set Partial.

Each color in colors corresponds to a position in positions with the same location. For example, the first color in colors is applied to the first position in positions. These colors override the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Color and IAgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Translucency properties. Accessing these properties will result in an Invalid Operation Exception.
To create translucent points, use the Color's alpha component. An alpha of 0 is completely transparent and an alpha of 255 is completely opaque.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions (in the order x, y, z) for the point batch.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of colors for the point batch. There must be one color for each position in positions. In .NET a Color should be translated to a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: Defines the positions and colors of points in a point batch. The points are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame. renderPassHint is provided for efficiency.

remarks.para:
Calling this method with a renderPassHint of
Unknown is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Set with just positions and colors. When a more specific renderPassHint is used, this method can be more efficient.
See IAgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions of points in a point batch using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. summary.para: Gets or sets whether an outline is rendered around each point in the batch.
Gets or sets the outline's color.

Gets or sets the translucency of the outline. Translucency is between
0 and
1, where
0 is opaque and
1 is transparent.
Gets or sets the size, in pixels, of the outline around each point in the batch.
Gets or sets the size, in pixels, of each point in the point batch.
Gets the minimum pixel size supported by the video card.
Gets the maximum pixel size supported by the video card.

Gets or sets a IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition that is evaluated per point in the point batch during rendering. This is different than IAgStkGraphicsDisplayCondition, which is evaluated once for the entire point batch. When
DistanceDisplayConditionPerPoint is
null, no per point display condition is evaluated.
Gets the primitive's AgEStkGraphicsSetHint. See the Set Hint Performance Overview for selecting an appropriate value to construct the primitive with.

Gets or sets whether individual point indices will be included in the IAgStkGraphicsPickResult returned from the IAgStkGraphicsScene's
Pick method. Each point index that is picked will be returned as a IAgStkGraphicsBatchPrimitiveIndex.
Renders a polyline in the 3D scene. Each line segment may have a different color. A polyline can be constructed with a IAgStkGraphicsPositionInterpolator to render great arcs or rhumb lines.

Initializes a default polyline primitive. This is equivalent to constructing a polyline with a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent and a AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType of
LineStrip.
Initializes a polyline primitive with the specified interpolator and setHint.

param.name: Interpolator
param.para:
The IAgStkGraphicsPositionInterpolator applied to positions passed to
Set methods.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of a polyline primitive with the specified polylineType and setHint.

param.name: PolylineType
param.para:
Describes how the polyline should interpret positions passed to
Set methods.

summary.para:
Initializes a polyline primitive with the specified interpolator. This is equivalent to constructing a polyline with the specified interpolator and a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent.

param.name: Interpolator
param.para:
The IAgStkGraphicsPositionInterpolator applied to positions passed to
Set methods.

summary.para:
Initializes a new instance of a polyline primitive with the specified AgEStkGraphicsSetHint. This is equivalent to constructing a polyline with a AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType of
LineStrip and the specified AgEStkGraphicsSetHint.

Initializes a polyline primitive with the specified polylineType. This is equivalent to constructing a polyline with the specified polylineType and a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent.

param.name: PolylineType
param.para:
Describes how the polyline should interpret positions passed to
Set methods.

summary.para: Gets the minimum width, in pixels, supported by the video card.
Gets the maximum width, in pixels, supported by the video card.
Renders a polyline in the 3D scene. Each line segment may have a different color. A polyline can be constructed with a IAgStkGraphicsPositionInterpolator to render great arcs or rhumb lines.
Defines the positions for a polyline primitive. The polyline is rendered in it's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous positions and per-position colors. To update a subset of positions, use IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.SetPartial.

If the polyline's IAgStkGraphicsPositionInterpolator is not
null, positions are interpolated before they are rendered. If the polyline's AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType is
LineStrip, for each position after the first position, a line segment is rendered that connects the position to the previous position. Otherwise, if
Lines is used, a line segment is rendered for every two positions.
Each line segment is rendered with the same color and translucency, which is defined by the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Color and IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Translucency properties.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions (in the order x, y, z) for the polyline.

summary.para: Defines the positions and colors of a polyline. The polyline is rendered in it's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous positions and per-position colors. To update a subset of positions and colors, use IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.SetPartial.

If the polyline's IAgStkGraphicsPositionInterpolator is not
null, positions are interpolated before they are rendered. If the polyline's AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType is
LineStrip, for each position after the first position, a line segment is rendered that connects the position to the previous position. Otherwise, if
Lines is used, a line segment is rendered for every two positions.

Each color in colors corresponds to a position in positions with the same location. For example, the first color in colors is applied to the first position in positions. These colors override the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Color and IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Translucency properties. Accessing these properties will result in an Invalid Operation Exception.
To create translucent line segments, use the Color's alpha component. An alpha of 0 is completely transparent and an alpha of 255 is completely opaque.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions (in the order x, y, z) for the polyline.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of colors for the polyline. There must be one color for each position in positions. The first color is ignored, each additional color defines the color of the line segment ending at that position. In .NET a Color should be translated to a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: Defines the positions and colors of a polyline. The polyline is rendered in it's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame. renderPassHint is provided for efficiency.

remarks.para:
Calling this method with a renderPassHint of
Unknown is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set with just positions and colors. When a more specific renderPassHint is used, this method can be more efficient.
See IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

The first color is ignored, each additional color defines the color of the line segment ending at that position. In .NET a Color should be translated to a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: Defines the positions of a polyline using the positions of the specified surfaceShapesResult.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to to calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set with surfaceShapesResult.Positions. See IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: SurfaceShapesResult
param.para: The surface shapes result used to define the polyline.

summary.para: Defines the positions of a polyline using the boundary positions of the specified surfaceTriangulatorResult.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to to calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set with surfaceTriangulatorResult.BoundaryPositions. See IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: SurfaceTriangulatorResult
param.para: The surface triangulator result used to define the polyline.

summary.para: Defines the positions of a polyline using the outline positions of the specified solidTriangulatorResult.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to to calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set with solidTriangulatorResult.OutlinePositions. See IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: SolidTriangulatorResult
param.para: The solid triangulator result used to define the polyline.

summary.para: Defines the positions of a polyline using a subset of input positions.

remarks.para:
When the caller has an array of positions and wants to define a polyline primitive using a continuous subset of the array, calling
SetSubset is more convenient and efficient than copying the positions into a temporary array and calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array of positions in the order x, y, z. The subset of this array defined by index and count define the new positions for the polyline.

param.name: Index
param.para: A zero-based index into positions that defines the first position copied to the polyline. Note that this index considers a set of x, y, and z coordinates as a single element.

param.name: Count
param.para: The number of elements in positions copied to the polyline. Note that is number considers a set of x, y, and z elements as a single element.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions of a polyline using a subset of input Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting the subset of positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.SetSubset.

remarks.para: See IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.SetSubset for a full discussion.

param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Count
param.para: The number of elements in positions copied to the polyline. Note that this number considers a set of latitude, longitude, and altitude as a single element.

Set methods.

0 and
1, where
