Position interpolators compute positions based on a collection of input positions. Position interpolators are used in conjunction with the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive to render things such as great arcs and rhumb lines.
Computes interpolated positions based on the input positions. Returns an array of positions in the order x, y, z.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) to use for interpolation.

summary.para: Gets the AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType of positions returned from IAgStkGraphicsPositionInterpolator.Interpolate
A IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay for handling rasters.
Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsRasterImageGlobeOverlay with the provided values.

param.name: Uri
param.para: The String that represents the Uri that points to the raster file.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent of the overlay. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

summary.para: Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsRasterImageGlobeOverlay with the provided values.

param.name: Color
param.para: The Color of the overlay.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent of the overlay. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

summary.para: Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsRasterImageGlobeOverlay with the provided values.

param.name: Raster
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsRaster of the overlay.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent of the overlay. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

summary.para: A IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay for handling rasters.
Gets or sets whether IAgStkGraphicsRasterImageGlobeOverlay.TransparentColor should be used.
Gets or sets the Color that will become transparent.

The rhumb line interpolator computes interpolated positions along a rhumb line. Rhumb lines are lines of constant bearing. They appear as straight lines on a Mercator 2D map projection and are well suited to navigation.

Initializes a default rhumb line interpolator. This is equivalent to constructing a rhumb line interpolator with a IAgStkGraphicsRhumbLineInterpolator.CentralBody equal to an instance of Earth Central Body and a IAgStkGraphicsRhumbLineInterpolator.Granularity of
1 degree.

Initializes a rhumb line interpolator with the specified centralBody and a IAgStkGraphicsRhumbLineInterpolator.Granularity of
1 degree.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body used when interpolating with Interpolate.

summary.para: Initializes a rhumb line interpolator with the specified centralBody and granularity.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body used when interpolating with Interpolate.

param.name: Granularity
param.para: The granularity, in radians, used when interpolating with Interpolate.

summary.para: The rhumb line interpolator computes interpolated positions along a rhumb line. Rhumb lines are lines of constant bearing. They appear as straight lines on a Mercator 2D map projection and are well suited to navigation.
Gets or sets the central body used when interpolating with IAgStkGraphicsRhumbLineInterpolator.Interpolate.
Gets or sets the granularity, in radians, used when interpolating with IAgStkGraphicsRhumbLineInterpolator.Interpolate. Lower granularities are more precise but create more positions.
A display condition used to control what scene or scenes an object, such as a primitive, is rendered in. This is used to show an object in some scenes and hide it in others.

Initializes a default scene display condition. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object can be restricted to only render in certain scenes. Call IAgStkGraphicsSceneDisplayCondition.SetDisplayInScene or IAgStkGraphicsSceneDisplayCondition.DisplayOnlyInScene to limit the scenes.
A display condition used to control what scene or scenes an object, such as a primitive, is rendered in. This is used to show an object in some scenes and hide it in others.
Allows or disallows rendering for in a particular scene for.

param.name: Scene
param.para: The scene to enable or disable rendering for.

param.name: On
param.para: True, if an object with this display condition should render in the given scene.

summary.para: Determines whether the display condition allows rendering rendering in the given scene.

param.name: Scene
param.para: The scene to check if rendering is enabled for.

summary.para: Allows rendering only in the given scene. The display condition will not allow rendering in other scenes, including newly created ones.

param.name: Scene
param.para: The scene to enable or disable rendering for.

summary.para: The static IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager class provides global properties and functionality that apply to all IAgStkGraphicsScene and thus affect the rendering of every globe control. It also provides a IAgStkGraphicsSceneManagerInitializer.Textures property for creating new Texture 2D, and controls the Time of all IAgStkGraphicsScene within an application. The Animation property and Set Time method can be used to control Time. The IAgStkGraphicsSceneManagerInitializer.Primitives and IAgStkGraphicsSceneManagerInitializer.ScreenOverlays properties allow you to add IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive and IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay to all IAgStkGraphicsScene. To render these objects in specific scenes, see the IAgStkGraphicsSceneDisplayCondition class. To render all IAgStkGraphicsScene within an application, call the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManagerInitializer.Render method.
Renders all IAgStkGraphicsScene within an application. To render a specific IAgStkGraphicsScene, use the IAgStkGraphicsScene.Render method.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsPrimitiveManager, which is used to add IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive to your IAgStkGraphicsScene.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayManager, which is used to add IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay to your IAgStkGraphicsScene.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsTexture2DFactory, which can be used to create Texture 2D from various sources.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlaySettings, which are used to set global settings for all IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay.
Gets a read-only collection of IAgStkGraphicsScene that are associated with the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.
The primitive manager contains spatial data structures used to efficiently render primitives. Once a primitive is constructed, it must be added to the primitive manager before it will be rendered.
Adds a primitive to the manager. Primitives must be added to the manager to be rendered.

remarks.para: When a primitive is added to the manager, the scene is not automatically re-rendered, so the primitive doesn't immediately show up. The scene can be rendered explicitly using IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Render or IAgStkGraphicsScene.Render. For best performance, add several primitives to the manager before re-rendering.

When a primitive is added to the manager, it appears in all scenes by default. To limit the number of scenes, assign a IAgStkGraphicsSceneDisplayCondition to the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.DisplayCondition.

param.name: Primitive
param.para: The primitive to add to the manager.

summary.para: Removes a primitive from the manager. The primitive is no longer rendered unless it is added back into the manager.

remarks.para: If primitive does not exist in the manager, this call is ignored.

param.name: Primitive
param.para: The primitive to remove from the manager.

summary.para: Determines whether the manager contains a primitive.

param.name: Primitive
param.para: The primitive to locate in the manager.

summary.para: Removes all primitives from the manager.
Gets the number of primitives in the manager.

Gets or sets the exponent used to compute the maximum precision for primitive rendering. For example, a value of -3 indicates the maximum precision of 2^-3, 0.125 m along the x, y, or z axis. The worst case precision, taking into account all axes, is sqrt(3 * (2^-3)^2), 0.2165 m. The default is -2.

Gets or sets the sort order for translucent primitives in the primitive manager. This determines a trade-off between rendering speed and quality. It is only recommended to use AgEStkGraphicsPrimitivesSortOrder when translucent primitives along the same line of sight cause blending artifacts.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.IAgStkGraphicsPrimitiveManager._NewEnum
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection. The order of the primitives is not guaranteed to be the order that the primitives were added.

summary.para: The top-level container for screen overlays. All child IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay that are added to this container are specified relative to the overall globe control.
Gets the overall bounds of the globe control. The array contains the properties defining the bounds in the order left x location, top y location, width, height.
Gets the collection of overlays that are contained within this manager.

Gets or sets the padding surrounding the IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayManager.Overlays that are contained within this manager. The array contains the components of the padding arranged in the order left, top, right, bottom.
Gets or sets if the collection of overlays that are contained within this manager should be rendered.
A factory for creating Texture 2D objects from various sources.
Creates a new texture from a Uri, which can be a file, HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP source. See IAgStkGraphicsRaster for a list of supported raster formats.

param.name: Uri
param.para: The Uri of the raster to create the texture from.

summary.para: Creates a new texture from a IAgStkGraphicsRaster.

param.name: Raster
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsRaster to create the texture from.

summary.para: Settings used by IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay objects. These setting affect all scenes.
Gets or sets the size of the terrain cache in megabytes. It is not recommended to go above 128 megabytes. Large cache sizes can slow down rendering since so much imagery will be rendered.
Gets or sets the size of the imagery cache in megabytes. It is not recommended to go above 128 megabytes. Large cache sizes can slow down rendering since so much imagery will be rendered.

Gets or sets whether per-pixel lighting is used for terrain and imagery. When set to true, per-pixel lighting is used for the best visual quality; when set to false, per vertex-lighting is used, which may provide better performance on older GPUs, but worse visual quality. The default value is true.

Gets or sets whether terrain and imagery are preloaded. When set to true, terrain and imagery are preloaded to get the best visual quality; when set to false, they are not preloaded. For example, the correct resolution globe may not fully load until you stop moving the cursor, but you will be able to move more smoothly around the 3D graphics window.
A visible element drawn in screen space. Overlays are useful for floating logos, heads up displays, and integrating user interfaces into the 3D window.
Initializes the overlay with the specified x position, y position, width, and height, all specified in pixels.

param.name: XPixels
param.para: The X position of the panel in pixels.

param.name: YPixels
param.para: The Y position of the panel in pixels.

param.name: WidthPixels
param.para: The width of the panel in pixels.

param.name: HeightPixels
param.para: The height of the panel in pixels.

summary.para: Initializes the overlay with the specified position and size.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array with a size of 4 that represents the position of the overlay. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

param.name: Size
param.para: An array with a size of 4 that represents the size of the overlay. The elements are in the order width, height, width AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, height AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

summary.para: Renders filled solid objects and their outlines. Example solids include boxes and ellipsoids. Various effects are supported, such as displaying the solid's silhouette, and hidding the outline of the backside of the solid. In cases where you just want to visualize a solid's fill or outline, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used for reduced overhead.

Initializes a default solid primitive. This is equivalent to constructing a solid primitive with a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent.
Initializes a solid primitive with the specified setHint.
Gets the minimum silhouette width, in pixels, supported by the video card.
Gets the maximum silhouette width, in pixels, supported by the video card.

Renders filled solid objects and their outlines. Example solids include boxes and ellipsoids. Various effects are supported, such as displaying the solid's silhouette, and hidding the outline of the backside of the solid. In cases where you just want to visualize a solid's fill or outline, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used for reduced overhead.
Defines the solid using the specified solidTriangulatorResult. The solid is rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

param.name: SolidTriangulatorResult
param.para: The triangulator used to define the solid.

summary.para: Defines the solid using the specified parameters. The solid is rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the positions of the solid in the order x, y, z.

param.name: Normals
param.para: An array containing the normals of the mesh in the order x, y, z.

param.name: Indices
param.para: An array of integers containing the indices into positions and normals. A set of x, y, and z elements is considered a single index.

param.name: OutlineIndices
param.para: An array of integers containing the indices into positions that define an outline of the solid. A set of x, y, and z elements is considered a single index.

param.name: WindingOrder
param.para: The orientation of front-facing triangles.

param.name: BoundingSphere
param.para: The bounding sphere that encompasses the solid.

param.name: Closed
param.para: Indicates if the solid is closed. For example, a box with six faces is closed. If one face is removed, the box is open.

summary.para: Gets or sets whether the primitive is affected by lighting.
Gets or sets whether the solid's fill is displayed.
Gets or sets whether the solid's silhouette is displayed.
Gets or sets the silhouette's color.

Gets or sets the silhouette's translucency. Translucency is between
0 and
1, where
0 is opaque and
1 is transparent.
Gets or sets the silhouette' width, in pixels.
Gets the minimum silhouette width, in pixels, supported by the video card.
Gets the maximum silhouette width, in pixels, supported by the video card.
Gets or sets whether the solid's outline is displayed.
Gets or sets the outline's color.

Gets or sets the outline's translucency. Translucency is between
0 and
1, where
0 is opaque and
1 is transparent.
Gets or sets the outline's width, in pixels.
Gets or sets the outline's appearance.
Gets or sets the back line's color.

Gets or sets the back line's translucency. Translucency is between
0 and
1, where
0 is opaque and
1 is transparent.
Gets or sets the solid's position. The position is defined in the solid's Reference Frame. The array contains the components of the position in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the rotation applied to the solid before rendering.

Gets or sets a non-uniform scale that is applied to the solid to increase or decrease its rendered size. The array contains the scale for each component of the size in the order x scale, y scale, z scale.
Gets or sets the back line's width, in pixels.
Gets the primitive's AgEStkGraphicsSetHint. See the Set Hint Performance Overview for selecting an appropriate value to construct the primitive with.
Possible appearances of an outline. Front lines are lines on front facing geometry and back lines are lines on back facing geometry.
Both the front and back lines are displayed.
Only the front lines are displayed. This can be used to declutter the outline.

Both the front and back lines are displayed. The back lines are displayed using a different color, translucency, and width. This is used to declutter the outline but still provide a visual cue for the back facing geometry.
A triangle mesh primitive for meshes on the surface that need to conform to terrain.

Frequent and a AgEStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshRenderingMethod of
Automatic.

Automatic.

summary.para: Defines the surface mesh using the specified surfaceTriangulator. The mesh is rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para:
Calling this method is more efficient than calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive.Set but the surface mesh will not render textures when this is used instead of IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive.Set. Therefore, only use
SetWithoutTexturing when the surface mesh's IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive.Texture will only ever be
null.

param.name: SurfaceTriangulator

Gets or sets whether the primitive is rendered in wireframe. This is useful for debugging.

Gets the rendering method used to render the mesh.
Gets or sets the filter used when a IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive.Texture is applied to this primitive.
Gets or sets the matrix used to transform texture coordinates when a IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive.Texture is applied to this primitive.

Gets or set the boolean that defines if the color obtained from texture coordinates beyond the texture border should be considered transparent or not. This is typically used in conjunction with the a IAgStkGraphicsTextureMatrix.

Rendering methods available for use by the surface mesh primitive. Different methods may have different performance characteristics and require different video card support. When in doubt, use
Automatic.
Render the surface mesh using a geometry shader. Requires OpenGL 3.0 or 2.0 with the ARB_geometry_shader4 extension.

Unknown is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive.Set with just positions, text, and optionalParameters. When a more specific renderPassHint is used, this method can be more efficient.

null, no per string display condition is evaluated.

Gets or sets whether individual text indices will be included in the IAgStkGraphicsPickResult returned from the IAgStkGraphicsScene's
Pick method. Each text index that is picked will be returned as a IAgStkGraphicsBatchPrimitiveIndex.
Gets or sets the filter used to filter the texture-based IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive.Font.

Optional per-string and per-batch parameters for IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive. To use optional parameters, create an instance of
TextBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then call the desired methods or properties to define per-string and per-batch parameters, and finally pass the object to the text batch's
Set or
SetPartial method.
Defines a collection of origins, one for each string in the batch.

remarks.para: The origin defines where the string is placed relative to its position.
Per-string origins override the per-batch origin. Therefore, when per-string origins are defined with this method, AgEStkGraphicsOrigin is ignored.

param.name: Origins
param.para:
An array containing a AgEStkGraphicsOrigin for each string in the batch. There must be one origin for each string passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of eye offsets, one for each string in the batch.

remarks.para:
Eye offsets define an eye-space translation in meters. In eye-space, the
x axis points to the right, the
y axis points up, and the
z axis points into the screen. Eye offsets are commonly used when more than one primitive is located at the same position. For example, if a string in a text batch is located at the same position as a model primitive, an eye offset in the positive
y direction can be applied to the string so it appears a specified number of meters above the model.
Per-string eye offsets override the per-batch eye offset. Therefore, when per-string eye offsets are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters.EyeOffset is ignored.

param.name: EyeOffsets
param.para:
An array containing the x, y, and z eye offset for each string in the batch. There must be one x eye offset, followed by one y eye offset, followed by one z eye offset for each string passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of pixel offsets, one for each string in the batch.

remarks.para:
The pixel offset defines a screen-space translation for a string from its position. Positive
x values translate to the right and positive
y values translate up. This is commonly used when more than one primitive is located at the same position. For example, if a string in a text batch and a point in a point batch have the same position, the string may have a pixel offset applied to it so it doesn't overlap the point.

Per-string pixel offsets override the per-batch pixel offset. Therefore, when per-string pixel offsets are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters.PixelOffset is ignored.

param.name: PixelOffsets
param.para:
An array containing a X and Y pixel offset for each string in the batch. There must be one X pixel offset followed by one Y pixel offset for each string passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of colors, one for each string in the batch.

remarks.para: Per-string colors override the per-batch color. Therefore, when per-string colors are defined with this method, the text batch's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Color property is ignored.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of a color for each string in the batch. There must be one color for each string passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method. In .NET a Color should be translated a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: Gets or sets the per-batch origin, which is applied to each string in the text batch.
Gets or sets the per-batch eye offset, which is applied to each string in the text batch. The array contains the components of the offset arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the per-batch pixel offset, which is applied to each string in the text batch. The array contains one x pixel offset followed by one y pixel offset.
Gets or sets the maximum length of each string in the text batch.

Optional per-string and per-batch parameters for IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive. To use optional parameters, create an instance of
TextBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then call the desired methods or properties to define per-string and per-batch parameters, and finally pass the object to the text batch's
Set or
SetPartial method.
Initializes default text batch primitive optional parameters.
A 4 by 4 matrix applied to a texture coordinate.
Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsTextureMatrix to the identity matrix.
Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsTextureMatrix. The subscripts define [row][column].
Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsTextureMatrix from a Matrix. The upper left 2x2 matrix defines rotation and scaling. The top two elements of the last column define translation.

param.name: Matrix
param.para: An array representing the matrix of the texture. The elements should be provided row by row, from left to right.

summary.para: Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsTextureMatrix from texture corner points. Normally, a texture is mapped such that the lower left corner is texture coordinate (0, 0), the lower right is (1, 0), the upper right is (1, 1), and the upper left is (0, 1). This code remaps those corners to new corners. For example, remapping the lower left corner to (0.5, 0), the lower right to (1, 0.5), the upper right to (0.5, 1), and the upper left to (0, 0.5) would rotate the texture 45 degress.

param.name: Corner0
param.para: An array containing the new location of the texture's lower left corner in the order x, y.

param.name: Corner1
param.para: An array containing the new location of the texture's lower right corner in the order x, y.

param.name: Corner2
param.para: An array containing the new location of the texture's upper right corner in the order x, y.

param.name: Corner3
param.para: An array containing the new location of the texture's upper left corner in the order x, y.

summary.para: A rectangular overlay that can be assigned a texture.
Initializes the overlay with a position of (0, 0), a width of 100 pixels, and a height of 50 pixels.
Initializes the overlay with the specified x position, y position, width, and height, all specified in pixels.

param.name: XPixels
param.para: The X position of the panel in pixels.

param.name: YPixels
param.para: The Y position of the panel in pixels.

param.name: WidthPixels
param.para: The width of the panel in pixels.

param.name: HeightPixels
param.para: The height of the panel in pixels.

summary.para: Initializes the overlay with the specified position and size.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array with a size of 4 that represents the position of the overlay. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

param.name: Size
param.para: An array with a size of 4 that represents the size of the overlay. The elements are in the order width, height, width AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, height AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

summary.para: Initializes the overlay with a specified background texture. The size of the overlay will be the same as the size of the texture.

param.name: XPixels
param.para: The X position of the panel in pixels.

param.name: YPixels
param.para: The Y position of the panel in pixels.

param.name: Texture
param.para: The texture (image) to be drawn on the overlay. Textures can be obtained from IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Textures.

summary.para: Initializes the overlay with a specified background texture. The size of the overlay will be the same as the size of the texture.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array with a size of 4 that represents the position of the overlay. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

param.name: Texture
param.para: The texture (image) to be drawn on the overlay. Textures can be obtained from IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Textures.

summary.para: A rectangular overlay that can be assigned a texture.
Gets or sets the texture (image) to be drawn on the overlay. Textures can be obtained from IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Textures.
Gets or sets the filter used for the IAgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.Texture associated with this overlay.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the aspect ratio of the texture screen overlay is maintained or not.
Specifies whether the aspect ratio of a texture will be maintained during sizing of a screen overlay.
The aspect ratio of the texture is not maintained during sizing of the screen overlay.

The aspect ratio of the texture is maintained based on the IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Width property of the screen overlay. When used, the IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Height property is ignored and the height is automatically calculated based on the aspect ratio of the texture and the overlay's IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Width property.

The aspect ratio of the texture is maintained based on the IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Height property of the screen overlay. When used, the IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Width property is ignored and the width is automatically calculated based on the aspect ratio of the texture and the overlay's IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Height property.
Defines an inclusive time interval that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the current animation time .

Initializes a default time display condition. IAgStkGraphicsTimeIntervalDisplayCondition.MinimumTime is set to
JulianDate.MinValue and IAgStkGraphicsTimeIntervalDisplayCondition.MaximumTime is set to
JulianDate.MaxValue. With this interval, an object is always rendered regardless of the current animation time.

Initializes a time display condition with the inclusive time interval [minimumTime, maximumTime]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the current animation time, Time, is within the interval.

param.name: MinimumTime
param.para: The minimum time of the inclusive time interval.

param.name: MaximumTime
param.para: The maximum distance of the inclusive time interval.

summary.para: Initializes a time display condition with a Time Interval.

param.name: TimeInterval
param.para: An array containing the time interval to assign to the display condition, in the order start time, stop time.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive time interval that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the current animation time .
Gets or sets the minimum time of the inclusive time interval.
Gets or sets the maximum time of the inclusive time interval.
Renders a triangle mesh in the 3D scene. Examples of triangle meshes includes polygons on the globe (e.g. states or countries), terrain and imagery extents, ellipses, and extrusions.

Initializes a default triangle mesh primitive. This is equivalent to constructing a triangle mesh with a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent.
Initializes a triangle mesh primitive with the specified setHint .
Renders a triangle mesh in the 3D scene. Examples of triangle meshes includes polygons on the globe (e.g. states or countries), terrain and imagery extents, ellipses, and extrusions.
Defines the triangle mesh using an indexed triangle list specified by positions, normals, and indices. The mesh is rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) for the triangle mesh.

param.name: Normals
param.para: An array containing the normals (in the order x, y, z) used for lighting the triangle mesh. There must be one normal for each position in positions.

param.name: Indices
param.para: An array of integers containing the indices into positions and normals. A set of x, y, and z elements is considered a single index. Every 3 indices represent 1 triangle.

summary.para: Defines the triangle mesh using an indexed triangle list specified by positions, normals, indices, and optionalParameters. The mesh is rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: See IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitiveOptionalParameters for details on how to define parameters.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) for the triangle mesh.

param.name: Normals
param.para: An array containing the normals (in the order x, y, z) used for lighting the triangle mesh. There must be one normal for each position in positions.

param.name: Indices
param.para: An array of integers containing the indices into positions and normals. A set of x, y, and z elements is considered a single index. Every 3 indices represent 1 triangle.

param.name: OptionalParameters
param.para: Optional parameters corresponding to positions.

summary.para: Defines the triangle mesh using the specified triangulator. The mesh is rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

param.name: Triangulator
param.para: The triangulator used to define the triangle mesh.

summary.para: Gets or sets whether the primitive is rendered in wireframe. This is useful for debugging.
Gets or sets whether the primitive is rendered in two passes to improve the visual quality for translucent, convex meshes.
Gets or sets whether the primitive is lit.
Gets or sets the orientation of front-facing triangles. This is used in combination with AgEStkGraphicsCullFace for culling.
Gets or sets whether front and/or back-facing triangles may be culled. This is used in combination with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.TriangleWindingOrder for culling.
Gets or sets the shading model for the mesh.
Gets or sets the texture to be drawn on the triangle mesh. Textures can be obtained from IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Textures.
Gets or sets the filter used for the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.Texture associated with this triangle mesh.
Gets the primitive's AgEStkGraphicsSetHint. See the Set Hint Performance Overview for selecting an appropriate value to construct the primitive with.
Identifies whether front- and/or back-facing triangles are culled.
Front-facing triangles are culled.
Back-facing triangles are culled.
Both front- and back-facing triangles are culled. Therefore, no triangles are rendered.
No triangles are culled.
Identifies which shade model to use. The primitive can be drawn with a single color or multiple colors.
Flat shading renders the primitive with one color across all of the vertices.
Gouraud shading renders the primitive by interpolating the color between the vertices.

Optional parameters for IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive. To use optional parameters, create an instance of
TriangleMeshPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then call the desired methods or properties to define the parameters, and finally pass the object to the triangle mesh's
Set method.
Defines a collection of texture coordinates.

param.name: TextureCoordinates
param.para:
An array containing the texture coordinates (in the order x, y) for the mesh. There must be one texture coordinate for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive's
Set method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of colors.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of colors for each vertex in the mesh. There must be one color for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive's
Set method. In .NET a Color should be translated to a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: The result from triangulation: a triangle mesh defined using an indexed triangle list. This is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive.
Gets the positions of the mesh. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.

Gets the normals of the mesh. Every position in IAgStkGraphicsTriangulatorResult.Positions has corresponding normal. Normals are commonly used for lighting. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one normal.

Gets indices into IAgStkGraphicsTriangulatorResult.Positions and IAgStkGraphicsTriangulatorResult.Normals. Every
3 indices represent
1 triangle. The indices returned consider the three components of a position or normal (x, y, and z) as a single array element. Multiply the index by 3 to get the location of the x component in IAgStkGraphicsTriangulatorResult.Positions or IAgStkGraphicsTriangulatorResult.Normals.
Gets the orientation of front-facing triangles in the mesh.
Gets the bounding sphere that encompasses the mesh.

Optional parameters for IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive. To use optional parameters, create an instance of
TriangleMeshPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then call the desired methods or properties to define the parameters, and finally pass the object to the triangle mesh's
Set method.
Initializes default triangle mesh primitive optional parameters.

The result from extruded polyline triangulation: a triangle mesh defined using an indexed triangle list with top and bottom boundary positions. The mesh is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive. The boundaries are commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.

Gets the winding order of IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResult.TopBoundaryPositions and IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResult.BottomBoundaryPositions.

The result from a triangulation of a solid: a triangle mesh defined using an indexed triangle list and positions outlining the solid. It is recommended to visualize the solid using a IAgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive. Although, if only the fill is desired for visualization, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.RenderBackThenFrontFaces set to
true can be used. Likewise, if only the outline is desired, a IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used.

Gets the positions outlining the solid. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.
Gets the AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType of IAgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResult.OutlineIndices and IAgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResult.OutlinePositions.
Gets whether the solid is closed. For example, a box with six faces is closed. If one face is removed, the box is open.
Represents the boundary positions of a shape on the surface computed from by a IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceShapesInitializer method.
Gets the positions of the computed shape. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.
Gets the winding order of IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceShapesResult.Positions.
Gets the AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType of IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceShapesResult.Positions.

The result from a triangulation on the surface of a central body: a triangle mesh defined using an indexed triangle list and boundary positions surrounding the mesh. The mesh is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive. The boundary are commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceTriangulatorResult.Positions
member.summary: Gets the positions of the mesh. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceTriangulatorResult.Normals
member.summary: Gets the normals of the mesh. Every position in positions has corresponding normal. Normals are commonly used for lighting. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one normal.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceTriangulatorResult.Indices
member.summary: Gets indices into positions and normals. Every 3 indices represent 1 triangle. The indices returned consider the three components of a position or normal (x, y, and z) as a single array element...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceTriangulatorResult.TriangleWindingOrder
member.summary: Gets the orientation of front-facing triangles in the mesh.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceTriangulatorResult.BoundingSphere
member.summary: Gets the bounding sphere that encompasses the mesh.

summary.para: Gets the granularity, in radians, used when the triangulation was computed. Lower granularities are more precise but create more triangles.

Gets indices into Positions that define the boundary positions that surround the mesh. The indices returned consider the three components of a position (x, y, and z) as a single array element. Multiply the index by 3 to get the location of the x component in Positions.
Gets the boundary positions that surround the mesh. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.
Gets the winding order of IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceTriangulatorResult.BoundaryPositions.
Gets the AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType of IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceTriangulatorResult.BoundaryPositions.
The result from triangulation: a triangle mesh defined using an indexed triangle list. This is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive.
Gets the positions of the mesh. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.

Gets the normals of the mesh. Every position in IAgStkGraphicsTriangulatorResult.Positions has corresponding normal. Normals are commonly used for lighting. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one normal.

Gets indices into IAgStkGraphicsTriangulatorResult.Positions and IAgStkGraphicsTriangulatorResult.Normals. Every
3 indices represent
1 triangle. The indices returned consider the three components of a position or normal (x, y, and z) as a single array element. Multiply the index by 3 to get the location of the x component in IAgStkGraphicsTriangulatorResult.Positions or IAgStkGraphicsTriangulatorResult.Normals.
Gets the orientation of front-facing triangles in the mesh.
Gets the bounding sphere that encompasses the mesh.

summary.para: Takes snapshots of the 3D window.
Saves a snapshot of the 3D window to the filename with the specified format.

param.name: Filename
param.para: The filename of the snapshot.

param.name: CameraSnapshotFormat
param.para: The file format of the snapshot

summary.para: Saves a snapshot of the 3D window to the filename with the specified format at high resolution. Generally, this is used to take snapshots for print media, such as posters, which is why the input parameters are in terms of inches and dots per inch typically required by printers.

param.name: Filename
param.para: The filename of the snapshot.

param.name: CameraSnapshotFormat
param.para: The file format of the snapshot

param.name: WidthInInches
param.para: The desired width of the snapshot in inches.

param.name: DotsPerInch
param.para: The number of pixels per inch.

summary.para: Saves a single frame of the 3D window to the clipboard.
Saves a snapshot of the 3D window to a IAgStkGraphicsRaster.
Saves a snapshot of the 3D window to a Texture 2D.
Records the 3D window to either a movie file or to consecutively ordered image files each time the IAgStkGraphicsScene is rendered.
Starts recording a file in the WMV format at the specified bit and frame rate.

param.name: WmvFilename
param.para: The filename of the WMV file.

param.name: VideoBitRate
param.para: A higher value will create larger files with better visual quality than a lower value that will create smaller files with poorer visual quality. A value of 5000 is a good starting point to judge the file size to visual quality trade-off.

param.name: VideoFrameRate
param.para: The frame rate of the video in frames per second. A value of 30 is typical.

summary.para: Starts recording a frame stack. Each frame is saved as a separate image file. The filename of each frame is defined by a prefix followed by a frame number.

param.name: FileDirectory
param.para: The directory in which each frame will be saved.

param.name: FilePrefix
param.para: Used to create the filename of each saved frame.

param.name: CameraSnapshotFileFormat
param.para: The file format of each saved frame.

param.name: StartingFrameNumber
param.para: The number of the first frame

param.name: NumberOfFrameDigits
param.para: The maximum number of digits available for defining the frame number

summary.para: Stops recording.
Gets if recording is occurring or not.

The Activator class provides methods to load COM plugins that implement custom image globe overlays. For more information about custom image globe overlays, see the STK Programming Interface.

Returns a pointer to plugin object's IUnknown interface.

The base class of all IAgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay objects.
Gets the Central Body that the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay is displayed on. It will return null if the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay hasn't been added to a Central Body.

Gets the Cartographic Extent that represents the area covered by the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay. The array elements are arranged in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.
Gets the AgEStkGraphicsGlobeOverlayRole of the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay.
Gets the absolute URI specifying the location of the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay.
Gets whether or not the overlay is valid. It can be invalid because of a missing file, corrupt file, unlicensed file, or a file on the incorrect Central Body.
Gets or sets the IAgStkGraphicsDisplayCondition that controls whether or not the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay is displayed.
Settings used by IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay objects. These setting affect all scenes.
Gets or sets the size of the terrain cache in megabytes. It is not recommended to go above 128 megabytes. Large cache sizes can slow down rendering since so much imagery will be rendered.
Gets or sets the size of the imagery cache in megabytes. It is not recommended to go above 128 megabytes. Large cache sizes can slow down rendering since so much imagery will be rendered.

Gets or sets whether per-pixel lighting is used for terrain and imagery. When set to true, per-pixel lighting is used for the best visual quality; when set to false, per vertex-lighting is used, which may provide better performance on older GPUs, but worse visual quality. The default value is true.

Gets or sets whether terrain and imagery are preloaded. When set to true, terrain and imagery are preloaded to get the best visual quality; when set to false, they are not preloaded. For example, the correct resolution globe may not fully load until you stop moving the cursor, but you will be able to move more smoothly around the 3D graphics window.
Lighting in the 3D scene.
Gets or sets whether or not lighting is enabled.
Gets or sets the ambient intensity throughout the scene.
Gets or sets the diffuse intensity from the sun.
Gets or sets the overall brightness for the night light's image overlay, IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.NightOverlay.
A class that encapsulates the update logic for a IAgStkGraphicsPathPrimitive. Derived classes must implement the IAgStkGraphicsPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.Update method.
Updates the pathPrimitive at the specified date.

param.name: PathPrimitive
param.para: The primitive to be updated.

param.name: Date
param.para: The time this method is called by the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.

summary.para: A IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay which IAgStkGraphicsProjection a IAgStkGraphicsRaster onto the IAgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay or surface of the Central Body. You can also enable projection onto IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive by setting IAgStkGraphicsSceneGlobeOverlaySettings.ProjectedRasterModelProjection to true for a Scene. The IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay can also be used with IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream and IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream to stream IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream and other raster data to a IAgStkGraphicsProjection that moves with time.

member.summary: Gets the central body that the globe overlay is displayed on. It will return <see langword='null' /> if the globe overlay hasn't been added to a central body.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.Extent
member.summary: Gets the cartographic extent that represents the area covered by the globe overlay. The array elements are arranged in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.Role
member.summary: Gets the globe overlay role of the globe overlay.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.UriAsString
member.summary: Gets the absolute URI specifying the location of the globe overlay.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.IsValid
member.summary: Gets whether or not the overlay is valid. It can be invalid because of a missing file, corrupt file, unlicensed file, or a file on the incorrect central body.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.DisplayCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets the display condition that controls whether or not the globe overlay is displayed.

summary.para: Gets or sets the IAgStkGraphicsRaster that is IAgStkGraphicsProjection
Gets or sets the IAgStkGraphicsProjection that projects the IAgStkGraphicsRaster

Gets or sets whether to show shadows or not. When set to true, the IAgStkGraphicsRaster will only be projected onto parts of the terrain visible from the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's position. When false, the IAgStkGraphicsRaster will project onto any terrain inside the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's view frustum. Shadows are more realistic, but are slower to render.
Gets or sets whether to show the frustum of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.
Gets or sets whether to show the far plane of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection. If this is set to true, you will see the projected IAgStkGraphicsRaster even when it does not intersect terrain.
Gets or sets the color of the projected IAgStkGraphicsRaster.
Gets or sets the color of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's frustum.
Gets or sets the color of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's far plane.
Gets or sets the color of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's shadow.
Gets or sets the color of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's border.
Gets or sets the width of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's border.
Gets or sets the translucency of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's frustum.
Gets or sets the translucency of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's far plane.
Gets or sets the translucency of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's shadow.
Gets or sets the translucency of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's border.
Gets or sets whether IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.TransparentColor should be used.
Gets or sets the Color that will become transparent.

Gets the direction vectors in the central body's fixed reference frame that define the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's frustum. The collection contains the direction vector down the center of the projection, and the bottom left, bottom right, upper right, and upper left corner direction vectors, in that order. If no direction can be calculated, Cartesian.Zero is returned. Each vector is represented in the array as its individual components in the order x, y, z.
Gets whether or not the video card supports the IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.

A IAgStkGraphicsProjection represents a simplified camera with a IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Position, IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Orientation, and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewHorizontal and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewVertical. Unlike a real world camera, IAgStkGraphicsProjection has a nearest and farthest viewing distance, as defined by the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.NearPlane and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FarPlane properties. For example, IAgStkGraphicsProjection can be used to represent a UAV's camera, to allow for projecting video onto terrain. See the Raster and Projection Streams Overview for such an example.

Gets or sets the Cartesian defining the position of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection in the central body's fixed reference frame. The array contains the components of the position arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the Unit Quaternion defining the orientation of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection in the central body's fixed reference frame.
Gets or sets the horizontal field of view associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.
Gets or sets the vertical field of view associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.
Gets or sets the near plane associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.
Gets or sets the far plane associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

A IAgStkGraphicsProjection that is updated dynamically at the specified IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.UpdateDelta. The class can be used to stream projection data to IAgStkGraphicsProjection clients, like IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay. Note to Implementers: When implementing a derived class of ProjectionStream, you must provide an implementation for the Update method.

When overridden in a derived class, updates the projection data associated with the projection stream at the specified time. When the Update method is called, the projection stream contains the current projection data. The time parameter provides the current and next IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time. Return true if the projection data was updated, otherwise return false.

param.name: Time
param.para: The current IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time.

param.name: NextTime
param.para: The next IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the cartesian defining the position of the projection in the central body's fixed reference frame. The array contains the components of the position arranged in the order x, y, z.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit quaternion defining the orientation of the projection in the central body's fixed reference frame.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.FieldOfViewHorizontal
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal field of view associated with the projection.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.FieldOfViewVertical
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical field of view associated with the projection.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.NearPlane
member.summary: Gets or sets the near plane associated with the projection.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.FarPlane
member.summary: Gets or sets the far plane associated with the projection.

summary.para: Gets or sets the update delta of the projection stream in seconds. The IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.UpdateDelta defines the interval at which the IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.Update method will be called. The default IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.UpdateDelta is 0, which will call the IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.Update method every time the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time changes. When animating, this means the IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.Update method would be called on every animation step.
Settings used by IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay objects. These settings only affect the scene.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not imagery is anti-aliased.
Gets or sets the pixel error for terrain meshes. This is the number of pixels that the rendered terrain is different from the actual terrain data. The default is 2.0 pixels.
Gets or sets the pixel error for imagery. This is the number of pixels that the rendered imagery is different from the actual imagery data. The default is 1.0 pixel.
Gets or sets whether Projected Raster Globe Overlay will also project onto IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.

summary.para: A factory for creating Texture 2D objects from various sources.
Creates a new texture from a Uri, which can be a file, HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP source. See IAgStkGraphicsRaster for a list of supported raster formats.

param.name: Uri
param.para: The Uri of the raster to create the texture from.

summary.para: Creates a new texture from a IAgStkGraphicsRaster.

param.name: Raster
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsRaster to create the texture from.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive altitude interval, in meters, that determines when an object is rendered based on the camera's altitude relative to a Central Body.

Gets or sets the minimum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MinValue to ignore checking the minimum altitude.

Gets or sets the maximum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum altitude.
Gets or sets the Central Body to which the altitude is relative.
Implemented by the scene camera. Contains operations to manipulate the camera position, view direction and orientation in the scene.
Gets the visibility of a sphere against the view frustum and any occluding central bodies.

param.name: ReferenceFrame
param.para: The Reference Frame that sphere is in.

param.name: Sphere
param.para: The bounding sphere to be tested.

summary.para: Converts a Cartographic position to a pixel coordinate relative to the globe control. This method can throw an exception. Returns an array containing the pixel coordinate (in the order x, y) of the Cartographic position relative to the globe control. The coordinate can be fractional.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the Cartographic position to convert, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para: Converts a Cartographic position to a pixel coordinate relative to the globe control. This method does not throw an exception.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the Cartographic position to convert, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para: Converts a pixel coordinate relative to the globe control to a Cartographic position. For speed, terrain is not considered; if the pixel coordinate does not intersect the ellipsoid, an exception is thrown. Returns the Cartographic position. The array contains the elements of the position in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the pixel coordinate (in the order x, y) to convert.

summary.para: Converts a pixel coordinate relative to the globe control to a Cartographic position. For speed, terrain is not considered. This method does not throw an exception.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the pixel coordinate (in the order x, y) to convert.

summary.para: Zoom to a central body and use the specified axes for rotation. The reference point is set to the center of the central body and the camera's position is set so the entire central body is visible.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body to be viewed.

param.name: Axes
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes of rotation. IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes will be set to this.

summary.para: Zooms to a Cartographic Extent on the centralBody. The camera will be looking straight down at the extent, with the up vector pointing toward local north. The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes is set to an east-north-up axes at the center of extent.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body that the extent is on.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent to be viewed. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

summary.para: Zooms to a rectangular extent composed of west, south, east, north on the centralBody. The camera will be looking straight down at the extent, with the up vector pointing toward local north. The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes is set to an east-north-up axes at the center of the extent.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body that the extent is on.

param.name: West
param.para: The west longitude of the extent.

param.name: South
param.para: The south latitude of the extent.

param.name: East
param.para: The east longitude of the extent.

param.name: North
param.para: The north latitude of the extent.

summary.para: Gets or sets the position of the camera. The array contains the components of the position arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the reference point of the camera. The array contains the components of the reference point arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the direction of the camera in IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes. The array contains the components of the direction arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the up direction of the camera in IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes. The array contains the components of the direction arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the distance the camera position is from the reference point.
Gets or sets camera's axes of rotation.
Gets or sets the axis to constrain the up vector to.
Gets or sets whether the camera can rotate over the constrained up axis. For example, if true the camera would be able to flip over the North Pole and view the globe upside down.
Gets or sets whether the camera's direction is locked.

Gets or sets field of view in radians. The field of view is applied to the larger of the window dimensions. For example, if the window width was 640 and the height was 480, the field of view applies to the horizontal. Use IAgStkGraphicsCamera.HorizontalFieldOfView and IAgStkGraphicsCamera.VerticalFieldOfView to get the horizontal and vertical field of views. Wide fields of views generally show more objects but can look distorted as compared to narrower ones.
Gets the horizontal field of view in radians.
Gets the vertical field of view in radians.
Gets or sets the distance in meters from the camera to the near plane.
Gets or sets the distance in meters from the camera to the far plane.

Gets or sets the value that is used to compute subdivisions of the viewing frustum. A large value will be faster but lose z-value precision. A small value will have better precision but perform slower. The default value of 1000 achieves a good balance between speed and accuracy.

Returns the distance that the Camera's Position should be from the ReferencePoint in order to ensure that a sphere with a 1 meter radius centered at the ReferencePoint fits entirely in the view frustum.
Gets the camera snapshot settings.
Gets the camera video recorder.

Gets the approximate number of meters covered by a pixel that is
1 meter away from the camera. This is commonly multiplied by the distance from the camera to an object to compute the approximate number of meters covered by a pixel of the object.
Gets the Reference Frame that the IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Position is returned in. This Reference Frame is composed of the camera's from Point and the IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes.
Gets the Reference Frame that the IAgStkGraphicsCamera.ReferencePoint is returned in. This Reference Frame is composed of the camera's to Point and the IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes.

The graphical properties associated with a particular Central Body. Changing the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics will affect how the associated Central Body is rendered in a IAgStkGraphicsScene. For instance, to show or hide the Central Body, use the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Show property. IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics also contains the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Terrain and IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery for the associated Central Body.
Gets or sets the Color of the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene.
Gets or sets the specular Color of the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The specular color is associated with the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.SpecularOverlay.

Gets or sets the shininess of the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The shininess affects the size and brightness of specular reflection associated with the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.SpecularOverlay.
Gets or sets whether the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery for Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene is shown or hidden.
Gets or sets whether the Central Body is shown or hidden in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. This only affects the Central Body itself, not the IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive that are associated with it.
Gets or sets whether a label with the name of the Central Body should be rendered in the IAgStkGraphicsScene when the IAgStkGraphicsCamera is at certain distance away from the Central Body.

Gets or sets the altitude, in meters, that all IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Terrain and IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery will be offset from the surface of the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene.

Gets or sets the base IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.BaseOverlay is always rendered before any other IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery. By default, the Earth, Sun, and Moon Central Body will have a default IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.BaseOverlay image is loaded by STK Engine when the IAgStkGraphicsScene is created.

Gets or sets the night IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.NightOverlay is displayed only on parts of the Central Body that are not in sun light. The intensity of the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.NightOverlay for all scenes can be adjusted with the scene's IAgStkGraphicsLighting.NightLightsIntensity property.

Gets or sets the specular IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.SpecularOverlay is displayed only in the specular highlight of the Central Body.
Gets the collection of IAgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene.
Gets the collection of IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene.

A composite of display conditions combined using a AgEStkGraphicsBinaryLogicOperation. For example, several IAgStkGraphicsTimeIntervalDisplayCondition objects can be added to a composite. The composite can then be assigned to an object so the object is only rendered when the current animation time is within one of the time intervals.

Requests enough memory for the composite to contain at least count display conditions. IAgStkGraphicsCompositeDisplayCondition.Count will not be affected but IAgStkGraphicsCompositeDisplayCondition.Capacity may be.

param.name: Count
param.para: The number of display conditions to request memory for.

summary.para: Adds a display condition to the end of the composite.

param.name: DisplayCondition
param.para: The display condition to add to the composite.

param.name: Negate
param.para:
When true, a logical
not is applied to displayCondition when the composite display condition is evaluated.

summary.para: Adds a display condition to the end of the composite.

param.name: DisplayCondition
param.para: The display condition to add to the composite.

summary.para: Inserts a display condition at the given zero-based index, shifting existing display conditions.

param.para: The display condition to insert into the composite.

not is applied to displayCondition when the composite display condition is evaluated.

This call has no effect if displayCondition is
null or does not exist in the composite.

summary.para: Removes the display condition at the given zero-based index, shifting existing display conditions.

param.name: Index
param.para: The zero-based index of the display condition to remove.

summary.para: Removes all display conditions from the composite.

remarks.para:
An empty composite display condition evaluates to
true, so when an empty composite is assigned to an object, the object is always rendered.

summary.para:
Determines if a logical
not operation is applied to a display condition in the composite.

remarks.para: Display conditions can be in more than one composite at a time. Each composite may or may not negate the display condition. So a display condition that is negated in one composite is not necessarily negated in another.

param.name: DisplayCondition
param.para: The display condition to check.

summary.para:
Sets if a logical
not operation is applied to a display condition in the composite when the composite is evaluated.

remarks.para: Display conditions can be in more than one composite at a time. Each composite may or may not negate the display condition. So a display condition that is negated in one composite is not necessarily negated in another.

param.name: DisplayCondition
param.para:
The display condition to set the logical
not operation for.

param.name: Negate
param.para: True if displayCondition should be negated.

summary.para:
Determines if a logical
not operation is applied to a display condition in the composite.

remarks.para: Display conditions can be in more than one composite at a time. Each composite may or may not negate the display condition. So a display condition that is negated in one composite is not necessarily negated in another.

param.name: Index
param.para: The zero-based index of the display condition to check.

summary.para:
Sets if a logical
not operation is applied to a display condition in the composite when the composite is evaluated.

remarks.para: Display conditions can be in more than one composite at a time. Each composite may or may not negate the display condition. So a display condition that is negated in one composite is not necessarily negated in another.

param.name: Index
param.para:
The zero-based index of the display condition to set the logical
not operation for.

param.name: Negate
param.para: True if the display condition with the given index should be negated.

summary.para: Gets the number of display conditions in the composite.
Gets the number of display conditions for which memory has been allocated. This will always be greater or equal to IAgStkGraphicsCompositeDisplayCondition.Count.

Gets or sets the binary logic operation applied to all display conditions in the composite when the composite is evaluated. To combine logical
and and
or operations in the same expression, create composites containing composites.

member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive's translucency. Translucency is between 0 and 1, where 0 is opaque and 1 is transparent.

summary.para: Gets the number of primitives in the composite.

Gets or sets the sort order for translucent primitives in this composite. This determines a trade-off between rendering speed and quality. It is only recommended to use AgEStkGraphicsPrimitivesSortOrder when translucent primitives along the same line of sight cause blending artifacts.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsCompositePrimitive._NewEnum

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsCompositePrimitive.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom value associated with this primitive.

summary.para:
A display condition that evaluates to a user-defined value. This is commonly used to hide primitives by assigning to a primitive a display condition that always returns
false.
Gets or sets the value the display condition evaluates to.
When assigned to objects, such as primitives or globe overlays, display conditions are evaluated to determine if the object should be rendered.
Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to the object.
Gets or sets the minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

Gets or sets the maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.
Gets the squared minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.
Gets the squared maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay. This is different from IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition because it is based on the camera's distance to a specified IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay, rather than the camera's distance to the object that uses this display condition.
Gets or sets the globe overlay associated with this instance.
Gets or sets the minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.
Gets the squared minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

Gets or sets the maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.
Gets the squared maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to a position defined in the given Reference Frame.
Gets or sets the minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.
Gets the squared minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

Gets or sets the maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.
Gets the squared maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.
Gets or sets the position used to compute the distance from the camera. The array contains the components of the position arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the reference frame that IAgStkGraphicsDistanceToPositionDisplayCondition.Position is defined in.

Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a screen overlay, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to the IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive. This is different from IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition because it is based on the camera's distance to a specified IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive, rather than the camera's distance to the object that uses this display condition.
Gets or sets the primitive associated with this instance.
Gets or sets the minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.
Gets the squared minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

Gets or sets the maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.
Gets the squared maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

member.summary: Gets or sets the display condition that controls whether or not the globe overlay is displayed.

summary.para: Gets or sets the translucency value for the image. The translucency is between 0 and 1, where 0 is fully opaque and 1 is invisible.

Gets or sets whether to use altitude to determine the translucency value for the image or not. If false, the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.Translucency value is used. If true, the translucency will be determined by the values of IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerTranslucency, IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperTranslucency, IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude, and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude.

Gets or sets the lower translucency value for the image when IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.UseAltitudeBasedTranslucency is set to true. When the altitude of the viewer is at or below IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude, the image will have the translucency specified by this property, and will be linearly interpolated at altitude values between IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude.

Gets or sets the upper translucency value for the image when IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.UseAltitudeBasedTranslucency is set to true. When the altitude of the viewer is at or above IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude, the image will have the translucency specified by this property, and will be linearly interpolated at altitude values between IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude.

Gets or sets the lower altitude bound used to calculate translucency for the image when IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.UseAltitudeBasedTranslucency is set to true. When the altitude of the viewer is at or below this value, the image will have the translucency specified by IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerTranslucency, and will be linearly interpolated at altitude values between IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude.

Gets or sets the upper altitude bound used to calculate translucency for the image when IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.UseAltitudeBasedTranslucency is set to true. When the altitude of the viewer is at or above this value, the image will have the translucency specified by IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperTranslucency, and will be linearly interpolated at altitude values between IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude.
Gets whether or not the video card allows for more than one image globe overlay IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay to be added.

The great arc interpolator computes interpolated positions along a great arc. A great arc is the shortest path between two positions on an ellipsoid.

summary.para: Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster derived from the luminance of the raster's color bands.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster based on the value of its first pixel. All pixels in the source raster that are the same color as the first pixel will be made transparent.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster derived from the color bands or alpha of another raster. This filter can be used to apply an alpha mask to the source raster.
Gets or sets the raster that the source raster will use to derive an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band.
Extracts a band or set of bands from the source raster. The IAgStkGraphicsBandExtractFilter.ExtractFormat property specifies the bands and the order of the bands that will be extracted.
Gets or sets the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat containing the bands and the order of the bands that will be extracted.

Reorders or swizzles the bands of the source raster to match the band order of the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat specified by the IAgStkGraphicsBandOrderFilter.BandOrder property. When IAgStkGraphicsBandOrderFilter.MaintainRasterFormat is true, the source raster's format is maintained after swizzling.
Gets or sets the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat indicating the desired order of the bands in the source raster.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to maintain the source raster's format after the filter is applied. When true, the source raster's format is maintained after swizzling.
Applies a IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter to blur or smooth the source raster. Can be used to reduce noise in the raster.
