member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom value associated with this primitive.

summary.para:
Optional per-string and per-batch parameters for IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive. To use optional parameters, create an instance of
TextBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then call the desired methods or properties to define per-string and per-batch parameters, and finally pass the object to the text batch's
Set or
SetPartial method.
Defines a collection of origins, one for each string in the batch.

remarks.para: The origin defines where the string is placed relative to its position.
Per-string origins override the per-batch origin. Therefore, when per-string origins are defined with this method, AgEStkGraphicsOrigin is ignored.

param.name: Origins
param.para:
An array containing a AgEStkGraphicsOrigin for each string in the batch. There must be one origin for each string passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of eye offsets, one for each string in the batch.

remarks.para:
Eye offsets define an eye-space translation in meters. In eye-space, the
x axis points to the right, the
y axis points up, and the
z axis points into the screen. Eye offsets are commonly used when more than one primitive is located at the same position. For example, if a string in a text batch is located at the same position as a model primitive, an eye offset in the positive
y direction can be applied to the string so it appears a specified number of meters above the model.
Per-string eye offsets override the per-batch eye offset. Therefore, when per-string eye offsets are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters.EyeOffset is ignored.

param.name: EyeOffsets
param.para:
An array containing the x, y, and z eye offset for each string in the batch. There must be one x eye offset, followed by one y eye offset, followed by one z eye offset for each string passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of pixel offsets, one for each string in the batch.

remarks.para:
The pixel offset defines a screen-space translation for a string from its position. Positive
x values translate to the right and positive
y values translate up. This is commonly used when more than one primitive is located at the same position. For example, if a string in a text batch and a point in a point batch have the same position, the string may have a pixel offset applied to it so it doesn't overlap the point.

Per-string pixel offsets override the per-batch pixel offset. Therefore, when per-string pixel offsets are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters.PixelOffset is ignored.

param.name: PixelOffsets
param.para:
An array containing a X and Y pixel offset for each string in the batch. There must be one X pixel offset followed by one Y pixel offset for each string passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of colors, one for each string in the batch.

remarks.para: Per-string colors override the per-batch color. Therefore, when per-string colors are defined with this method, the text batch's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Color property is ignored.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of a color for each string in the batch. There must be one color for each string passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method. In .NET a Color should be translated a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: Gets or sets the per-batch origin, which is applied to each string in the text batch.
Gets or sets the per-batch eye offset, which is applied to each string in the text batch. The array contains the components of the offset arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the per-batch pixel offset, which is applied to each string in the text batch. The array contains one x pixel offset followed by one y pixel offset.
Gets or sets the maximum length of each string in the text batch.
A 4 by 4 matrix applied to a texture coordinate.
Gets the element in the first row, first column.
Gets the element in the first row, second column.
Gets the element in the first row, third column.
Gets the element in the first row, fourth column.
Gets the element in the second row, first column.
Gets the element in the second row, second column.
Gets the element in the second row, third column.
Gets the element in the second row, fourth column.
Gets the element in the third row, first column.
Gets the element in the third row, second column.
Gets the element in the third row, third column.
Gets the element in the third row, fourth column.
Gets the element in the fourth row, first column.
Gets the element in the fourth row, second column.
Gets the element in the fourth row, third column.
Gets the element in the fourth row, fourth column.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive time interval that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the current animation time .

Renders a triangle mesh in the 3D scene. Examples of triangle meshes includes polygons on the globe (e.g. states or countries), terrain and imagery extents, ellipses, and extrusions.
Defines the triangle mesh using an indexed triangle list specified by positions, normals, and indices. The mesh is rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) for the triangle mesh.

param.name: Normals
param.para: An array containing the normals (in the order x, y, z) used for lighting the triangle mesh. There must be one normal for each position in positions.

param.name: Indices
param.para: An array of integers containing the indices into positions and normals. A set of x, y, and z elements is considered a single index. Every 3 indices represent 1 triangle.

summary.para: Defines the triangle mesh using an indexed triangle list specified by positions, normals, indices, and optionalParameters. The mesh is rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: See IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitiveOptionalParameters for details on how to define parameters.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) for the triangle mesh.

param.name: Normals
param.para: An array containing the normals (in the order x, y, z) used for lighting the triangle mesh. There must be one normal for each position in positions.

param.name: Indices
param.para: An array of integers containing the indices into positions and normals. A set of x, y, and z elements is considered a single index. Every 3 indices represent 1 triangle.

param.name: OptionalParameters
param.para: Optional parameters corresponding to positions.

summary.para: Defines the triangle mesh using the specified triangulator. The mesh is rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

param.name: Triangulator
param.para: The triangulator used to define the triangle mesh.

Gets or sets whether front and/or back-facing triangles may be culled. This is used in combination with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.TriangleWindingOrder for culling.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics._IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom value associated with this primitive.

summary.para:
Optional parameters for IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive. To use optional parameters, create an instance of
TriangleMeshPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then call the desired methods or properties to define the parameters, and finally pass the object to the triangle mesh's
Set method.
Defines a collection of texture coordinates.

param.name: TextureCoordinates
param.para:
An array containing the texture coordinates (in the order x, y) for the mesh. There must be one texture coordinate for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive's
Set method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of colors.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of colors for each vertex in the mesh. There must be one color for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive's
Set method. In .NET a Color should be translated to a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para:
Triangulates a box. It is recommended to visualize the box using a IAgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive. Although, if only the fill is desired for visualization, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.RenderBackThenFrontFaces set to
true can be used. Likewise, if only the outline is desired, a IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used.
Computes the triangulation for a box of the specified size, centered at the origin.

param.name: Size
param.para: An array containing the size along each axis of the box. The sizes are expected in the order x, y, z to correspond to the respective axis.

summary.para:
Triangulates a cylinder. It is recommended to visualize the cylinder using a IAgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive. Although, if only the fill is desired for visualization, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.RenderBackThenFrontFaces set to
true can be used. Likewise, if only the outline is desired, a IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used.
Computes the triangulation for a cylinder centered at the origin.

param.name: Length
param.para: The length, in meters, of the cylinder along the z axis.

param.name: Radius
param.para: The radius, in meters, of the cylinder.

summary.para: Computes the triangulation for a cylinder centered at the origin.

param.name: Length
param.para: The length, in meters, of the cylinder along the z axis.

param.name: BottomRadius
param.para: The radius, in meters, of the cylinder's bottom cap.

param.name: TopRadius
param.para: The radius, in meters, of the cylinder's top cap.

param.name: Slices
param.para: The number of slices around the z axis.

param.name: CylinderFill
param.para:
Flags enumeration indicating what cylinder faces should be filled. Values can be logically
ored together.

summary.para:
Triangulates an ellipsoid. It is recommended to visualize the ellipsoid using a IAgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive. Although, if only the fill is desired for visualization, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.RenderBackThenFrontFaces set to
true can be used. Likewise, if only the outline is desired, a IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used.
Computes the triangulation for an ellipsoid with the specified radii, centered at the origin, using 32 slices and 16 stacks.

param.name: Radii
param.para: The radii of the ellipsoid along each of its axes. The sizes are expected in the order x, y, z to correspond to the respective axis.

summary.para: Computes the triangulation for an ellipsoid with the specified radii, centered at the origin.

param.name: Radii
param.para: The radii of the ellipsoid along each of its axes. The sizes are expected in the order x, y, z to correspond to the respective axis.

param.name: Slices
param.para: The number of slices around the z axis.

param.name: Stacks
param.para: The number of stacks along the z axis.

summary.para: Triangulates a polyline into an extrusion with bottom and top boundaries.

Computes an extrusion between bottomPositions and topPositions on the specified centralBody. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorInitializer with a
positionsWindingOrder of AgEStkGraphicsWindingOrder.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: BottomPositions
param.para: An array containing bottom positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

param.name: TopPositions
param.para: An array containing top positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

summary.para: Computes an extrusion between bottomPositions and topPositions on the specified centralBody.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: BottomPositions
param.para: An array containing bottom positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

param.name: TopPositions
param.para: An array containing top positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

param.name: PositionsWindingOrder
param.para: The winding order of bottomPositions and topPositions.

summary.para: For convenience. Computes an extrusion between bottomPositions and topPositions on the specified centralBody using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in bottomPositions and topPositions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorInitializer

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: BottomPositions
param.para: An array containing bottom positions, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: TopPositions
param.para: An array containing top positions, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para: For convenience. Computes an extrusion between bottomPositions and topPositions on the specified centralBody using Cartographic positions. param.name: BottomAltitude

param.name: TopAltitude
param.para: The extrusion's top altitude, in meters, above the ellipsoid.

summary.para: Triangulates an extent on a central body into a triangle mesh and a surrounding boundary. The mesh is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive. The boundary is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.

Computes a triangulation on the specified centralBody for the specified extent. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceExtentTriangulatorInitializer with an
altitude of
0 and a
granularity of
1 degree.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent to compute the triangulation for. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

summary.para: Computes a triangulation on the specified centralBody for the specified extent.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent to compute the triangulation for. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

param.name: Altitude
param.para:
The altitude of the triangulation. When
0, the mesh is computed to conform to the ellipsoid.

param.name: Granularity
param.para: The angular separation, in radians, of triangles in the triangulation. Lower granularities are more precise but create more triangles.

summary.para: Triangulates a polygon, with an optional hole, on a central body, into a triangle mesh and a surrounding boundary. The mesh is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive. The boundary is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.

Computes the triangulation on the specified centralBody for a polygon whose boundary is defined by the specified positions. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfacePolygonTriangulatorInitializer with an
altitude of
0, a
granularity of
1 degree, and a
positionsWindingOrder of AgEStkGraphicsWindingOrder.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) defining the boundary of the polygon, in the centralBody's fixed reference frame, to triangulate.

summary.para: For convenience. Computes the triangulation on the specified centralBody for a polygon whose boundary is defined by the specified Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfacePolygonTriangulatorInitializer

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions defining the boundary of the polygon to triangulate, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para:
Computes the triangulation on the specified centralBody for a polygon whose boundary is defined by the specified positions with a hole specified by holePositions. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfacePolygonTriangulatorInitializer with an
altitude of
0 and a
granularity of
1 degree.

summary.para: A IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay which IAgStkGraphicsProjection a IAgStkGraphicsRaster onto the IAgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay or surface of the Central Body. You can also enable projection onto IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive by setting IAgStkGraphicsSceneGlobeOverlaySettings.ProjectedRasterModelProjection to true for a Scene. The IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay can also be used with IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream and IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream to stream IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream and other raster data to a IAgStkGraphicsProjection that moves with time.
Initializes a new instance.

param.name: Raster
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsRaster to be projected with projection.

param.name: Projection
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection that will project the raster.

summary.para: Gets whether or not the video card supports the IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.

A IAgStkGraphicsProjection represents a simplified camera with a IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Position, IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Orientation, and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewHorizontal and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewVertical. Unlike a real world camera, IAgStkGraphicsProjection has a nearest and farthest viewing distance, as defined by the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.NearPlane and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FarPlane properties. For example, IAgStkGraphicsProjection can be used to represent a UAV's camera, to allow for projecting video onto terrain. See the Raster and Projection Streams Overview for such an example.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the cartesian IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Position (in the order x, y, z) of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

param.name: Orientation
param.para: The Unit Quaternion defining the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Orientation of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

param.name: FieldOfViewHorizontal
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewHorizontal associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

param.name: FieldOfViewVertical
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewVertical associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

param.name: NearPlane
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection.NearPlane associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

param.name: FarPlane
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FarPlane associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance from another projection.

param.name: Projection
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection from which to initialize the new instance.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive altitude interval, in meters, that determines when an object is rendered based on the camera's altitude relative to a Central Body.
Initializes a default altitude display condition. With this constructor, an object is always rendered regardless of the camera's altitude.

Initializes an altitude display condition with the inclusive altitude interval [minimumAltitude, maximumAltitude]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the camera's altitude, relative to the Central Body, is within the interval.

param.name: MinimumAltitude
param.para:
The minimum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MinValue to ignore checking the minimum altitude.

param.name: MaximumAltitude
param.para:
The maximum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum altitude.

summary.para: Initializes an altitude display condition with the inclusive altitude interval [minimumAltitude, maximumAltitude]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the camera's altitude, relative to the centralBody, is within the interval.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body to which the altitude is relative.

param.name: MinimumAltitude
param.para:
The minimum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MinValue to ignore checking the minimum altitude.

param.name: MaximumAltitude
param.para:
The maximum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum altitude.

summary.para: A composite of display conditions combined using a AgEStkGraphicsBinaryLogicOperation. For example, several IAgStkGraphicsTimeIntervalDisplayCondition objects can be added to a composite. The composite can then be assigned to an object so the object is only rendered when the current animation time is within one of the time intervals.
Initializes an empty composite display condition.

A primitive that is composed of multiple other primitives. Since composites can contain other composites, they are commonly used to build hierarchies of primitives to efficiently evaluate display conditions.
Primitives in a composite must have the same IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.
Initializes a default composite primitive.

A display condition that evaluates to a user-defined value. This is commonly used to hide primitives by assigning to a primitive a display condition that always returns
false.

Initializes a default constant display condition. IAgStkGraphicsConstantDisplayCondition.Display is set to
false so when this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is not rendered.
Initializes a constant display condition with the value the display condition evaluates to.

param.name: Display
param.para: The value the display condition evaluates to. If true, when this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is always rendered. If false, the object is never rendered.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to the object.

Initializes a default distance display condition. IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition.MinimumDistance is set to
0 and IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition.MaximumDistance is set to
Double.MaxValue. With this interval, an object is always rendered regardless of its distance to the camera.

Initializes a distance display condition with the inclusive distance interval [minimumDistance, maximumDistance]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the distance, in meters, from the camera to the object is within the interval.

param.name: MinimumDistance
param.para: The minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

param.name: MaximumDistance
param.para:
The maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay. This is different from IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition because it is based on the camera's distance to a specified IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay, rather than the camera's distance to the object that uses this display condition.
Initializes a default distance to globe overlay display condition. With this constructor, an object is always rendered regardless of the camera's distance to the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay.

Initializes a distance display condition with the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay and the inclusive distance interval [minimumDistance, maximumDistance]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the distance, in meters, from the camera to the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay is within the interval.

param.name: GlobeOverlay
param.para: The globe overlay associated with this instance.

param.name: MinimumDistance
param.para: The minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

param.name: MaximumDistance
param.para:
The maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to a position defined in the given Reference Frame.

Initializes a default distance to position display condition. With this constructor, an object is always rendered regardless of the camera's distance to the IAgStkGraphicsDistanceToPositionDisplayCondition.Position.

Initializes a distance display condition with the inclusive distance interval [minimumDistance, maximumDistance]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the distance, in meters, from the camera to the position is within the interval.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the position (in the order x, y, z) used to compute the distance from the camera.

param.name: MinimumDistance
param.para: The minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

param.name: MaximumDistance
param.para:
The maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

summary.para: Initializes a distance display condition with the inclusive distance interval [minimumDistance, maximumDistance]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the distance, in meters, from the camera to the position is within the interval.

param.name: ReferenceFrame
param.para: The reference frame of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the position (in the order x, y, z) used to compute the distance from the camera.

param.name: MinimumDistance
param.para: The minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

param.name: MaximumDistance
param.para:
The maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a screen overlay, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to the IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive. This is different from IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition because it is based on the camera's distance to a specified IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive, rather than the camera's distance to the object that uses this display condition.
Initializes a default distance to primitive display condition. With this constructor, an object is always rendered regardless of the camera's distance to the IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.

Initializes a distance to primitive display condition with the inclusive distance interval [minimumDistance, maximumDistance]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a screen overlay, the object is only rendered when the distance, in meters, from the camera to the IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive, is within the interval.

param.name: Primitive
param.para: The primitive associated with this instance.

param.name: MinimumDistance
param.para: The minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

param.name: MaximumDistance
param.para:
The maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

summary.para: IAgStkGraphicsPathPrimitive update policy that removes points from IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.RemoveLocation after a given IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.Duration.

Constructs a default update policy. This is equivalent to constructing a policy with IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.Duration set to 0 and a IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.RemoveLocation of
Front.
Initializes a policy with the specified duration and removeLocation.

param.name: Duration
param.para: Sets the amount of time that a point at IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.RemoveLocation will be on the path.

param.name: RemoveLocation
param.para: Sets the remove location to the front or back of the path.

summary.para: A IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay that shows an image.
Gets whether or not the video card allows for more than one image globe overlay IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay to be added.

A font that is suitable for use with the IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive. For best performance, avoid creating duplicate font objects. Instead assign the same font object to several text batch primitives.

param.name: Name
param.para: The typeface name of the font.

param.name: Size
param.para: The size of the font.

param.name: FontStyle
param.para:
The style of the font. AgEStkGraphicsFontStyle enumeration values can be logically
ored together to apply more than one style.

param.name: Outline
param.para:
true if the font should be created with an outline around its characters; otherwise,
false.

summary.para: Initializes a graphics font with the typeface name and size.

param.name: Name
param.para: The typeface name of the font.

param.name: Size
param.para: The size of the font.

summary.para: The great arc interpolator computes interpolated positions along a great arc. A great arc is the shortest path between two positions on an ellipsoid.

Initializes a default great arc interpolator. This is equivalent to constructing a great arc interpolator with a IAgStkGraphicsGreatArcInterpolator.CentralBody equal to an instance of Earth Central Body and a IAgStkGraphicsGreatArcInterpolator.Granularity of
1 degree.

Initializes a great arc interpolator with the specified centralBody and a IAgStkGraphicsGreatArcInterpolator.Granularity of
1 degree.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body used when interpolating with Interpolate.

summary.para: Initializes a great arc interpolator with the specified centralBody and granularity.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body used when interpolating with Interpolate.

param.name: Granularity
param.para: The granularity, in radians, used when interpolating with Interpolate.

summary.para: Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster derived from the luminance of the raster's color bands.
Initializes a new instance.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster based on the value of its first pixel. All pixels in the source raster that are the same color as the first pixel will be made transparent.
Initializes a new instance.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster derived from the color bands or alpha of another raster. This filter can be used to apply an alpha mask to the source raster.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with the raster that the source raster will use to derive an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band.

param.name: Raster
param.para: The raster the source raster will use to derive an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band.

summary.para: Extracts a band or set of bands from the source raster. The IAgStkGraphicsBandExtractFilter.ExtractFormat property specifies the bands and the order of the bands that will be extracted.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with the AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand to be extracted from the source raster.

param.name: RasterBand
param.para: The AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand to be extracted from the source raster.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance with the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat containing the bands to be extracted from the source raster.

param.name: RasterFormat
param.para: The AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat containing the bands to be extracted from the source raster.

summary.para: Reorders or swizzles the bands of the source raster to match the band order of the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat specified by the IAgStkGraphicsBandOrderFilter.BandOrder property. When IAgStkGraphicsBandOrderFilter.MaintainRasterFormat is true, the source raster's format is maintained after swizzling.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with a AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat indicating the desired order of the bands in the source raster.

param.name: BandOrder
param.para: The AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat indicating the desired order of the bands in the source raster.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance with a AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat indicating the desired order of the bands in the source raster, and whether to maintain the source raster's format after swizzling.

param.name: BandOrder
param.para: The AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat indicating the desired order of the bands in the source raster.

param.name: MaintainImageFormat
param.para: true to maintain the source raster's format after swizzling; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Applies a IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter to blur or smooth the source raster. Can be used to reduce noise in the raster.
Initializes a new instance.
Initialize a new instance with the specified AgEStkGraphicsBlurMethod.

param.name: Method
param.para: Method used to blur the source raster.

summary.para: Adjusts the brightness of the source raster's color bands. The IAgStkGraphicsBrightnessFilter.Adjustment to brightness is a value between -1 and 1, corresponding to least bright to most bright.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with the IAgStkGraphicsBrightnessFilter.Adjustment to brightness.

param.name: Adjustment
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsBrightnessFilter.Adjustment to brightness.

summary.para: Extracts a AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band derived from the color bands of the source raster.
Initializes a new instance.
Adjusts the contrast of the source raster. The IAgStkGraphicsContrastFilter.Adjustment to contrast is a value between -1 and 1, corresponding to least contrast to most contrast.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with the IAgStkGraphicsContrastFilter.Adjustment to contrast.

param.name: Adjustment
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsContrastFilter.Adjustment to contrast.

summary.para: Applies convolution to the source raster. Convolution is the modification of a pixel's value based on the values of its surrounding pixels. The IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel is the numerical matrix that is applied to each pixel in this process. The convolution operation is discussed in more detail in numerous texts on image processing and useful convolution kernels are widely available from various sources.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with the specified IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel.

param.name: Kernel
param.para: An array containing the 9 elements of the IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel of the convolution matrix. The elements should be provided as the entire first row, followed by the entire second row, followed by the entire third row, each from left to right.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance with the specified IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel and IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Divisor.

param.name: Kernel
param.para: An array containing the 9 elements of the IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel of the convolution matrix. The elements should be provided as the entire first row, followed by the entire second row, followed by the entire third row, each from left to right.

param.name: Divisor
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Divisor of the convolution.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance with the specified IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel, IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Divisor, and IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Offset.

param.name: Kernel
param.para: An array containing the 9 elements of the IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel of the convolution matrix. The elements should be provided as the entire first row, followed by the entire second row, followed by the entire third row, each from left to right.

param.name: Divisor
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Divisor of the convolution.

param.name: Offset
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Offset of the convolution.

summary.para: Applies a IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter to detect edges in the source raster.

Initializes a new instance with the specified AgEStkGraphicsEdgeDetectMethod.

param.name: Method
param.para: Method used to detect edges in the source raster.

summary.para: A class decorator for applying a IAgStkGraphicsRasterFilter to each update of a IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream. Can be used to apply filters to videos and other raster streams as they are updated.

param.name: RasterStream

param.name: Filter
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsRasterFilter to apply to each update of the IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.

summary.para: Flips the source raster along the given AgEStkGraphicsFlipAxis.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with the specified AgEStkGraphicsFlipAxis.

param.name: FlipAxis
param.para: The AgEStkGraphicsFlipAxis.

summary.para: Applies gamma correction to the source raster. The IAgStkGraphicsGammaCorrectionFilter.Gamma is a value between .2 and 5. The default gamma value is 2.2.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with the specified IAgStkGraphicsGammaCorrectionFilter.Gamma.

param.name: Gamma
param.para: The gamma value for the filter.

summary.para: Applies a IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter to blur the source raster using the Gaussian function.

Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with specified AgEStkGraphicsGradientDetectMethod.

param.name: Method
param.para: Method used to detect gradients in a raster.

summary.para: Converts an image, such as a BMP, to a GeoJP2 file that can be used as an image globe overlay.
Converts an image, such as a BMP, to a GeoJP2 file that can be used as an image globe overlay. The extent of the image must be in the image, as in a GeoTIFF.

param.name: ImageUri
param.para: The image filename to be converted. Only file URIs are supported.

param.name: CompressionProfile
param.para: The compression profile.

param.name: CompressionRate
param.para: A higher compression rate results in smaller JPEG 2000 files. Use 1 for no compression. Valid values are 1 to 65535.

param.name: Jpeg2000Uri
param.para: The JPEG 2000 filename. Only file URIs are supported.

param.name: OverwriteExistingFile
param.para: If true and the JPEG 2000 file already exists, the file will be overwritten during the conversion.

summary.para: Converts an image, such as a BMP, to a GeoJP2 file that can be used as an image globe overlay. The extent of the image can be defined as an input parameter if necessary.

param.name: ImageUri
param.para: The image filename to be converted. Only file URIs are supported.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent of the image. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude. The extent can be null if the image defines the extent as with a GeoTIFF image.

param.name: CompressionProfile
param.para: The compression profile.

param.name: CompressionRate
param.para: A higher compression rate results in smaller JPEG 2000 files. Use 1 for no compression. Valid values are 1 to 65535.

param.name: Jpeg2000Uri
param.para: The JPEG 2000 filename. Only file URIs are supported.

param.name: OverwriteExistingFile
param.para: If true and the JPEG 2000 file already exists, the file will be overwritten during the conversion.

param.para: If true and the JPEG 2000 file already exists, the file will be overwritten during the conversion.

param.para: The image filename to be converted. Only file URIs are supported.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent of the image. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude. The extent can be null if the image defines the extent as with a GeoTIFF image.

param.name: SubExtent
param.para: If a sub-extent is specified, only part of the image defined by the sub-extent is converted. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

summary.para: Adjusts the band levels of the source raster linearly.
Initializes a new instance.

The Activator class provides methods to load COM plugins that implement projection and raster streaming. For more information about the projection and raster plugins, see the STK Programming Interface.
Initializes a new instance of the Activator type.

A raster dataset. A raster consists of one or more AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand, or sets of values, which are most commonly associated with colors when the raster represents an image. For instance, a typical color image contains three sets of values, or bands (red, green, and blue) which define the color of pixels within the image. The following raster image formats can be read by the raster class: BMP, ECW, IMG, JP2, NTF, NITF, PNG, SID, TIF, TIFF, JPG, JPEG, PPM, PGM, CLDS, and TGA. To create a texture from a raster, pass it to the IAgStkGraphicsTexture2DFactory.FromRaster method.
Initializes a raster from a Uri, which can be a file, HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP source. See IAgStkGraphicsRaster for a list of supported formats.

param.name: Uri
param.para: The Uri of the raster.

summary.para: Initializes a raster from a Uri. Only the specified subsection of the raster is read. See IAgStkGraphicsRaster for a list of supported formats.

param.para: The Uri of the raster.

param.name: X
param.para: The X position of the subsection in pixels.

param.name: Y
param.para: The Y position of the subsection in pixels.

param.name: Width
param.para: The width of the subsection in pixels.

param.name: Height
param.para: The height of the subsection in pixels.

summary.para: The attributes describing a IAgStkGraphicsRaster dataset. IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes define the memory layout of a IAgStkGraphicsRaster, and includes properties defining the order of each AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand that the raster contains, as specified by the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat. It also describes the type of data, or AgEStkGraphicsRasterType of the contained bands, the IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes.Height and IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes.Width of the raster in pixels, the IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes.RowAlignment of the raster, and other relevant properties.
Initializes a new instance with the width and height of the raster in pixels, and the given AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat.

param.para: The width of the raster in pixels.

param.name: Height

summary.para: Renders one or more markers in the 3D scene. Markers are 2D images that always face the viewer which can be sized in pixels or meters. Markers are also referred to as sprites or billboards.
For best performance, avoid creating lots of batches with only a few markers each. See the Batching Performance Overview.

Initializes a default marker batch primitive. This is equivalent to constructing a marker batch with a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSizeSource of
FromTexture, a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSortOrder of
ByTexture, a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent, and a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchRenderingMethod of
Automatic.

Initializes a marker batch primitive with the specified setHint. This is equivalent to constructing a marker batch with a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSizeSource of
FromTexture, a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSortOrder of
ByTexture, the specified setHint, and a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchRenderingMethod of
Automatic.

Initializes a marker batch primitive with the specified sizeSource. This is equivalent to constructing a marker batch with the specified sizeSource, a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSortOrder of
ByTexture, a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent, and a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchRenderingMethod of
Automatic.

param.name: SizeSource
param.para: Determines the source used for the size of markers in the batch.

summary.para:
Initializes a marker batch primitive with the specified sizeSource and sortOrder. This is equivalent to constructing a marker batch with the specified sizeSource, the specified sortOrder, a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent, and a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchRenderingMethod of
Automatic.

param.name: SizeSource
param.para: Determines the source used for the size of markers in the batch.

param.name: SortOrder
param.para: The order in which markers in the batch should be sorted before rendering.

summary.para:
Initializes a marker batch primitive with the specified sizeSource, sortOrder, and setHint. This is equivalent to constructing a marker batch with the specified arguments and a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchRenderingMethod of
Automatic.

param.name: SizeSource

param.name: SortOrder

summary.para:
Optional per-marker parameters for IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive that overrides the marker batch's per-batch parameters. Define per-marker parameters by creating an instance of
MarkerBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then calling the desired methods to define per-marker parameters, and finally passing the object to the marker batch's
Set or
SetPartial method.
Initializes default marker batch primitive optional parameters. All per-marker parameters are initially empty.

IAgStkGraphicsPathPrimitive update policy that removes points from IAgStkGraphicsMaximumCountPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.RemoveLocation when the number of points in the path exceeds IAgStkGraphicsMaximumCountPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.MaximumCount.

Constructs a default update policy. This is equivalent to constructing a policy with IAgStkGraphicsMaximumCountPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.MaximumCount set to 0 and a IAgStkGraphicsMaximumCountPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.RemoveLocation of
Front.

summary.para:
Renders a line to the 3D scene. Similar to the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive; however, the
PathPrimitive was designed for the efficient addition/removal of points to/from the front or back of the line.
Initializes a default path primitive. This is equivalent to constructing a path primitive with an initial capacity of 16.

param.name: Capacity
param.para: Sets the initial capacity for the buffer containing positions. Setting the capacity reserves memory so the addition of points is more efficient.

summary.para: Gets the minimum width, in pixels, supported by the video card.
Gets the maximum width, in pixels, supported by the video card.

Defines an inclusive interval, in pixels, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the number of pixels the object's bounding sphere (or in the case of screen overlays, bounding rectangle) covers on the screen. This is commonly used to implement level of detail algorithms that take into account the field of view.

Initializes a default pixel size display condition. IAgStkGraphicsPixelSizeDisplayCondition.MinimumPixelSize is set to
0 and IAgStkGraphicsPixelSizeDisplayCondition.MaximumPixelSize is set to
Int32.MaxValue. With this interval, an object is always rendered regardless of how many pixels its bounding sphere or rectangle covers.

Initializes a pixel size display condition with the inclusive interval [minimumPixelSize, maximumPixelSize]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the number of pixels consumed by the object's bounding sphere, projected onto the screen, (or in the case of screen overlays, the area of its bounding rectangle) is within the interval.

param.name: MinimumPixelSize
param.para: The minimum pixel size of the inclusive interval.

param.name: MaximumPixelSize
param.para:
The maximum pixel size of the inclusive interval. Use
Int32.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum pixel size.

summary.para: Renders one or more points in the 3D scene. Each point in the batch has a unique position and an optional color. All points in the batch share the same pixel size. For best performance, avoid creating lots of batches with only a few points each. See the Batching Performance Overview.

Initializes a default point batch primitive. This is equivalent to constructing a point batch with a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent.
Initializes a new instance of a point batch primitive with the specified AgEStkGraphicsSetHint.
Gets the minimum pixel size supported by the video card.
Gets the maximum pixel size supported by the video card.

Frequent and a AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType of
LineStrip.

summary.para: The rhumb line interpolator computes interpolated positions along a rhumb line. Rhumb lines are lines of constant bearing. They appear as straight lines on a Mercator 2D map projection and are well suited to navigation.

1 degree.

summary.para: A display condition used to control what scene or scenes an object, such as a primitive, is rendered in. This is used to show an object in some scenes and hide it in others.

Initializes a default scene display condition. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object can be restricted to only render in certain scenes. Call IAgStkGraphicsSceneDisplayCondition.SetDisplayInScene or IAgStkGraphicsSceneDisplayCondition.DisplayOnlyInScene to limit the scenes.

The static IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager class provides global properties and functionality that apply to all IAgStkGraphicsScene and thus affect the rendering of every globe control. It also provides a IAgStkGraphicsSceneManagerInitializer.Textures property for creating new Texture 2D, and controls the Time of all IAgStkGraphicsScene within an application. The Animation property and Set Time method can be used to control Time. The IAgStkGraphicsSceneManagerInitializer.Primitives and IAgStkGraphicsSceneManagerInitializer.ScreenOverlays properties allow you to add IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive and IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay to all IAgStkGraphicsScene. To render these objects in specific scenes, see the IAgStkGraphicsSceneDisplayCondition class. To render all IAgStkGraphicsScene within an application, call the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManagerInitializer.Render method.
Renders all IAgStkGraphicsScene within an application. To render a specific IAgStkGraphicsScene, use the IAgStkGraphicsScene.Render method.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsPrimitiveManager, which is used to add IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive to your IAgStkGraphicsScene.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayManager, which is used to add IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay to your IAgStkGraphicsScene.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsTexture2DFactory, which can be used to create Texture 2D from various sources.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlaySettings, which are used to set global settings for all IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay.
Gets a read-only collection of IAgStkGraphicsScene that are associated with the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.

summary.para: Renders filled solid objects and their outlines. Example solids include boxes and ellipsoids. Various effects are supported, such as displaying the solid's silhouette, and hidding the outline of the backside of the solid. In cases where you just want to visualize a solid's fill or outline, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used for reduced overhead.

Optional per-string and per-batch parameters for IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive. To use optional parameters, create an instance of

SetPartial method.

A 4 by 4 matrix applied to a texture coordinate.
Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsTextureMatrix to the identity matrix.
Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsTextureMatrix. The subscripts define [row][column].
Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsTextureMatrix from a Matrix. The upper left 2x2 matrix defines rotation and scaling. The top two elements of the last column define translation.

param.name: Matrix
param.para: An array representing the matrix of the texture. The elements should be provided row by row, from left to right.

summary.para: Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsTextureMatrix from texture corner points. Normally, a texture is mapped such that the lower left corner is texture coordinate (0, 0), the lower right is (1, 0), the upper right is (1, 1), and the upper left is (0, 1). This code remaps those corners to new corners. For example, remapping the lower left corner to (0.5, 0), the lower right to (1, 0.5), the upper right to (0.5, 1), and the upper left to (0, 0.5) would rotate the texture 45 degress.

param.name: Corner0
param.para: An array containing the new location of the texture's lower left corner in the order x, y.

param.name: Corner1
param.para: An array containing the new location of the texture's lower right corner in the order x, y.

param.name: Corner2
param.para: An array containing the new location of the texture's upper right corner in the order x, y.

param.name: Corner3
param.para: An array containing the new location of the texture's upper left corner in the order x, y.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive time interval that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the current animation time .

Initializes a default time display condition. IAgStkGraphicsTimeIntervalDisplayCondition.MinimumTime is set to
JulianDate.MinValue and IAgStkGraphicsTimeIntervalDisplayCondition.MaximumTime is set to
JulianDate.MaxValue. With this interval, an object is always rendered regardless of the current animation time.

Initializes a time display condition with the inclusive time interval [minimumTime, maximumTime]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the current animation time, Time, is within the interval.

param.name: MinimumTime
param.para: The minimum time of the inclusive time interval.

param.name: MaximumTime
param.para: The maximum distance of the inclusive time interval.

summary.para: Initializes a time display condition with a Time Interval.

param.name: TimeInterval
param.para: An array containing the time interval to assign to the display condition, in the order start time, stop time.

summary.para: Renders a triangle mesh in the 3D scene. Examples of triangle meshes includes polygons on the globe (e.g. states or countries), terrain and imagery extents, ellipses, and extrusions.

Initializes a default triangle mesh primitive. This is equivalent to constructing a triangle mesh with a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent.
Initializes a triangle mesh primitive with the specified setHint .

Optional parameters for IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive. To use optional parameters, create an instance of
TriangleMeshPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then call the desired methods or properties to define the parameters, and finally pass the object to the triangle mesh's
Set method.
Initializes default triangle mesh primitive optional parameters.
The rate at which animation frames will occur.
The animation will occur as fast as possible. The maximum frame rate is the refresh rate of the display or is the maximum that video card is capable of if the video card's vertical sync is off.
The animation will target a specified frame rate.

Describes when a primitive will be rendered. Some primitives need to be rendered during or at a certain time. For example, translucent primitives need to be rendered after opaque primitives to allow proper blending. These values can be logically
ored together when a primitive should be rendered in more than one pass.
Render during the opaque rendering pass.
Render during the translucent rendering pass.
Render before the central body is rendered.
Rendered in an ordered composite before all other primitives and before the central body is rendered.
Rendered in an ordered composite before all primitives but after the central body is rendered.
Render after the terrain is rendered.
The multisample anti-aliasing (MSAA) options for Scenes. As the level of anti-aliasing increases, performance will generally decrease, but the quality of the anti-aliasing will improve.
No anti-aliasing
Anti-aliasing at 2x
Anti-aliasing at 4x
Anti-aliasing at 8x
Anti-aliasing at 16x

Represents an individual item index that is associated with a batch primitive. Provides the Index of the individual item and the Primitive that contains that index. When the PerItemPickingEnabled property is set to true for a batch primitive, the PickResults returned from Scene.Pick will contain BatchPrimitiveIndex types referencing particular indices within that batch.
The index of the item contained by the Primitive.
The Primitive that contains the item at the Index specified.

The result from extruded polyline triangulation: a triangle mesh defined using an indexed triangle list with top and bottom boundary positions. The mesh is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive. The boundaries are commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResult.Positions
member.summary: Gets the positions of the mesh. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResult.Normals
member.summary: Gets the normals of the mesh. Every position in positions has corresponding normal. Normals are commonly used for lighting. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one normal.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResult.Indices
member.summary: Gets indices into positions and normals. Every 3 indices represent 1 triangle. The indices returned consider the three components of a position or normal (x, y, and z) as a single array element...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResult.TriangleWindingOrder
member.summary: Gets the orientation of front-facing triangles in the mesh.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResult.BoundingSphere
member.summary: Gets the bounding sphere that encompasses the mesh.

summary.para: Gets the boundary positions along the top of the extrusion. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.
Gets the boundary positions along the bottom of the extrusion. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.
Gets the winding order of IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResult.TopBoundaryPositions and IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResult.BottomBoundaryPositions.

The result from extruded polyline triangulation: a triangle mesh defined using an indexed triangle list with top and bottom boundary positions. The mesh is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive. The boundaries are commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResultClass.Positions
member.summary: Gets the positions of the mesh. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResultClass.Normals
member.summary: Gets the normals of the mesh. Every position in positions has corresponding normal. Normals are commonly used for lighting. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one normal.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResultClass.Indices
member.summary: Gets indices into positions and normals. Every 3 indices represent 1 triangle. The indices returned consider the three components of a position or normal (x, y, and z) as a single array element...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResultClass.TriangleWindingOrder
member.summary: Gets the orientation of front-facing triangles in the mesh.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResultClass.BoundingSphere
member.summary: Gets the bounding sphere that encompasses the mesh.

summary.para: Gets the boundary positions along the top of the extrusion. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.
Gets the boundary positions along the bottom of the extrusion. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.
Gets the winding order of IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResult.TopBoundaryPositions and IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorResult.BottomBoundaryPositions.

The result from a triangulation of a solid: a triangle mesh defined using an indexed triangle list and positions outlining the solid. It is recommended to visualize the solid using a IAgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive. Although, if only the fill is desired for visualization, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.RenderBackThenFrontFaces set to
true can be used. Likewise, if only the outline is desired, a IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResult.Positions
member.summary: Gets the positions of the mesh. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResult.Normals
member.summary: Gets the normals of the mesh. Every position in positions has corresponding normal. Normals are commonly used for lighting. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one normal.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResult.Indices
member.summary: Gets indices into positions and normals. Every 3 indices represent 1 triangle. The indices returned consider the three components of a position or normal (x, y, and z) as a single array element...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResult.TriangleWindingOrder
member.summary: Gets the orientation of front-facing triangles in the mesh.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResult.BoundingSphere
member.summary: Gets the bounding sphere that encompasses the mesh.

summary.para: Gets indices into Positions that define the positions outlining the solid. The indices returned consider the three components of a position (x, y, and z) as a single array element. Multiply the index by 3 to get the location of the x component in Positions.
Gets the positions outlining the solid. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.
Gets the AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType of IAgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResult.OutlineIndices and IAgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResult.OutlinePositions.
Gets whether the solid is closed. For example, a box with six faces is closed. If one face is removed, the box is open.

The result from a triangulation of a solid: a triangle mesh defined using an indexed triangle list and positions outlining the solid. It is recommended to visualize the solid using a IAgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive. Although, if only the fill is desired for visualization, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.RenderBackThenFrontFaces set to
true can be used. Likewise, if only the outline is desired, a IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResultClass.Positions
member.summary: Gets the positions of the mesh. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResultClass.Normals
member.summary: Gets the normals of the mesh. Every position in positions has corresponding normal. Normals are commonly used for lighting. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one normal.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResultClass.Indices
member.summary: Gets indices into positions and normals. Every 3 indices represent 1 triangle. The indices returned consider the three components of a position or normal (x, y, and z) as a single array element...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResultClass.TriangleWindingOrder
member.summary: Gets the orientation of front-facing triangles in the mesh.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResultClass.BoundingSphere
member.summary: Gets the bounding sphere that encompasses the mesh.

summary.para: Gets indices into Positions that define the positions outlining the solid. The indices returned consider the three components of a position (x, y, and z) as a single array element. Multiply the index by 3 to get the location of the x component in Positions.
Gets the positions outlining the solid. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.
Gets the AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType of IAgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResult.OutlineIndices and IAgStkGraphicsSolidTriangulatorResult.OutlinePositions.
Gets whether the solid is closed. For example, a box with six faces is closed. If one face is removed, the box is open.
Represents the boundary positions of a shape on the surface computed from by a IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceShapesInitializer method.
Gets the positions of the computed shape. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.
Gets the winding order of IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceShapesResult.Positions.
Gets the AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType of IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceShapesResult.Positions.
Represents the boundary positions of a shape on the surface computed from by a IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceShapesInitializer method.
Gets the positions of the computed shape. Three array elements (in the order x, y, z) constitute one position.
Gets the winding order of IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceShapesResult.Positions.
Gets the AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType of IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceShapesResult.Positions.

The result from a triangulation on the surface of a central body: a triangle mesh defined using an indexed triangle list and boundary positions surrounding the mesh. The mesh is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive. The boundary are commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.

A IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay for handling AGI Processed Image (PDTTX) files.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsAGIProcessedImageGlobeOverlay.Translucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the translucency value for the image. The translucency is between 0 and 1, where 0 is fully opaque and 1 is invisible.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsAGIProcessedImageGlobeOverlay.UseAltitudeBasedTranslucency
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use altitude to determine the translucency value for the image or not. If <see langword='false' />, the globe image overlay . translucency value is used...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsAGIProcessedImageGlobeOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerTranslucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower translucency value for the image when globe image overlay . use altitude based translucency is set to <see langword='true' />. When the altitude of the viewer is at or below globe image overlay ...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsAGIProcessedImageGlobeOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperTranslucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper translucency value for the image when globe image overlay . use altitude based translucency is set to <see langword='true' />. When the altitude of the viewer is at or above globe image overlay ...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsAGIProcessedImageGlobeOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower altitude bound used to calculate translucency for the image when globe image overlay . use altitude based translucency is set to <see langword='true' />...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsAGIProcessedImageGlobeOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper altitude bound used to calculate translucency for the image when globe image overlay . use altitude based translucency is set to <see langword='true' />...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsAGIProcessedImageGlobeOverlay.MoreThanOneImageGlobeOverlaySupported
member.summary: Gets whether or not the video card allows for more than one image globe overlay globe image overlay to be added.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsAGIProcessedImageGlobeOverlay.CentralBody
member.summary: Gets the central body that the globe overlay is displayed on. It will return <see langword='null' /> if the globe overlay hasn't been added to a central body.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsAGIProcessedImageGlobeOverlay.Extent
member.summary: Gets the cartographic extent that represents the area covered by the globe overlay. The array elements are arranged in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsAGIProcessedImageGlobeOverlay.Role
member.summary: Gets the globe overlay role of the globe overlay.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsAGIProcessedImageGlobeOverlay.UriAsString
member.summary: Gets the absolute URI specifying the location of the globe overlay.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsAGIProcessedImageGlobeOverlay.IsValid
member.summary: Gets whether or not the overlay is valid. It can be invalid because of a missing file, corrupt file, unlicensed file, or a file on the incorrect central body.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsAGIProcessedImageGlobeOverlay.DisplayCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets the display condition that controls whether or not the globe overlay is displayed.

summary.para: Takes snapshots of the 3D window.
Saves a snapshot of the 3D window to the filename with the specified format.

param.name: Filename
param.para: The filename of the snapshot.

param.name: CameraSnapshotFormat
param.para: The file format of the snapshot

summary.para: Saves a snapshot of the 3D window to the filename with the specified format at high resolution. Generally, this is used to take snapshots for print media, such as posters, which is why the input parameters are in terms of inches and dots per inch typically required by printers.

param.name: Filename
param.para: The filename of the snapshot.

param.name: CameraSnapshotFormat
param.para: The file format of the snapshot

param.name: WidthInInches
param.para: The desired width of the snapshot in inches.

param.name: DotsPerInch
param.para: The number of pixels per inch.

Saves a snapshot of the 3D window to a IAgStkGraphicsRaster.

Starts recording a file in the WMV format at the specified bit and frame rate.

param.name: WmvFilename
param.para: The filename of the WMV file.

param.name: VideoBitRate
param.para: A higher value will create larger files with better visual quality than a lower value that will create smaller files with poorer visual quality. A value of 5000 is a good starting point to judge the file size to visual quality trade-off.

param.name: VideoFrameRate
param.para: The frame rate of the video in frames per second. A value of 30 is typical.

summary.para: Starts recording a frame stack. Each frame is saved as a separate image file. The filename of each frame is defined by a prefix followed by a frame number.

param.name: FileDirectory
param.para: The directory in which each frame will be saved.

param.name: FilePrefix
param.para: Used to create the filename of each saved frame.

param.name: CameraSnapshotFileFormat
param.para: The file format of each saved frame.

param.name: StartingFrameNumber
param.para: The number of the first frame

param.name: NumberOfFrameDigits
param.para: The maximum number of digits available for defining the frame number

summary.para: Stops recording.
Gets if recording is occurring or not.
Records the 3D window to either a movie file or to consecutively ordered image files each time the IAgStkGraphicsScene is rendered.

Called automatically when imagery is being removed from the globe.

Settings used by IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay objects. These setting affect all scenes.
Gets or sets the size of the terrain cache in megabytes. It is not recommended to go above 128 megabytes. Large cache sizes can slow down rendering since so much imagery will be rendered.
Gets or sets the size of the imagery cache in megabytes. It is not recommended to go above 128 megabytes. Large cache sizes can slow down rendering since so much imagery will be rendered.

Gets or sets whether per-pixel lighting is used for terrain and imagery. When set to true, per-pixel lighting is used for the best visual quality; when set to false, per vertex-lighting is used, which may provide better performance on older GPUs, but worse visual quality. The default value is true.

Gets or sets whether terrain and imagery are preloaded. When set to true, terrain and imagery are preloaded to get the best visual quality; when set to false, they are not preloaded. For example, the correct resolution globe may not fully load until you stop moving the cursor, but you will be able to move more smoothly around the 3D graphics window.
Settings used by IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay objects. These setting affect all scenes.
Gets or sets the size of the terrain cache in megabytes. It is not recommended to go above 128 megabytes. Large cache sizes can slow down rendering since so much imagery will be rendered.
Gets or sets the size of the imagery cache in megabytes. It is not recommended to go above 128 megabytes. Large cache sizes can slow down rendering since so much imagery will be rendered.

Gets or sets whether per-pixel lighting is used for terrain and imagery. When set to true, per-pixel lighting is used for the best visual quality; when set to false, per vertex-lighting is used, which may provide better performance on older GPUs, but worse visual quality. The default value is true.

Gets or sets whether terrain and imagery are preloaded. When set to true, terrain and imagery are preloaded to get the best visual quality; when set to false, they are not preloaded. For example, the correct resolution globe may not fully load until you stop moving the cursor, but you will be able to move more smoothly around the 3D graphics window.
Lighting in the 3D scene.
Gets or sets whether or not lighting is enabled.
Gets or sets the ambient intensity throughout the scene.
Gets or sets the diffuse intensity from the sun.
Gets or sets the overall brightness for the night light's image overlay, IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.NightOverlay.

Gets or sets the ambient intensity throughout the scene.
Gets or sets the diffuse intensity from the sun.

summary.para: A IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay which IAgStkGraphicsProjection a IAgStkGraphicsRaster onto the IAgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay or surface of the Central Body. You can also enable projection onto IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive by setting IAgStkGraphicsSceneGlobeOverlaySettings.ProjectedRasterModelProjection to true for a Scene. The IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay can also be used with IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream and IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream to stream IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream and other raster data to a IAgStkGraphicsProjection that moves with time.
