member.summary: Gets whether or not the overlay is valid. It can be invalid because of a missing file, corrupt file, unlicensed file, or a file on the incorrect central body.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.DisplayCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets the display condition that controls whether or not the globe overlay is displayed.

summary.para: Gets or sets the IAgStkGraphicsRaster that is IAgStkGraphicsProjection
Gets or sets the IAgStkGraphicsProjection that projects the IAgStkGraphicsRaster

Gets or sets whether to show shadows or not. When set to true, the IAgStkGraphicsRaster will only be projected onto parts of the terrain visible from the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's position. When false, the IAgStkGraphicsRaster will project onto any terrain inside the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's view frustum. Shadows are more realistic, but are slower to render.
Gets or sets whether to show the frustum of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.
Gets or sets whether to show the far plane of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection. If this is set to true, you will see the projected IAgStkGraphicsRaster even when it does not intersect terrain.
Gets or sets the color of the projected IAgStkGraphicsRaster.
Gets or sets the color of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's frustum.
Gets or sets the color of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's far plane.
Gets or sets the color of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's shadow.
Gets or sets the color of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's border.
Gets or sets the width of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's border.
Gets or sets the translucency of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's frustum.
Gets or sets the translucency of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's far plane.
Gets or sets the translucency of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's shadow.
Gets or sets the translucency of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's border.
Gets or sets whether IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.TransparentColor should be used.
Gets or sets the Color that will become transparent.

Gets the direction vectors in the central body's fixed reference frame that define the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's frustum. The collection contains the direction vector down the center of the projection, and the bottom left, bottom right, upper right, and upper left corner direction vectors, in that order. If no direction can be calculated, Cartesian.Zero is returned. Each vector is represented in the array as its individual components in the order x, y, z.
Gets whether or not the video card supports the IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.

A IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay which IAgStkGraphicsProjection a IAgStkGraphicsRaster onto the IAgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay or surface of the Central Body. You can also enable projection onto IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive by setting IAgStkGraphicsSceneGlobeOverlaySettings.ProjectedRasterModelProjection to true for a Scene. The IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay can also be used with IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream and IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream to stream IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream and other raster data to a IAgStkGraphicsProjection that moves with time.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlayClass.Translucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the translucency value for the image. The translucency is between 0 and 1, where 0 is fully opaque and 1 is invisible.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlayClass.UseAltitudeBasedTranslucency
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use altitude to determine the translucency value for the image or not. If <see langword='false' />, the globe image overlay . translucency value is used...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlayClass.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerTranslucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower translucency value for the image when globe image overlay . use altitude based translucency is set to <see langword='true' />. When the altitude of the viewer is at or below globe image overlay ...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlayClass.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperTranslucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper translucency value for the image when globe image overlay . use altitude based translucency is set to <see langword='true' />. When the altitude of the viewer is at or above globe image overlay ...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlayClass.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower altitude bound used to calculate translucency for the image when globe image overlay . use altitude based translucency is set to <see langword='true' />...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlayClass.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper altitude bound used to calculate translucency for the image when globe image overlay . use altitude based translucency is set to <see langword='true' />...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlayClass.MoreThanOneImageGlobeOverlaySupported
member.summary: Gets whether or not the video card allows for more than one image globe overlay globe image overlay to be added.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlayClass.CentralBody
member.summary: Gets the central body that the globe overlay is displayed on. It will return <see langword='null' /> if the globe overlay hasn't been added to a central body.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlayClass.Extent
member.summary: Gets the cartographic extent that represents the area covered by the globe overlay. The array elements are arranged in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

member.summary: Gets the globe overlay role of the globe overlay.

member.summary: Gets the absolute URI specifying the location of the globe overlay.

member.summary: Gets whether or not the overlay is valid. It can be invalid because of a missing file, corrupt file, unlicensed file, or a file on the incorrect central body.

summary.para: Gets or sets the IAgStkGraphicsRaster that is IAgStkGraphicsProjection
Gets or sets the IAgStkGraphicsProjection that projects the IAgStkGraphicsRaster

Gets or sets whether to show shadows or not. When set to true, the IAgStkGraphicsRaster will only be projected onto parts of the terrain visible from the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's position. When false, the IAgStkGraphicsRaster will project onto any terrain inside the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's view frustum. Shadows are more realistic, but are slower to render.
Gets or sets whether to show the frustum of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.
Gets or sets whether to show the far plane of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection. If this is set to true, you will see the projected IAgStkGraphicsRaster even when it does not intersect terrain.
Gets or sets the color of the projected IAgStkGraphicsRaster.
Gets or sets the color of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's frustum.
Gets or sets the color of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's far plane.
Gets or sets the color of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's shadow.
Gets or sets the color of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's border.
Gets or sets the width of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's border.
Gets or sets the translucency of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's frustum.
Gets or sets the translucency of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's far plane.
Gets or sets the translucency of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's shadow.
Gets or sets the translucency of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's border.
Gets or sets whether IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.TransparentColor should be used.
Gets or sets the Color that will become transparent.

Gets the direction vectors in the central body's fixed reference frame that define the IAgStkGraphicsProjection's frustum. The collection contains the direction vector down the center of the projection, and the bottom left, bottom right, upper right, and upper left corner direction vectors, in that order. If no direction can be calculated, Cartesian.Zero is returned. Each vector is represented in the array as its individual components in the order x, y, z.
Gets whether or not the video card supports the IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.

A IAgStkGraphicsProjection represents a simplified camera with a IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Position, IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Orientation, and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewHorizontal and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewVertical. Unlike a real world camera, IAgStkGraphicsProjection has a nearest and farthest viewing distance, as defined by the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.NearPlane and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FarPlane properties. For example, IAgStkGraphicsProjection can be used to represent a UAV's camera, to allow for projecting video onto terrain. See the Raster and Projection Streams Overview for such an example.

Gets or sets the Cartesian defining the position of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection in the central body's fixed reference frame. The array contains the components of the position arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the Unit Quaternion defining the orientation of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection in the central body's fixed reference frame.
Gets or sets the horizontal field of view associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.
Gets or sets the vertical field of view associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.
Gets or sets the near plane associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.
Gets or sets the far plane associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

A IAgStkGraphicsProjection represents a simplified camera with a IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Position, IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Orientation, and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewHorizontal and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewVertical. Unlike a real world camera, IAgStkGraphicsProjection has a nearest and farthest viewing distance, as defined by the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.NearPlane and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FarPlane properties. For example, IAgStkGraphicsProjection can be used to represent a UAV's camera, to allow for projecting video onto terrain. See the Raster and Projection Streams Overview for such an example.

Gets or sets the Cartesian defining the position of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection in the central body's fixed reference frame. The array contains the components of the position arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the Unit Quaternion defining the orientation of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection in the central body's fixed reference frame.
Gets or sets the horizontal field of view associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.
Gets or sets the vertical field of view associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.
Gets or sets the near plane associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.
Gets or sets the far plane associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

A IAgStkGraphicsProjection that is updated dynamically at the specified IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.UpdateDelta. The class can be used to stream projection data to IAgStkGraphicsProjection clients, like IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay. Note to Implementers: When implementing a derived class of ProjectionStream, you must provide an implementation for the Update method.

When overridden in a derived class, updates the projection data associated with the projection stream at the specified time. When the Update method is called, the projection stream contains the current projection data. The time parameter provides the current and next IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time. Return true if the projection data was updated, otherwise return false.

param.name: Time
param.para: The current IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time.

param.name: NextTime
param.para: The next IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time.

summary.para: Gets or sets the update delta of the projection stream in seconds. The IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.UpdateDelta defines the interval at which the IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.Update method will be called. The default IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.UpdateDelta is 0, which will call the IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.Update method every time the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time changes. When animating, this means the IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.Update method would be called on every animation step.

A IAgStkGraphicsProjection that is updated dynamically at the specified IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream.UpdateDelta. The class can be used to stream projection data to IAgStkGraphicsProjection clients, like IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay. Note to Implementers: When implementing a derived class of ProjectionStream, you must provide an implementation for the Update method.

When overridden in a derived class, updates the projection data associated with the projection stream at the specified time. When the Update method is called, the projection stream contains the current projection data. The time parameter provides the current and next IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time. Return true if the projection data was updated, otherwise return false.

param.name: Time
param.para: The current IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time.

param.name: NextTime
param.para: The next IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time.

Settings used by IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay objects. These settings only affect the scene.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not imagery is anti-aliased.
Gets or sets the pixel error for terrain meshes. This is the number of pixels that the rendered terrain is different from the actual terrain data. The default is 2.0 pixels.
Gets or sets the pixel error for imagery. This is the number of pixels that the rendered imagery is different from the actual imagery data. The default is 1.0 pixel.
Gets or sets whether Projected Raster Globe Overlay will also project onto IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.
Settings used by IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay objects. These settings only affect the scene.

Gets or sets the pixel error for imagery. This is the number of pixels that the rendered imagery is different from the actual imagery data. The default is 1.0 pixel.
Gets or sets whether Projected Raster Globe Overlay will also project onto IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.

summary.para: A factory for creating Texture 2D objects from various sources.
Creates a new texture from a Uri, which can be a file, HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP source. See IAgStkGraphicsRaster for a list of supported raster formats.

param.name: Uri
param.para: The Uri of the raster to create the texture from.

summary.para: Creates a new texture from a IAgStkGraphicsRaster.

param.name: Raster
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsRaster to create the texture from.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive altitude interval, in meters, that determines when an object is rendered based on the camera's altitude relative to a Central Body.

Gets or sets the minimum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MinValue to ignore checking the minimum altitude.

Gets or sets the maximum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum altitude.
Gets or sets the Central Body to which the altitude is relative.
Defines an inclusive altitude interval, in meters, that determines when an object is rendered based on the camera's altitude relative to a Central Body.

Gets or sets the minimum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MinValue to ignore checking the minimum altitude.

Gets or sets the maximum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum altitude.
Gets or sets the Central Body to which the altitude is relative.
Implemented by the scene camera. Contains operations to manipulate the camera position, view direction and orientation in the scene.
Gets the visibility of a sphere against the view frustum and any occluding central bodies.

param.name: ReferenceFrame
param.para: The Reference Frame that sphere is in.

param.name: Sphere
param.para: The bounding sphere to be tested.

summary.para: Converts a Cartographic position to a pixel coordinate relative to the globe control. This method can throw an exception. Returns an array containing the pixel coordinate (in the order x, y) of the Cartographic position relative to the globe control. The coordinate can be fractional.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the Cartographic position to convert, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para: Converts a Cartographic position to a pixel coordinate relative to the globe control. This method does not throw an exception.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the Cartographic position to convert, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para: Converts a pixel coordinate relative to the globe control to a Cartographic position. For speed, terrain is not considered; if the pixel coordinate does not intersect the ellipsoid, an exception is thrown. Returns the Cartographic position. The array contains the elements of the position in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the pixel coordinate (in the order x, y) to convert.

summary.para: Converts a pixel coordinate relative to the globe control to a Cartographic position. For speed, terrain is not considered. This method does not throw an exception.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the pixel coordinate (in the order x, y) to convert.

summary.para: Zoom to a central body and use the specified axes for rotation. The reference point is set to the center of the central body and the camera's position is set so the entire central body is visible.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body to be viewed.

param.name: Axes
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes of rotation. IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes will be set to this.

summary.para: Zooms to a Cartographic Extent on the centralBody. The camera will be looking straight down at the extent, with the up vector pointing toward local north. The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes is set to an east-north-up axes at the center of extent.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body that the extent is on.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent to be viewed. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

summary.para: Zooms to a rectangular extent composed of west, south, east, north on the centralBody. The camera will be looking straight down at the extent, with the up vector pointing toward local north. The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes is set to an east-north-up axes at the center of the extent.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body that the extent is on.

param.name: West
param.para: The west longitude of the extent.

param.name: South
param.para: The south latitude of the extent.

param.name: East
param.para: The east longitude of the extent.

param.name: North
param.para: The north latitude of the extent.

summary.para: Gets or sets the position of the camera. The array contains the components of the position arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the reference point of the camera. The array contains the components of the reference point arranged in the order x, y, z.

Gets or sets the up direction of the camera in IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes. The array contains the components of the direction arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the distance the camera position is from the reference point.
Gets or sets camera's axes of rotation.
Gets or sets the axis to constrain the up vector to.
Gets or sets whether the camera can rotate over the constrained up axis. For example, if true the camera would be able to flip over the North Pole and view the globe upside down.
Gets or sets whether the camera's direction is locked.

Gets or sets field of view in radians. The field of view is applied to the larger of the window dimensions. For example, if the window width was 640 and the height was 480, the field of view applies to the horizontal. Use IAgStkGraphicsCamera.HorizontalFieldOfView and IAgStkGraphicsCamera.VerticalFieldOfView to get the horizontal and vertical field of views. Wide fields of views generally show more objects but can look distorted as compared to narrower ones.
Gets the horizontal field of view in radians.
Gets the vertical field of view in radians.
Gets or sets the distance in meters from the camera to the near plane.
Gets or sets the distance in meters from the camera to the far plane.

Gets or sets the value that is used to compute subdivisions of the viewing frustum. A large value will be faster but lose z-value precision. A small value will have better precision but perform slower. The default value of 1000 achieves a good balance between speed and accuracy.

Returns the distance that the Camera's Position should be from the ReferencePoint in order to ensure that a sphere with a 1 meter radius centered at the ReferencePoint fits entirely in the view frustum.
Gets the camera snapshot settings.
Gets the camera video recorder.

Gets the approximate number of meters covered by a pixel that is
1 meter away from the camera. This is commonly multiplied by the distance from the camera to an object to compute the approximate number of meters covered by a pixel of the object.
Gets the Reference Frame that the IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Position is returned in. This Reference Frame is composed of the camera's from Point and the IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes.
Gets the Reference Frame that the IAgStkGraphicsCamera.ReferencePoint is returned in. This Reference Frame is composed of the camera's to Point and the IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes.
Implemented by the scene camera. Contains operations to manipulate the camera position, view direction and orientation in the scene.
Gets the visibility of a sphere against the view frustum and any occluding central bodies.

param.name: ReferenceFrame
param.para: The Reference Frame that sphere is in.

param.name: Sphere
param.para: The bounding sphere to be tested.

summary.para: Converts a Cartographic position to a pixel coordinate relative to the globe control. This method can throw an exception. Returns an array containing the pixel coordinate (in the order x, y) of the Cartographic position relative to the globe control. The coordinate can be fractional.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the Cartographic position to convert, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para: Converts a Cartographic position to a pixel coordinate relative to the globe control. This method does not throw an exception.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the Cartographic position to convert, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para: Converts a pixel coordinate relative to the globe control to a Cartographic position. For speed, terrain is not considered; if the pixel coordinate does not intersect the ellipsoid, an exception is thrown. Returns the Cartographic position. The array contains the elements of the position in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the pixel coordinate (in the order x, y) to convert.

summary.para: Converts a pixel coordinate relative to the globe control to a Cartographic position. For speed, terrain is not considered. This method does not throw an exception.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body of the position.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the pixel coordinate (in the order x, y) to convert.

summary.para: Zoom to a central body and use the specified axes for rotation. The reference point is set to the center of the central body and the camera's position is set so the entire central body is visible.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body to be viewed.

param.name: Axes
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes of rotation. IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes will be set to this.

summary.para: Zooms to a Cartographic Extent on the centralBody. The camera will be looking straight down at the extent, with the up vector pointing toward local north. The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes is set to an east-north-up axes at the center of extent.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body that the extent is on.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent to be viewed. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

summary.para: Zooms to a rectangular extent composed of west, south, east, north on the centralBody. The camera will be looking straight down at the extent, with the up vector pointing toward local north. The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes is set to an east-north-up axes at the center of the extent.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body that the extent is on.

param.name: West
param.para: The west longitude of the extent.

param.name: South
param.para: The south latitude of the extent.

param.name: East
param.para: The east longitude of the extent.

param.name: North
param.para: The north latitude of the extent.

summary.para: Views from a point to a point. Sets the camera's position and the reference point the camera is looking at.

param.name: Axes
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes of rotation. IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes will be set to this.

param.name: CameraPosition
param.para: The Point that will be evaluated at the animation time to get IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Position.

param.name: ReferencePoint
param.para: The Point that will be evaluated at the animation time to get IAgStkGraphicsCamera.ReferencePoint.

param.name: UpAxis
param.para: An array containing the up direction (in the order x, y, z) in axes.

summary.para: Views from a point to a point. Sets the camera's position and the reference point the camera is looking at.

param.name: Axes
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes of rotation. IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes will be set to this.

param.name: CameraPosition
param.para: The Point that will be evaluated at the animation time to get IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Position.

param.name: ReferencePoint
param.para: The Point that will be evaluated at the animation time to get IAgStkGraphicsCamera.ReferencePoint.

summary.para: Views from a point to a direction. Sets the camera's position and the direction vector indicating where the camera is looking.

param.name: Axes
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes of rotation. IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes will be set to this.

param.name: CameraPosition
param.para: The Point that will be evaluated at the animation time to get IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Position.

param.name: Direction
param.para: The Vector that will be evaluated at the animation time to get IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Direction.

param.name: UpAxis
param.para: An array containing the up direction (in the order x, y, z) in axes.

summary.para: Views from a point to a direction. Sets the camera's position and the direction vector indicating where the camera is looking.

param.name: Axes
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes of rotation. IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes will be set to this.

param.name: CameraPosition
param.para: The Point that will be evaluated at the animation time to get IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Position.

param.name: Direction
param.para: The Vector that will be evaluated at the animation time to get IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Direction.

summary.para: Sets the camera's reference point - the point the camera is looking at. The camera's position is the reference point translated by the offset.

param.name: Axes
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes of rotation. IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes will be set to this.

param.name: ReferencePoint
param.para: The Point that will be evaluated at the animation time to get IAgStkGraphicsCamera.ReferencePoint.

param.name: Offset
param.para: An array containing the offset of the camera position (in the order x, y, z) relative to the referencePoint.

param.name: UpAxis
param.para: An array containing the up direction (in the order x, y, z) in axes.

summary.para: Sets the camera's reference point - the point the camera is looking at. The camera's position is the reference point translated by the offset.

param.name: Axes
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes of rotation. IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes will be set to this.

param.name: ReferencePoint
param.para: The Point that will be evaluated at the animation time to get IAgStkGraphicsCamera.ReferencePoint.

param.name: Offset
param.para: An array containing the offset of the camera position (in the order x, y, z) relative to the referencePoint.

summary.para: Sets the camera's reference point - the point the camera is looking at. The camera's position is the reference point translated by the direction vector.

param.name: Axes
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes of rotation. IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes will be set to this.

param.name: ReferencePoint
param.para: The Point that will be evaluated at the animation time to get IAgStkGraphicsCamera.ReferencePoint.

param.name: Direction
param.para: The Vector that will be evaluated at the animation time to get the direction to offset the camera position. This will be equivalent to the negative of IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Direction.

param.name: UpAxis
param.para: An array containing the up direction (in the order x, y, z) in axes.

summary.para: Sets the camera's reference point - the point the camera is looking at. The camera's position is the reference point translated by the direction vector.

param.name: Axes
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes of rotation. IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes will be set to this.

param.name: ReferencePoint
param.para: The Point that will be evaluated at the animation time to get IAgStkGraphicsCamera.ReferencePoint.

param.name: Direction
param.para: The Vector that will be evaluated at the animation time to get the direction to offset the camera position. This will be equivalent to the negative of IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Direction.

summary.para: Gets or sets the position of the camera. The array contains the components of the position arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the reference point of the camera. The array contains the components of the reference point arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the direction of the camera in IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes. The array contains the components of the direction arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the up direction of the camera in IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes. The array contains the components of the direction arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the distance the camera position is from the reference point.
Gets or sets camera's axes of rotation.
Gets or sets the axis to constrain the up vector to.
Gets or sets whether the camera can rotate over the constrained up axis. For example, if true the camera would be able to flip over the North Pole and view the globe upside down.
Gets or sets whether the camera's direction is locked.

Gets or sets field of view in radians. The field of view is applied to the larger of the window dimensions. For example, if the window width was 640 and the height was 480, the field of view applies to the horizontal. Use IAgStkGraphicsCamera.HorizontalFieldOfView and IAgStkGraphicsCamera.VerticalFieldOfView to get the horizontal and vertical field of views. Wide fields of views generally show more objects but can look distorted as compared to narrower ones.
Gets the horizontal field of view in radians.
Gets the vertical field of view in radians.
Gets or sets the distance in meters from the camera to the near plane.
Gets or sets the distance in meters from the camera to the far plane.

Gets or sets the value that is used to compute subdivisions of the viewing frustum. A large value will be faster but lose z-value precision. A small value will have better precision but perform slower. The default value of 1000 achieves a good balance between speed and accuracy.

Returns the distance that the Camera's Position should be from the ReferencePoint in order to ensure that a sphere with a 1 meter radius centered at the ReferencePoint fits entirely in the view frustum.
Gets the camera snapshot settings.
Gets the camera video recorder.

Gets the approximate number of meters covered by a pixel that is
1 meter away from the camera. This is commonly multiplied by the distance from the camera to an object to compute the approximate number of meters covered by a pixel of the object.
Gets the Reference Frame that the IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Position is returned in. This Reference Frame is composed of the camera's from Point and the IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes.
Gets the Reference Frame that the IAgStkGraphicsCamera.ReferencePoint is returned in. This Reference Frame is composed of the camera's to Point and the IAgStkGraphicsCamera.Axes.

The graphical properties associated with a particular Central Body. Changing the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics will affect how the associated Central Body is rendered in a IAgStkGraphicsScene. For instance, to show or hide the Central Body, use the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Show property. IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics also contains the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Terrain and IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery for the associated Central Body.
Gets or sets the Color of the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene.
Gets or sets the specular Color of the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The specular color is associated with the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.SpecularOverlay.

Gets or sets the shininess of the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The shininess affects the size and brightness of specular reflection associated with the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.SpecularOverlay.
Gets or sets whether the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery for Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene is shown or hidden.
Gets or sets whether the Central Body is shown or hidden in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. This only affects the Central Body itself, not the IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive that are associated with it.
Gets or sets whether a label with the name of the Central Body should be rendered in the IAgStkGraphicsScene when the IAgStkGraphicsCamera is at certain distance away from the Central Body.

Gets or sets the altitude, in meters, that all IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Terrain and IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery will be offset from the surface of the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene.

Gets or sets the base IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.BaseOverlay is always rendered before any other IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery. By default, the Earth, Sun, and Moon Central Body will have a default IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.BaseOverlay image is loaded by STK Engine when the IAgStkGraphicsScene is created.

Gets or sets the night IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.NightOverlay is displayed only on parts of the Central Body that are not in sun light. The intensity of the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.NightOverlay for all scenes can be adjusted with the scene's IAgStkGraphicsLighting.NightLightsIntensity property.

Gets or sets the specular IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.SpecularOverlay is displayed only in the specular highlight of the Central Body.
Gets the collection of IAgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene.
Gets the collection of IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene.

The graphical properties associated with a particular Central Body. Changing the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics will affect how the associated Central Body is rendered in a IAgStkGraphicsScene. For instance, to show or hide the Central Body, use the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Show property. IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics also contains the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Terrain and IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery for the associated Central Body.
Gets or sets the Color of the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene.
Gets or sets the specular Color of the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The specular color is associated with the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.SpecularOverlay.

Gets or sets the shininess of the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The shininess affects the size and brightness of specular reflection associated with the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.SpecularOverlay.
Gets or sets whether the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery for Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene is shown or hidden.
Gets or sets whether the Central Body is shown or hidden in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. This only affects the Central Body itself, not the IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive that are associated with it.
Gets or sets whether a label with the name of the Central Body should be rendered in the IAgStkGraphicsScene when the IAgStkGraphicsCamera is at certain distance away from the Central Body.

Gets or sets the altitude, in meters, that all IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Terrain and IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery will be offset from the surface of the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene.

Gets or sets the base IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.BaseOverlay is always rendered before any other IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.Imagery. By default, the Earth, Sun, and Moon Central Body will have a default IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.BaseOverlay image is loaded by STK Engine when the IAgStkGraphicsScene is created.

Gets or sets the night IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.NightOverlay is displayed only on parts of the Central Body that are not in sun light. The intensity of the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.NightOverlay for all scenes can be adjusted with the scene's IAgStkGraphicsLighting.NightLightsIntensity property.

Gets or sets the specular IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene. The IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics.SpecularOverlay is displayed only in the specular highlight of the Central Body.
Gets the collection of IAgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene.
Gets the collection of IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay associated with the Central Body in the IAgStkGraphicsScene.

A composite of display conditions combined using a AgEStkGraphicsBinaryLogicOperation. For example, several IAgStkGraphicsTimeIntervalDisplayCondition objects can be added to a composite. The composite can then be assigned to an object so the object is only rendered when the current animation time is within one of the time intervals.

Requests enough memory for the composite to contain at least count display conditions. IAgStkGraphicsCompositeDisplayCondition.Count will not be affected but IAgStkGraphicsCompositeDisplayCondition.Capacity may be.

param.name: Count
param.para: The number of display conditions to request memory for.

summary.para: Adds a display condition to the end of the composite.

param.name: DisplayCondition
param.para: The display condition to add to the composite.

param.name: Negate
param.para:
When true, a logical
not is applied to displayCondition when the composite display condition is evaluated.

summary.para: Adds a display condition to the end of the composite.

param.name: DisplayCondition
param.para: The display condition to add to the composite.

summary.para: Inserts a display condition at the given zero-based index, shifting existing display conditions.

param.name: Index
param.para: The zero-based index to insert the display condition at.

param.name: DisplayCondition
param.para: The display condition to insert into the composite.

param.name: Negate
param.para:
When true, a logical
not is applied to displayCondition when the composite display condition is evaluated.

summary.para: Inserts a display condition at the given zero-based index, shifting existing display conditions.

param.name: Index
param.para: The zero-based index to insert the display condition at.

param.name: DisplayCondition
param.para: The display condition to insert into the composite.

summary.para: Removes a display condition from the composite.

remarks.para:
This call has no effect if displayCondition is
null or does not exist in the composite.

param.name: DisplayCondition
param.para: The display condition to remove from the composite.

summary.para: Removes the display condition at the given zero-based index, shifting existing display conditions.

param.name: Index
param.para: The zero-based index of the display condition to remove.

summary.para: Removes all display conditions from the composite.

remarks.para:
An empty composite display condition evaluates to
true, so when an empty composite is assigned to an object, the object is always rendered.

summary.para:
Determines if a logical
not operation is applied to a display condition in the composite.

remarks.para: Display conditions can be in more than one composite at a time. Each composite may or may not negate the display condition. So a display condition that is negated in one composite is not necessarily negated in another.

param.name: DisplayCondition
param.para: The display condition to check.

summary.para:
Sets if a logical
not operation is applied to a display condition in the composite when the composite is evaluated.

remarks.para: Display conditions can be in more than one composite at a time. Each composite may or may not negate the display condition. So a display condition that is negated in one composite is not necessarily negated in another.

param.name: DisplayCondition
param.para:
The display condition to set the logical
not operation for.

param.name: Negate
param.para: True if displayCondition should be negated.

summary.para:
Determines if a logical
not operation is applied to a display condition in the composite.

remarks.para: Display conditions can be in more than one composite at a time. Each composite may or may not negate the display condition. So a display condition that is negated in one composite is not necessarily negated in another.

param.name: Index
param.para: The zero-based index of the display condition to check.

summary.para:
Sets if a logical
not operation is applied to a display condition in the composite when the composite is evaluated.

remarks.para: Display conditions can be in more than one composite at a time. Each composite may or may not negate the display condition. So a display condition that is negated in one composite is not necessarily negated in another.

param.name: Index
param.para:
The zero-based index of the display condition to set the logical
not operation for.

param.name: Negate
param.para: True if the display condition with the given index should be negated.

summary.para: Gets the number of display conditions in the composite.
Gets the number of display conditions for which memory has been allocated. This will always be greater or equal to IAgStkGraphicsCompositeDisplayCondition.Count.

Gets or sets the binary logic operation applied to all display conditions in the composite when the composite is evaluated. To combine logical
and and
or operations in the same expression, create composites containing composites.

summary.para: A primitive that is composed of multiple other primitives. Since composites can contain other composites, they are commonly used to build hierarchies of primitives to efficiently evaluate display conditions.
Primitives in a composite must have the same IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.
Adds a primitive to the composite.

param.name: Primitive
param.para: The primitive to add to the composite.

summary.para: Removes a primitive from the composite.

remarks.para: If primitive does not exist in the composite, this call is ignored.

param.name: Primitive
param.para: The primitive to remove from the composite.

summary.para: Determines whether the composite contains a primitive.

param.name: Primitive
param.para: The primitive to locate in the composite.

summary.para: Removes all primitives from the composite.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsCompositePrimitive.ReferenceFrame
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference frame this primitive is defined and rendered in.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsCompositePrimitive.BoundingSphere
member.summary: Gets or sets the bounding sphere that encompasses the primitive. The center is defined in the primitive's reference frame.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsCompositePrimitive.AutomaticallyComputeBoundingSphere
member.summary: Gets or sets if the primitive's bounding sphere is automatically computed.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsCompositePrimitive.DisplayCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets the display condition that determines if the primitive should be <topic name='Glossary' anchor='Render'>rendered</topic>. Both this and display must evaluate to true for the primitive to be rendered.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsCompositePrimitive.Display
member.summary: Gets or sets if the primitive should be <topic name='Glossary' anchor='Render'>rendered</topic>. Both this and display condition must evaluate to true for the primitive to be rendered.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsCompositePrimitive.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive's color.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsCompositePrimitive.Translucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive's translucency. Translucency is between 0 and 1, where 0 is opaque and 1 is transparent.

summary.para: Gets the number of primitives in the composite.

Gets or sets the sort order for translucent primitives in this composite. This determines a trade-off between rendering speed and quality. It is only recommended to use AgEStkGraphicsPrimitivesSortOrder when translucent primitives along the same line of sight cause blending artifacts.

A IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay that shows an image.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.CentralBody
member.summary: Gets the central body that the globe overlay is displayed on. It will return <see langword='null' /> if the globe overlay hasn't been added to a central body.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.Extent
member.summary: Gets the cartographic extent that represents the area covered by the globe overlay. The array elements are arranged in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.Role
member.summary: Gets the globe overlay role of the globe overlay.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.UriAsString
member.summary: Gets the absolute URI specifying the location of the globe overlay.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.IsValid
member.summary: Gets whether or not the overlay is valid. It can be invalid because of a missing file, corrupt file, unlicensed file, or a file on the incorrect central body.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.DisplayCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets the display condition that controls whether or not the globe overlay is displayed.

summary.para: Gets or sets the translucency value for the image. The translucency is between 0 and 1, where 0 is fully opaque and 1 is invisible.

Gets or sets whether to use altitude to determine the translucency value for the image or not. If false, the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.Translucency value is used. If true, the translucency will be determined by the values of IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerTranslucency, IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperTranslucency, IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude, and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude.

Gets or sets the lower translucency value for the image when IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.UseAltitudeBasedTranslucency is set to true. When the altitude of the viewer is at or below IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude, the image will have the translucency specified by this property, and will be linearly interpolated at altitude values between IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude.

Gets or sets the upper translucency value for the image when IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.UseAltitudeBasedTranslucency is set to true. When the altitude of the viewer is at or above IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude, the image will have the translucency specified by this property, and will be linearly interpolated at altitude values between IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude.

Gets or sets the lower altitude bound used to calculate translucency for the image when IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.UseAltitudeBasedTranslucency is set to true. When the altitude of the viewer is at or below this value, the image will have the translucency specified by IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerTranslucency, and will be linearly interpolated at altitude values between IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude.

Gets or sets the upper altitude bound used to calculate translucency for the image when IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.UseAltitudeBasedTranslucency is set to true. When the altitude of the viewer is at or above this value, the image will have the translucency specified by IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperTranslucency, and will be linearly interpolated at altitude values between IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyUpperAltitude and IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay.GlobeImageOverlay.AltitudeBasedTranslucencyLowerAltitude.
Gets whether or not the video card allows for more than one image globe overlay IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay to be added.

The great arc interpolator computes interpolated positions along a great arc. A great arc is the shortest path between two positions on an ellipsoid.

summary.para: Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster derived from the luminance of the raster's color bands.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster derived from the luminance of the raster's color bands.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster based on the value of its first pixel. All pixels in the source raster that are the same color as the first pixel will be made transparent.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster based on the value of its first pixel. All pixels in the source raster that are the same color as the first pixel will be made transparent.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster derived from the color bands or alpha of another raster. This filter can be used to apply an alpha mask to the source raster.
Gets or sets the raster that the source raster will use to derive an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster derived from the color bands or alpha of another raster. This filter can be used to apply an alpha mask to the source raster.
Gets or sets the raster that the source raster will use to derive an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band.
Extracts a band or set of bands from the source raster. The IAgStkGraphicsBandExtractFilter.ExtractFormat property specifies the bands and the order of the bands that will be extracted.
Gets or sets the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat containing the bands and the order of the bands that will be extracted.
Extracts a band or set of bands from the source raster. The IAgStkGraphicsBandExtractFilter.ExtractFormat property specifies the bands and the order of the bands that will be extracted.
Gets or sets the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat containing the bands and the order of the bands that will be extracted.

Reorders or swizzles the bands of the source raster to match the band order of the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat specified by the IAgStkGraphicsBandOrderFilter.BandOrder property. When IAgStkGraphicsBandOrderFilter.MaintainRasterFormat is true, the source raster's format is maintained after swizzling.
Gets or sets the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat indicating the desired order of the bands in the source raster.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to maintain the source raster's format after the filter is applied. When true, the source raster's format is maintained after swizzling.

Applies convolution to the source raster. Convolution is the modification of a pixel's value based on the values of its surrounding pixels. The IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel is the numerical matrix that is applied to each pixel in this process. The convolution operation is discussed in more detail in numerous texts on image processing and useful convolution kernels are widely available from various sources.
Gets or sets the divisor for the result of the convolution kernel operation.
Gets or sets the offset for the result of the convolution kernel operation. The value is added to the result of the operation.

Gets or sets the convolution kernel of the filter. The array contains the 9 elements of the IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel of the convolution matrix. The elements are provided as the entire first row, followed by the entire second row, followed by the entire third row, each from left to right.

The Activator class provides methods to load COM plugins that implement projection and raster streaming. For more information about the projection and raster plugins, see the STK Programming Interface.

A raster dataset. A raster consists of one or more AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand, or sets of values, which are most commonly associated with colors when the raster represents an image. For instance, a typical color image contains three sets of values, or bands (red, green, and blue) which define the color of pixels within the image. The following raster image formats can be read by the raster class: BMP, ECW, IMG, JP2, NTF, NITF, PNG, SID, TIF, TIFF, JPG, JPEG, PPM, PGM, CLDS, and TGA. To create a texture from a raster, pass it to the IAgStkGraphicsTexture2DFactory.FromRaster method.

The attributes describing a IAgStkGraphicsRaster dataset. IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes define the memory layout of a IAgStkGraphicsRaster, and includes properties defining the order of each AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand that the raster contains, as specified by the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat. It also describes the type of data, or AgEStkGraphicsRasterType of the contained bands, the IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes.Height and IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes.Width of the raster in pixels, the IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes.RowAlignment of the raster, and other relevant properties.

Gets the stride or scan/row width in bytes of the raster data.

A filter for processing IAgStkGraphicsRaster datasets. RasterFilter is the base class for all raster filters. A filter applies a transformation to a source raster either by modifying that raster directly, or returning a new instance of that raster that has the filter applied to it. To apply a filter to a raster, use the IAgStkGraphicsRaster.Apply or IAgStkGraphicsRaster.ApplyInPlace methods. Common filters include color transformations, like IAgStkGraphicsBrightnessFilter and IAgStkGraphicsGammaCorrectionFilter, and IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter based filters like IAgStkGraphicsSharpenFilter and IAgStkGraphicsEdgeDetectFilter.

A filter for processing IAgStkGraphicsRaster datasets. RasterFilter is the base class for all raster filters. A filter applies a transformation to a source raster either by modifying that raster directly, or returning a new instance of that raster that has the filter applied to it. To apply a filter to a raster, use the IAgStkGraphicsRaster.Apply or IAgStkGraphicsRaster.ApplyInPlace methods. Common filters include color transformations, like IAgStkGraphicsBrightnessFilter and IAgStkGraphicsGammaCorrectionFilter, and IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter based filters like IAgStkGraphicsSharpenFilter and IAgStkGraphicsEdgeDetectFilter.

A raster, the data of which, is updated dynamically at the specified IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.UpdateDelta. The class can be used to stream video and other dynamic raster data to textures and other IAgStkGraphicsRaster clients. Note to Implementers: When implementing a derived class of RasterStream, you must provide an implementation for the IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.Update method. The IAgStkGraphicsRaster.Attributes property of the Raster should be set in the constructor of the derived class.

summary.para: When overridden in a derived class, updates the raster data associated with the raster stream at the specified time. When the IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.Update method is called, the raster stream contains a raster data buffer defined by the current IAgStkGraphicsRaster.Attributes of the stream for updating the raster data. The time parameter provides the current and next IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time. Return true if the raster data was updated, otherwise return false.

param.name: Time
param.para: The current IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time.

param.name: NextTime
param.para: The next IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time.

summary.para: Gets or sets the update delta of the raster stream in seconds. The IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.UpdateDelta defines the interval at which the IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.Update method will be called. The default IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.UpdateDelta is 0, which will call the IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.Update method every time the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time changes. When animating, this means the IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream.Update method would be called on every animation step.

summary.para: Reinitializes the video stream from a Uri, which can be a file, HTTP, RTP, UDP, or TCP source. See the Video Streams Overview for a list of supported video formats and Uri usage.

param.name: Uri
param.para: The Uri of the video.

summary.para: Begins playing the video when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback.
Pauses the video when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback.

Stops the video when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback. Stopping the video will seek to the first frame and pause playback. Use the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Play method to begin playing the video again.
Seeks the video to its first frame and begins playing the video when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback.

summary.para: Gets the Uri of the video.
Gets or sets the AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback mode of the video.

Gets or sets the frame rate of the video when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback. If this property is not set, the internal framerate of the video is used.
Gets or sets the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time at which the video will begin playing when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback.
Gets or sets the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager time at which the video will stop playing when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback.

Gets or sets the start time of the video in seconds. Changing the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.StartTime property also changes the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.StartFrame property to the frame in the video that corresponds to the specified time.

Gets or sets the end time of the video in seconds. Changing the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.EndTime property also changes the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.EndFrame property to the frame in the video that corresponds to the specified time.

Gets or sets the start frame of the video. Changing the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.StartFrame property also changes the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.StartTime property to the time in the video that corresponds to the specified frame.

Gets or sets the end frame of the video. Changing the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.EndFrame property also changes the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.EndTime property to the time in the video that corresponds to the specified frame.
Gets or sets whether the video will loop when it reaches its last frame when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback.

Gets whether or not the video is playing. Use the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Play, IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Pause, IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Stop, and IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Reset methods to control the playback of the video when the IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream.Playback property is set to AgEStkGraphicsVideoPlayback.

Gets or sets the thread processing yield time for asynchronous streaming of video over common protocols like udp. Setting a high value may increase performance, but may cause frames or packets to drop, effecting visual quality. A lower value will ensure high priority processing of the stream, and thus less visual degradation, but may affect performance.

Gets or sets a value indicating the buffering limit for packets when processing a video stream. Increasing this value will provide more buffering of the video stream when frame processing cannot keep up, but has memory implications and may result in the video falling behind, or eventual visual degradation, if the frame processing load is not lessened.

Gets or sets a value indicating if frames should be dropped if video processing can not keep up with a video stream. If this is set to false, the video quality may degrade when the processing load is too high. Alternatively, when set to true, frames will be dropped, but each frame that is processed should have an improved visual quality.

Renders one or more markers in the 3D scene. Markers are 2D images that always face the viewer which can be sized in pixels or meters. Markers are also referred to as sprites or billboards.
For best performance, avoid creating lots of batches with only a few markers each. See the Batching Performance Overview.
Defines the positions of markers in a marker batch. The markers are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions (in the order x, y, z) for markers in the marker batch.

summary.para: Defines the positions and optional per-marker parameters of markers in a marker batch. The markers are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous markers. To update a subset of markers, use IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.SetPartial.

When a per-marker parameter is not specified in optionalParameters, its corresponding per-batch value is used. For example, if optionalParameters did not have a texture array defined with IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters.SetTextures, each marker uses the batch's IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Texture.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions (in the order x, y, z) for markers in the marker batch.

param.name: OptionalParameters
param.para: Optional per-marker parameters corresponding to positions. Each per-marker parameter must have the same number of elements as positions.

summary.para: Defines the positions and optional per-marker parameters of markers in a marker batch. The markers are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame. renderPassHint is provided for efficiency.

remarks.para:
Calling this method with a renderPassHint of
Unknown is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Set with just positions and optionalParameters. When a more specific renderPassHint is used, this method can be more efficient.
See IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions (in the order x, y, z) for markers in the marker batch.

param.name: OptionalParameters
param.para: Optional per-marker parameters corresponding to positions. Each per-marker parameter must have the same number of elements as positions.

param.name: RenderPassHint
param.para: An optimization hint indicating the AgEStkGraphicsRenderPass implied by per-marker colors defined in optionalParameters.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions of markers in a marker batch using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Set.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions for markers in the marker batch, in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions and optional per-marker parameters of markers in a marker batch using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Set.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions for markers in the marker batch, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: OptionalParameters
param.para: Optional per-marker parameters corresponding to positions. Each per-marker parameter must have the same number of elements as positions.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions and optional per-marker parameters of markers in a marker batch using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. renderPassHint is provided for efficiency. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Set.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions for markers in the marker batch, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: OptionalParameters
param.para: Optional per-marker parameters corresponding to positions. Each per-marker parameter must have the same number of elements as positions.

param.name: RenderPassHint
param.para: An optimization hint indicating the AgEStkGraphicsRenderPass implied by per-marker colors defined in optionalParameters.

summary.para: Updates a subset of marker positions in a marker batch.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) used to update a subset of positions in the marker batch.

param.para: An array of integers containing the indices into positions. A set of x, y, and z elements is considered a single index.

summary.para: Updates a subset of marker positions in a marker batch.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) used to update a subset of positions in the marker batch.

param.name: Indices
param.para: An array of integers containing the indices into positions. A set of x, y, and z elements is considered a single index.

summary.para: Updates a subset of marker positions and/or per-marker parameters in a marker batch.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) used to update a subset of positions in the marker batch.

param.name: OptionalParameters
param.para: Optional per-marker parameters corresponding to positions. Each per-marker parameter must have the same number of elements as positions.

param.name: Indices
param.para: An array of integers containing the indices into positions. A set of x, y, and z elements is considered a single index.

summary.para: For convenience. Updates a subset of positions in a marker batch using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive's color.

summary.para: Gets the source used for the size of markers in the batch.
Gets the order in which markers in the marker batch are sorted before rendering.
Gets the primitive's AgEStkGraphicsSetHint. See the Set Hint Performance Overview for selecting an appropriate value to construct the primitive with.
Gets the rendering method used to render the marker batch.
Gets or sets the pass during which the marker batch is rendered.
Gets or sets the scale applied to the radius of this primitive's bounding sphere.

Gets or sets a IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition that is evaluated per marker in the marker batch during rendering. This is different than IAgStkGraphicsDisplayCondition, which is evaluated once for the entire marker batch. When
DistanceDisplayConditionPerMarker is
null, no per marker display condition is evaluated.
Gets or sets the per-batch texture, which is applied to each marker in the batch.
Gets or sets the unit that each marker's size is defined in.
Gets or sets the per-batch size, which is applied to each marker in the batch. The array contains one width followed by one height.
Gets or sets the per-batch origin, which is applied to each marker in the batch.
Gets or sets the per-batch pixel offset, which is applied to each marker in the batch. The array contains one x pixel offset followed by one y pixel offset.
Gets or sets the per-batch eye offset, which is applied to each marker in the batch. The array contains the components of the eye offset in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the per-batch rotation angle, in radians, which is applied to each marker in the batch.
Gets or sets the per-batch texture coordinate, which is applied to each marker in the batch. The array contains the texture coordinates arranged in the order s, t, p, q.
Gets or sets whether the screen space position of each marker is aligned to a pixel.
Gets or sets whether the primitive is rendered in wireframe. This is useful for debugging.

Gets or sets whether individual marker indices will be included in the IAgStkGraphicsPickResult returned from the IAgStkGraphicsScene's
Pick method. Each marker index that is picked will be returned as a IAgStkGraphicsBatchPrimitiveIndex.
Gets or sets the filter used for per-marker or per-batch textures.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom value associated with this primitive.

summary.para: Renders one or more markers in the 3D scene. Markers are 2D images that always face the viewer which can be sized in pixels or meters. Markers are also referred to as sprites or billboards.
For best performance, avoid creating lots of batches with only a few markers each. See the Batching Performance Overview.
Defines the positions of markers in a marker batch. The markers are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions (in the order x, y, z) for markers in the marker batch.

summary.para: Defines the positions and optional per-marker parameters of markers in a marker batch. The markers are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous markers. To update a subset of markers, use IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.SetPartial.

When a per-marker parameter is not specified in optionalParameters, its corresponding per-batch value is used. For example, if optionalParameters did not have a texture array defined with IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters.SetTextures, each marker uses the batch's IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Texture.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions (in the order x, y, z) for markers in the marker batch.

param.name: OptionalParameters
param.para: Optional per-marker parameters corresponding to positions. Each per-marker parameter must have the same number of elements as positions.

summary.para: Defines the positions and optional per-marker parameters of markers in a marker batch. The markers are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame. renderPassHint is provided for efficiency.

remarks.para:
Calling this method with a renderPassHint of
Unknown is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Set with just positions and optionalParameters. When a more specific renderPassHint is used, this method can be more efficient.
See IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions (in the order x, y, z) for markers in the marker batch.

param.name: OptionalParameters
param.para: Optional per-marker parameters corresponding to positions. Each per-marker parameter must have the same number of elements as positions.

param.name: RenderPassHint
param.para: An optimization hint indicating the AgEStkGraphicsRenderPass implied by per-marker colors defined in optionalParameters.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions of markers in a marker batch using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Set.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions for markers in the marker batch, in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.
