member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitiveClass.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom value associated with this primitive.

summary.para:
Optional per-marker parameters for IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive that overrides the marker batch's per-batch parameters. Define per-marker parameters by creating an instance of
MarkerBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then calling the desired methods to define per-marker parameters, and finally passing the object to the marker batch's
Set or
SetPartial method.
Defines a collection of textures, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para: Per-marker textures override the per-batch texture. Therefore, when per-marker textures are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Texture is not used.

param.name: Textures
param.para:
An array containing a Texture 2D for each marker in the batch. There must be one texture for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of sizes, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para: To use user-defined per-marker sizes, the marker batch must be initialized with AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSizeSource, otherwise each marker's size is it's texture's size.
The size may be interpreted to be pixels or meters depending on IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.SizeUnit.
Per-marker sizes override the per-batch size. Therefore, when per-marker sizes are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Size is not used.

param.name: Sizes
param.para:
An array containing the size (in the order width, height) for each marker in the batch. There must be one width followed by one height for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of colors, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para:
If per-marker or per-batch textures are used, the texture is modulated with the per-marker color defined with
SetColors.
Per-marker colors override the per-batch color. Therefore, when per-marker colors are defined with this method, the marker batch's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Color property is ignored.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of the color for each marker in the batch. There must be one color for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method. In .NET a Color should be translated a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: Defines a collection of origins, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para: The origin defines where the marker is placed relative to its position.
Per-marker origins override the per-batch origin. Therefore, when per-marker origins are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Origin is not used.

param.name: Origins
param.para:
An array containing a AgEStkGraphicsOrigin element for each marker in the batch. There must be one origin for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of pixel offsets, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para:
The pixel offset defines a screen-space translation for a marker from its position. Positive
x values translate to the right and positive
y values translate up. This is commonly used when more than one primitive is located at the same position. For example, if a marker in a marker batch and a point in a point batch have the same position, the marker may have a pixel offset applied to it so it doesn't overlap the point.
Per-marker pixel offsets override the per-batch pixel offset. Therefore, when per-marker pixel offsets are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.PixelOffset is not used.

param.name: PixelOffsets
param.para:
An array containing a x pixel offset and a y pixel offset for each marker in the batch. There must be one x pixel offset followed by one y pixel offset for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of eye offsets, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para:
Eye offsets define an eye-space translation in meters. In eye-space, the
x axis points to the right, the
y axis points up, and the
z axis points into the screen. Eye offsets are commonly used when more than one primitive is located at the same position. For example, if a marker in a marker batch is located at the same position as a model primitive, an eye offset in the positive
y direction can be applied to the marker so it appears a specified number of meters above the model.
Per-marker eye offsets override the per-batch eye offset. Therefore, when per-marker eye offsets are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.EyeOffset is not used.

param.name: EyeOffsets
param.para:
An array containing the eye offsets (in the order x, y, z) for each marker in the batch. There must be one x eye offset, followed by one y eye offset, follow by one z eye offset for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of rotation angles in radians, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para: Positive rotation angles rotate counter-clockwise in screen-space.
Per-marker rotation angles override the per-batch rotation angle. Therefore, when per-marker rotation angles are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Rotation is not used.

param.name: RotationAngles
param.para:
An array containing a rotation angle for each marker in the batch. There must be one rotation angle for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of texture coordinates, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para:
Each texture coordinate component is in the range
[0, 1]. The
s and
t components define the bottom left corner and the
p and
q components define the upper right corner. When a marker uses an entire texture, the texture coordinates are
[s, t, p, q] = [0, 0, 1, 1].

Per-marker texture coordinates are used to implement a technique called a texture atlas. Instead of creating several small textures and assigning each texture to markers using per-marker textures, one large texture containing all the images is made. This texture is assigned to the marker batch and each marker is given texture coordinates that index the correct part of the texture. This can lead to better performance due to the reduced number of costly texture changes during rendering.

Per-marker texture coordinates override the per-batch texture coordinate. Therefore, when per-marker texture coordinates are defined with this method, the marker batch's IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.TextureCoordinate property is ignored.

param.name: TextureCoordinates
param.para:
An array containing the texture coordinates (in the order s, t, p, q) for each marker in the batch. There must be one s texture coordinate, followed by one t texture coordinate, followed by one p texture coordinate, followed by one q texture coordinate for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para:
Optional per-marker parameters for IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive that overrides the marker batch's per-batch parameters. Define per-marker parameters by creating an instance of
MarkerBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then calling the desired methods to define per-marker parameters, and finally passing the object to the marker batch's
Set or
SetPartial method.
Defines a collection of textures, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para: Per-marker textures override the per-batch texture. Therefore, when per-marker textures are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Texture is not used.

param.name: Textures
param.para:
An array containing a Texture 2D for each marker in the batch. There must be one texture for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of sizes, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para: To use user-defined per-marker sizes, the marker batch must be initialized with AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSizeSource, otherwise each marker's size is it's texture's size.
The size may be interpreted to be pixels or meters depending on IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.SizeUnit.
Per-marker sizes override the per-batch size. Therefore, when per-marker sizes are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Size is not used.

param.name: Sizes
param.para:
An array containing the size (in the order width, height) for each marker in the batch. There must be one width followed by one height for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of colors, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para:
If per-marker or per-batch textures are used, the texture is modulated with the per-marker color defined with
SetColors.
Per-marker colors override the per-batch color. Therefore, when per-marker colors are defined with this method, the marker batch's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Color property is ignored.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of the color for each marker in the batch. There must be one color for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method. In .NET a Color should be translated a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: Defines a collection of origins, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para: The origin defines where the marker is placed relative to its position.
Per-marker origins override the per-batch origin. Therefore, when per-marker origins are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Origin is not used.

param.name: Origins
param.para:
An array containing a AgEStkGraphicsOrigin element for each marker in the batch. There must be one origin for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of pixel offsets, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para:
The pixel offset defines a screen-space translation for a marker from its position. Positive
x values translate to the right and positive
y values translate up. This is commonly used when more than one primitive is located at the same position. For example, if a marker in a marker batch and a point in a point batch have the same position, the marker may have a pixel offset applied to it so it doesn't overlap the point.
Per-marker pixel offsets override the per-batch pixel offset. Therefore, when per-marker pixel offsets are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.PixelOffset is not used.

param.name: PixelOffsets
param.para:
An array containing a x pixel offset and a y pixel offset for each marker in the batch. There must be one x pixel offset followed by one y pixel offset for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of eye offsets, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para:
Eye offsets define an eye-space translation in meters. In eye-space, the
x axis points to the right, the
y axis points up, and the
z axis points into the screen. Eye offsets are commonly used when more than one primitive is located at the same position. For example, if a marker in a marker batch is located at the same position as a model primitive, an eye offset in the positive
y direction can be applied to the marker so it appears a specified number of meters above the model.
Per-marker eye offsets override the per-batch eye offset. Therefore, when per-marker eye offsets are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.EyeOffset is not used.

param.name: EyeOffsets
param.para:
An array containing the eye offsets (in the order x, y, z) for each marker in the batch. There must be one x eye offset, followed by one y eye offset, follow by one z eye offset for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of rotation angles in radians, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para: Positive rotation angles rotate counter-clockwise in screen-space.
Per-marker rotation angles override the per-batch rotation angle. Therefore, when per-marker rotation angles are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.Rotation is not used.

param.name: RotationAngles
param.para:
An array containing a rotation angle for each marker in the batch. There must be one rotation angle for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of texture coordinates, one for each marker in the batch.

remarks.para:
Each texture coordinate component is in the range
[0, 1]. The
s and
t components define the bottom left corner and the
p and
q components define the upper right corner. When a marker uses an entire texture, the texture coordinates are
[s, t, p, q] = [0, 0, 1, 1].

Per-marker texture coordinates are used to implement a technique called a texture atlas. Instead of creating several small textures and assigning each texture to markers using per-marker textures, one large texture containing all the images is made. This texture is assigned to the marker batch and each marker is given texture coordinates that index the correct part of the texture. This can lead to better performance due to the reduced number of costly texture changes during rendering.

Per-marker texture coordinates override the per-batch texture coordinate. Therefore, when per-marker texture coordinates are defined with this method, the marker batch's IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive.TextureCoordinate property is ignored.

param.name: TextureCoordinates
param.para:
An array containing the texture coordinates (in the order s, t, p, q) for each marker in the batch. There must be one s texture coordinate, followed by one t texture coordinate, followed by one p texture coordinate, followed by one q texture coordinate for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: The model primitive loads and renders COLLADA (DAE) and AGI MDL (MDL) models.
For convenience. Loads a COLLADA (DAE) or AGI MDL (MDL) model using a file path.

remarks.para: If the model includes articulations, they can be accessed using IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Articulations.

If the model's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.AutomaticallyComputeBoundingSphere property is
true, IAgStkGraphicsBoundingSphere is set to fit around the model. Otherwise, it is the caller's responsibility to update the model's IAgStkGraphicsBoundingSphere to a sphere that encompasses the model.
Loading a new model does not change the model's IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Position, IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Orientation, or IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Scale.

param.name: Uri
param.para: The path to the model file.

summary.para: For convenience. Loads a COLLADA (DAE) or AGI MDL (MDL) model using a file path.

remarks.para: If the model includes articulations, they can be accessed using IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Articulations.

If the model's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.AutomaticallyComputeBoundingSphere property is
true, IAgStkGraphicsBoundingSphere is set to fit around the model. Otherwise, it is the caller's responsibility to update the model's IAgStkGraphicsBoundingSphere to a sphere that encompasses the model.
Loading a new model does not change the model's IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Position, IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Orientation, or IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Scale.

param.name: Uri
param.para: The path to the model file.

param.name: UpAxis
param.para: The axis representing the up direction of the model file.

summary.para: For convenience. Sets the Cartographic position of the model. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This also sets IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Position.

remarks.para: centralBody is used to convert the position to Cartesian.
See IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Position for a full discussion.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the new Cartographic position of the model provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.ReferenceFrame
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference frame this primitive is defined and rendered in.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.BoundingSphere
member.summary: Gets or sets the bounding sphere that encompasses the primitive. The center is defined in the primitive's reference frame.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.AutomaticallyComputeBoundingSphere
member.summary: Gets or sets if the primitive's bounding sphere is automatically computed.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.DisplayCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets the display condition that determines if the primitive should be <topic name='Glossary' anchor='Render'>rendered</topic>. Both this and display must evaluate to true for the primitive to be rendered.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Display
member.summary: Gets or sets if the primitive should be <topic name='Glossary' anchor='Render'>rendered</topic>. Both this and display condition must evaluate to true for the primitive to be rendered.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive's color.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Translucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive's translucency. Translucency is between 0 and 1, where 0 is opaque and 1 is transparent.

summary.para: Gets the URI of the file used to load the file.
Gets or sets the linear scale used to increase or decrease the size of the rendered model.
Gets or sets the position of the model. The position is defined in the model's Reference Frame. The array contains the components of the position in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the model's orientation. The quaternion is a rotation from the model's local axes to the axes of the model's Reference Frame.
Gets the model's articulations. Articulations identify geometry and contain transformations for manipulating that geometry.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom value associated with this primitive.

summary.para: A IAgStkGraphicsModelTransformation defines a transformation that is applied to geometry on a IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive. That geometry is identified by the IAgStkGraphicsModelArticulation which contains the transformation. Changing the IAgStkGraphicsModelTransformation.CurrentValue property of the transformation will also change the geometry associated with its articulation. The type of transformation that will be applied is indicated by the IAgStkGraphicsModelTransformation.Type property.
Gets or sets the current value of the transformation. The current value of the transformation will be reflected in the geometry of the IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive that it is associated with.
Gets the minimum value of the transformation.
Gets the maximum value of the transformation.

Gets the default value of the transformation. The IAgStkGraphicsModelTransformation.CurrentValue property of the transformation will have this value when the IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive is initialized.
Gets the value range of the transformation. Equivalent to the difference of the IAgStkGraphicsModelTransformation.MaximumValue and IAgStkGraphicsModelTransformation.MinimumValue properties.
Gets the name of the transformation.
Gets the AgEStkGraphicsModelTransformationType associated with the transformation.

A IAgStkGraphicsModelTransformation defines a transformation that is applied to geometry on a IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive. That geometry is identified by the IAgStkGraphicsModelArticulation which contains the transformation. Changing the IAgStkGraphicsModelTransformation.CurrentValue property of the transformation will also change the geometry associated with its articulation. The type of transformation that will be applied is indicated by the IAgStkGraphicsModelTransformation.Type property.
Gets or sets the current value of the transformation. The current value of the transformation will be reflected in the geometry of the IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive that it is associated with.
Gets the minimum value of the transformation.
Gets the maximum value of the transformation.

Gets the default value of the transformation. The IAgStkGraphicsModelTransformation.CurrentValue property of the transformation will have this value when the IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive is initialized.
Gets the value range of the transformation. Equivalent to the difference of the IAgStkGraphicsModelTransformation.MaximumValue and IAgStkGraphicsModelTransformation.MinimumValue properties.
Gets the name of the transformation.
Gets the AgEStkGraphicsModelTransformationType associated with the transformation.
A visible element drawn in screen space. Overlays are useful for floating logos, heads up displays, and integrating user interfaces into the 3D window.
Brings the overlay to the front of the z-order, so it is on top of all other overlays with the same IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Parent
Sends the overlay to the back of the z-order, so it is underneath all other overlays with the same IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Parent

Transforms a given position, specified relative to the overlay, into coordinates relative to the overall globe control. Returns an array with a size of 4 and the elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

param.name: X
param.para: The horizontal position to transform.

param.name: Y
param.para: The vertical position to transform.

summary.para: Transforms a given position, specified relative to the overall globe control, into coordinates relative to this overlay. Returns an array with a size of 4 and the elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

param.name: X
param.para: The horizontal position to transform.

param.name: Y
param.para: The vertical position to transform.

summary.para: Gets or sets the position of the overlay relative to its parent. The array represents the position of the overlay and has a size of 4. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

Gets or sets the pinning position of the overlay, relative to the overlay, which determines the point on the overlay that corresponds to the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Position property. The array represents the pinning position of the overlay and has a size of 4. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

Gets or sets the X position of the overlay relative to its parent. The unit in which the position is defined is specified by the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.XUnit property. The position is measured horizontally from the AgEStkGraphicsOrigin, which is, by default, the lower-left corner.
Gets or sets the unit of the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.X property.

Gets or sets the Y position of the overlay relative to its parent. The unit in which the position is defined is specified by the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.YUnit property. The position is measured vertically from the AgEStkGraphicsOrigin, which is, by default, the lower-left corner.
Gets or sets the unit of the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Y property.
Gets or sets the size of the overlay. The array elements represent the size of the overlay in the order width, height, width AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, height AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.
Gets or sets the width of the overlay. The unit in which the width is defined is specified by the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.WidthUnit property.
Gets or sets the unit of the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Width property.
Gets or sets the height of the overlay. The unit in which the height is defined is specified by the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.HeightUnit property.
Gets or sets the unit of the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Height property.

Gets or sets the minimum size of the overlay. The overlay will never be smaller than this size, even if the overlay's IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Size is specified as a percentage of its parent and its parent is very small. It will also not become smaller than this size as a result of a IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Scale transformation. The array elements represent the size of the overlay in the order width, height, width AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, height AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

Gets or sets the maximum size of the overlay. The overlay will never be larger than this size, even if the overlay's IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Size is specified as a percentage of its parent and its parent is very large. It will also not become larger than this size as a result of a IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Scale transformation. The array elements represent the size of the overlay in the order width, height, width AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, height AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.
Gets the bounds of the overlay relative to its parent. The array contains the properties defining the bounds in the order left x location, top y location, width, height.
Gets or sets the overlay's border color. By default, the border color is White. However, also by default, the overlay has a IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.BorderSize of 0.0 so the border is not displayed.
Gets or sets the size of the overlay's border. By default, this is 0.0 so the border is not displayed.
Gets or sets the translucency of the overlay border. Translucency is a value between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is completely opaque and 1.0 is completely transparent.
Gets or sets the value with which the overlay will be translated from the X value of the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Position property.
Gets or sets the value with which the overlay will be translated from the Y value of the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Position property.
Gets or sets the counter-clockwise rotation of the overlay, in radians. The overlay is rotated around the point specified by the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.RotationPoint property.

Gets or sets the point that the overlay is rotated around when the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.RotationAngle property has a value other than 0.0. The array contains seven elements defining the properties of the rotation point. The elements are ordered as follows: UseOriginAsPoint (Boolean), AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayOrigin, RelativeToParent (Boolean), x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

Gets or sets the fractional value used to scale the overlay's IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Size property. A value greater than 1.0 will make the overlay larger while a value less than 1.0 will make it smaller.
Gets or sets whether the overlay will be flipped along its X axis.
Gets or sets whether the overlay will be flipped along its Y axis.

Gets or sets the origin from which the overlay's position is defined. By default, the value of this property is AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayOrigin.eStkGraphicsScreenOverlayOriginBottomLeft. See AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayOrigin for a list of the possible origins and a description of how the origin affects the measurement of the overlay's position and size properties.

Gets or sets the origin of the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.PinningPosition property, relative to the overlay. By default, the value of this property is AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayPinningOrigin.eStkGraphicsScreenOverlayPinningOriginAutomatic, which indicates that the origin of the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.PinningPosition property is the same as the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Origin property of the screen overlay. See AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayPinningOrigin for a list of the possible pinning origins and a description of how the pinning origin affects the measurement of the overlay's position property.

Gets the overlay's parent. This may be another overlay if this overlay was added to that overlay's IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Overlays collection. Or, it may be the IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayManager if this overlay was added to the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager's IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.ScreenOverlays collection.
Gets or sets the overlay's translucency. Translucency is a value between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is completely opaque and 1.0 is completely transparent.
Gets or sets the overlay's color. By default, the overlay is White.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not picking on the overlay is enabled. If picking is disabled, this overlay will never show up in the result of IAgStkGraphicsScene.PickScreenOverlays, even if it occupies the specified pick position.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the overlay will be clipped by the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Bounds of its parent. If this property is false, part of this overlay may be visible outside of its parent's bounds.
Gets or sets if this overlay and the collection of overlays that are contained within this overlay should be rendered.

Gets the position of the overlay in coordinates relative to the overall globe control. The array represents the position of the overlay and has a size of 4. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

Gets the size of the overlay in coordinates relative to the overall globe control. The elements are in the order width, height, width AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, height AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.
Gets the bounds of the overlay in coordinates relative to the overall globe control. The array contains the properties defining the bounds in the order left x location, top y location, width, height.

Gets or sets the display condition that determines if the overlay should be rendered. Both this and IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Display must evaulate to
true for the overlay to be rendered.
Gets the collection of overlays that are contained within this overlay.

Gets or sets the padding surrounding the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Overlays that are contained within this overlay. The array contains the components of the padding arranged in the order left, top, right, bottom.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsOverlay.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom value associated with this primitive.

summary.para: A visible element drawn in screen space. Overlays are useful for floating logos, heads up displays, and integrating user interfaces into the 3D window.
Brings the overlay to the front of the z-order, so it is on top of all other overlays with the same IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Parent
Sends the overlay to the back of the z-order, so it is underneath all other overlays with the same IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Parent

Transforms a given position, specified relative to the overlay, into coordinates relative to the overall globe control. Returns an array with a size of 4 and the elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

param.name: X
param.para: The horizontal position to transform.

param.name: Y
param.para: The vertical position to transform.

summary.para: Transforms a given position, specified relative to the overall globe control, into coordinates relative to this overlay. Returns an array with a size of 4 and the elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

param.name: X
param.para: The horizontal position to transform.

param.name: Y
param.para: The vertical position to transform.

summary.para: Gets or sets the position of the overlay relative to its parent. The array represents the position of the overlay and has a size of 4. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

Gets or sets the pinning position of the overlay, relative to the overlay, which determines the point on the overlay that corresponds to the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Position property. The array represents the pinning position of the overlay and has a size of 4. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

Gets or sets the X position of the overlay relative to its parent. The unit in which the position is defined is specified by the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.XUnit property. The position is measured horizontally from the AgEStkGraphicsOrigin, which is, by default, the lower-left corner.
Gets or sets the unit of the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.X property.

Gets or sets the Y position of the overlay relative to its parent. The unit in which the position is defined is specified by the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.YUnit property. The position is measured vertically from the AgEStkGraphicsOrigin, which is, by default, the lower-left corner.
Gets or sets the unit of the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Y property.
Gets or sets the size of the overlay. The array elements represent the size of the overlay in the order width, height, width AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, height AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.
Gets or sets the width of the overlay. The unit in which the width is defined is specified by the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.WidthUnit property.
Gets or sets the unit of the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Width property.
Gets or sets the height of the overlay. The unit in which the height is defined is specified by the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.HeightUnit property.
Gets or sets the unit of the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Height property.

Gets or sets the minimum size of the overlay. The overlay will never be smaller than this size, even if the overlay's IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Size is specified as a percentage of its parent and its parent is very small. It will also not become smaller than this size as a result of a IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Scale transformation. The array elements represent the size of the overlay in the order width, height, width AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, height AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

Gets or sets the maximum size of the overlay. The overlay will never be larger than this size, even if the overlay's IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Size is specified as a percentage of its parent and its parent is very large. It will also not become larger than this size as a result of a IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Scale transformation. The array elements represent the size of the overlay in the order width, height, width AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, height AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.
Gets the bounds of the overlay relative to its parent. The array contains the properties defining the bounds in the order left x location, top y location, width, height.
Gets or sets the overlay's border color. By default, the border color is White. However, also by default, the overlay has a IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.BorderSize of 0.0 so the border is not displayed.
Gets or sets the size of the overlay's border. By default, this is 0.0 so the border is not displayed.
Gets or sets the translucency of the overlay border. Translucency is a value between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is completely opaque and 1.0 is completely transparent.
Gets or sets the value with which the overlay will be translated from the X value of the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Position property.
Gets or sets the value with which the overlay will be translated from the Y value of the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Position property.
Gets or sets the counter-clockwise rotation of the overlay, in radians. The overlay is rotated around the point specified by the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.RotationPoint property.

Gets or sets the point that the overlay is rotated around when the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.RotationAngle property has a value other than 0.0. The array contains seven elements defining the properties of the rotation point. The elements are ordered as follows: UseOriginAsPoint (Boolean), AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayOrigin, RelativeToParent (Boolean), x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

Gets or sets the fractional value used to scale the overlay's IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Size property. A value greater than 1.0 will make the overlay larger while a value less than 1.0 will make it smaller.
Gets or sets whether the overlay will be flipped along its X axis.
Gets or sets whether the overlay will be flipped along its Y axis.

Gets or sets the origin from which the overlay's position is defined. By default, the value of this property is AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayOrigin.eStkGraphicsScreenOverlayOriginBottomLeft. See AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayOrigin for a list of the possible origins and a description of how the origin affects the measurement of the overlay's position and size properties.

Gets or sets the origin of the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.PinningPosition property, relative to the overlay. By default, the value of this property is AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayPinningOrigin.eStkGraphicsScreenOverlayPinningOriginAutomatic, which indicates that the origin of the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.PinningPosition property is the same as the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Origin property of the screen overlay. See AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayPinningOrigin for a list of the possible pinning origins and a description of how the pinning origin affects the measurement of the overlay's position property.

Gets the overlay's parent. This may be another overlay if this overlay was added to that overlay's IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Overlays collection. Or, it may be the IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayManager if this overlay was added to the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager's IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.ScreenOverlays collection.
Gets or sets the overlay's translucency. Translucency is a value between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is completely opaque and 1.0 is completely transparent.
Gets or sets the overlay's color. By default, the overlay is White.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not picking on the overlay is enabled. If picking is disabled, this overlay will never show up in the result of IAgStkGraphicsScene.PickScreenOverlays, even if it occupies the specified pick position.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the overlay will be clipped by the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Bounds of its parent. If this property is false, part of this overlay may be visible outside of its parent's bounds.
Gets or sets if this overlay and the collection of overlays that are contained within this overlay should be rendered.

Gets the position of the overlay in coordinates relative to the overall globe control. The array represents the position of the overlay and has a size of 4. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

Gets the size of the overlay in coordinates relative to the overall globe control. The elements are in the order width, height, width AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, height AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.
Gets the bounds of the overlay in coordinates relative to the overall globe control. The array contains the properties defining the bounds in the order left x location, top y location, width, height.

Gets or sets the display condition that determines if the overlay should be rendered. Both this and IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Display must evaulate to
true for the overlay to be rendered.
Gets the collection of overlays that are contained within this overlay.

Gets or sets the padding surrounding the IAgStkGraphicsOverlay.Overlays that are contained within this overlay. The array contains the components of the padding arranged in the order left, top, right, bottom.

member.summary: Gets or sets custom value associated with this primitive.

summary.para:
Renders a line to the 3D scene. Similar to the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive; however, the
PathPrimitive was designed for the efficient addition/removal of points to/from the front or back of the line.
Add a IAgStkGraphicsPathPoint to the front of the line.

param.name: PathPoint
param.para: The point added to the front of the line.

summary.para: Add the range of IAgStkGraphicsPathPoint to the front of the line.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) to add to the front of the path.

summary.para: Add a IAgStkGraphicsPathPoint to the back of the line.

param.name: PathPoint
param.para: The point added to the back of the line.

summary.para: Add the range of IAgStkGraphicsPathPoint to the back of the line.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) to add to the back of the path.

summary.para: Remove a IAgStkGraphicsPathPoint to the front of the line.
Remove all points before index.

param.name: Index
param.para: The index at which to stop removing points.

summary.para: Remove a IAgStkGraphicsPathPoint to the back of the line.
Remove all points after index.

param.name: Index
param.para: The index at which any points after will be removed.

summary.para: Access the IAgStkGraphicsPathPoint at the front of the line.
Access the IAgStkGraphicsPathPoint at the back of the line.
Removes all of the points.

remarks.para: Even though this method will remove all of the points, the memory reserved will not be altered.

summary.para: A single result from IAgStkGraphicsScene.Pick.
Gets a collection of objects that were on the pick stack for the picked object.
Gets the depth of the picked location in the 3D scene.
Gets the position of the picked location in the central body's fixed reference frame. The array contains the components of the position arranged in the order x, y, z.
A single result from IAgStkGraphicsScene.Pick.
Gets a collection of objects that were on the pick stack for the picked object.
Gets the depth of the picked location in the 3D scene.
Gets the position of the picked location in the central body's fixed reference frame. The array contains the components of the position arranged in the order x, y, z.

Defines an inclusive interval, in pixels, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the number of pixels the object's bounding sphere (or in the case of screen overlays, bounding rectangle) covers on the screen. This is commonly used to implement level of detail algorithms that take into account the field of view.
Gets or sets the minimum pixel size of the inclusive distance interval.

Gets or sets the maximum pixel size of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Int32.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

Defines an inclusive interval, in pixels, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the number of pixels the object's bounding sphere (or in the case of screen overlays, bounding rectangle) covers on the screen. This is commonly used to implement level of detail algorithms that take into account the field of view.
Gets or sets the minimum pixel size of the inclusive distance interval.

Gets or sets the maximum pixel size of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Int32.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

Renders one or more points in the 3D scene. Each point in the batch has a unique position and an optional color. All points in the batch share the same pixel size. For best performance, avoid creating lots of batches with only a few points each. See the Batching Performance Overview.
Defines the positions of points in a point batch. The points are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous positions and per-position colors. To update a subset of positions, use Set Partial.
Each point is rendered with the same color and translucency, which is defined by the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Color and IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Translucency properties.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions (in the order x, y, z) for the point batch.

summary.para: Defines the positions and colors of points in a point batch. The points are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous positions and per-position colors. To update a subset of positions and colors, use Set Partial.

Each color in colors corresponds to a position in positions with the same location. For example, the first color in colors is applied to the first position in positions. These colors override the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Color and IAgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Translucency properties. Accessing these properties will result in an Invalid Operation Exception.
To create translucent points, use the Color's alpha component. An alpha of 0 is completely transparent and an alpha of 255 is completely opaque.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions (in the order x, y, z) for the point batch.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of colors for the point batch. There must be one color for each position in positions. In .NET a Color should be translated to a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: Defines the positions and colors of points in a point batch. The points are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame. renderPassHint is provided for efficiency.

remarks.para:
Calling this method with a renderPassHint of
Unknown is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Set with just positions and colors. When a more specific renderPassHint is used, this method can be more efficient.
See IAgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions (in the order x, y, z) for the point batch.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of colors for the point batch. There must be one color for each position in positions. In .NET a Color should be translated to a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions of points in a point batch using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Set.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions for the point batch, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions and colors of points in a point batch using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Set.

member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive's color.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Translucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive's translucency. Translucency is between 0 and 1, where 0 is opaque and 1 is transparent.

summary.para: Gets or sets whether an outline is rendered around each point in the batch.
Gets or sets the outline's color.

Gets or sets the translucency of the outline. Translucency is between
0 and
1, where
0 is opaque and
1 is transparent.
Gets or sets the size, in pixels, of the outline around each point in the batch.
Gets or sets the size, in pixels, of each point in the point batch.
Gets the minimum pixel size supported by the video card.
Gets the maximum pixel size supported by the video card.

Gets or sets a IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition that is evaluated per point in the point batch during rendering. This is different than IAgStkGraphicsDisplayCondition, which is evaluated once for the entire point batch. When
DistanceDisplayConditionPerPoint is
null, no per point display condition is evaluated.
Gets the primitive's AgEStkGraphicsSetHint. See the Set Hint Performance Overview for selecting an appropriate value to construct the primitive with.

Gets or sets whether individual point indices will be included in the IAgStkGraphicsPickResult returned from the IAgStkGraphicsScene's
Pick method. Each point index that is picked will be returned as a IAgStkGraphicsBatchPrimitiveIndex.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom value associated with this primitive.

summary.para: Renders one or more points in the 3D scene. Each point in the batch has a unique position and an optional color. All points in the batch share the same pixel size. For best performance, avoid creating lots of batches with only a few points each. See the Batching Performance Overview.
Defines the positions of points in a point batch. The points are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous positions and per-position colors. To update a subset of positions, use Set Partial.
Each point is rendered with the same color and translucency, which is defined by the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Color and IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Translucency properties.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions (in the order x, y, z) for the point batch.

summary.para: Defines the positions and colors of points in a point batch. The points are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous positions and per-position colors. To update a subset of positions and colors, use Set Partial.

Each color in colors corresponds to a position in positions with the same location. For example, the first color in colors is applied to the first position in positions. These colors override the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Color and IAgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Translucency properties. Accessing these properties will result in an Invalid Operation Exception.
To create translucent points, use the Color's alpha component. An alpha of 0 is completely transparent and an alpha of 255 is completely opaque.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions (in the order x, y, z) for the point batch.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of colors for the point batch. There must be one color for each position in positions. In .NET a Color should be translated to a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: Defines the positions and colors of points in a point batch. The points are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame. renderPassHint is provided for efficiency.

remarks.para:
Calling this method with a renderPassHint of
Unknown is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Set with just positions and colors. When a more specific renderPassHint is used, this method can be more efficient.
See IAgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions (in the order x, y, z) for the point batch.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of colors for the point batch. There must be one color for each position in positions. In .NET a Color should be translated to a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions of points in a point batch using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitive.Set.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions for the point batch, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions and colors of points in a point batch using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsPointBatchPrimitiveClass.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom value associated with this primitive.

summary.para: Renders a polyline in the 3D scene. Each line segment may have a different color. A polyline can be constructed with a IAgStkGraphicsPositionInterpolator to render great arcs or rhumb lines.
Defines the positions for a polyline primitive. The polyline is rendered in it's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous positions and per-position colors. To update a subset of positions, use IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.SetPartial.

If the polyline's IAgStkGraphicsPositionInterpolator is not
null, positions are interpolated before they are rendered. If the polyline's AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType is
LineStrip, for each position after the first position, a line segment is rendered that connects the position to the previous position. Otherwise, if
Lines is used, a line segment is rendered for every two positions.
Each line segment is rendered with the same color and translucency, which is defined by the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Color and IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Translucency properties.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions (in the order x, y, z) for the polyline.

summary.para: Defines the positions and colors of a polyline. The polyline is rendered in it's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous positions and per-position colors. To update a subset of positions and colors, use IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.SetPartial.

If the polyline's IAgStkGraphicsPositionInterpolator is not
null, positions are interpolated before they are rendered. If the polyline's AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType is
LineStrip, for each position after the first position, a line segment is rendered that connects the position to the previous position. Otherwise, if
Lines is used, a line segment is rendered for every two positions.

Each color in colors corresponds to a position in positions with the same location. For example, the first color in colors is applied to the first position in positions. These colors override the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Color and IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Translucency properties. Accessing these properties will result in an Invalid Operation Exception.
To create translucent line segments, use the Color's alpha component. An alpha of 0 is completely transparent and an alpha of 255 is completely opaque.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions (in the order x, y, z) for the polyline.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of colors for the polyline. There must be one color for each position in positions. The first color is ignored, each additional color defines the color of the line segment ending at that position. In .NET a Color should be translated to a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: Defines the positions and colors of a polyline. The polyline is rendered in it's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame. renderPassHint is provided for efficiency.

remarks.para:
Calling this method with a renderPassHint of
Unknown is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set with just positions and colors. When a more specific renderPassHint is used, this method can be more efficient.
See IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions (in the order x, y, z) for the polyline.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of colors for the polyline. There must be one color for each position in positions. The first color is ignored, each additional color defines the color of the line segment ending at that position. In .NET a Color should be translated to a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: Defines the positions of a polyline using the positions of the specified surfaceShapesResult.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to to calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set with surfaceShapesResult.Positions. See IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: SurfaceShapesResult
param.para: The surface shapes result used to define the polyline.

summary.para: Defines the positions of a polyline using the boundary positions of the specified surfaceTriangulatorResult.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to to calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set with surfaceTriangulatorResult.BoundaryPositions. See IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: SurfaceTriangulatorResult
param.para: The surface triangulator result used to define the polyline.

summary.para: Defines the positions of a polyline using the outline positions of the specified solidTriangulatorResult.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to to calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set with solidTriangulatorResult.OutlinePositions. See IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: SolidTriangulatorResult
param.para: The solid triangulator result used to define the polyline.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions of a polyline using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions for the polyline, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions and colors of a polyline using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions for the polyline, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of colors for the polyline. There must be one color for each position in positions. The first color is ignored, each additional color defines the color of the line segment ending at that position. In .NET a Color should be translated to a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions and colors of a polyline using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. renderPassHint is provided for efficiency. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions for the polyline, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of colors for the polyline. There must be one color for each position in positions. The first color is ignored, each additional color defines the color of the line segment ending at that position. In .NET a Color should be translated to a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: Defines the positions of a polyline using a subset of input positions.

remarks.para:
When the caller has an array of positions and wants to define a polyline primitive using a continuous subset of the array, calling
SetSubset is more convenient and efficient than copying the positions into a temporary array and calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array of positions in the order x, y, z. The subset of this array defined by index and count define the new positions for the polyline.

param.name: Index
param.para: A zero-based index into positions that defines the first position copied to the polyline. Note that this index considers a set of x, y, and z coordinates as a single element.

param.name: Count
param.para: The number of elements in positions copied to the polyline. Note that is number considers a set of x, y, and z elements as a single element.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions of a polyline using a subset of input Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting the subset of positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.SetSubset.

remarks.para: See IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.SetSubset for a full discussion.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions in the order latitude, longitude, altitude. The subset of this array defined by index and count define the new positions for the polyline.

param.name: Index
param.para: A zero-based index into positions that defines the first position copied to the polyline. Note that this index considers a set of latitude, longitude, and altitude as a single element.

param.name: Count
param.para: The number of elements in positions copied to the polyline. Note that this number considers a set of latitude, longitude, and altitude as a single element.

param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) used to update a subset of positions in the polyline.

param.name: Indices
param.para: An array of integers containing the indices into positions. A set of x, y, and z elements is considered a single index.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom value associated with this primitive.

summary.para: Renders a polyline in the 3D scene. Each line segment may have a different color. A polyline can be constructed with a IAgStkGraphicsPositionInterpolator to render great arcs or rhumb lines.
Defines the positions for a polyline primitive. The polyline is rendered in it's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous positions and per-position colors. To update a subset of positions, use IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.SetPartial.

If the polyline's IAgStkGraphicsPositionInterpolator is not
null, positions are interpolated before they are rendered. If the polyline's AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType is
LineStrip, for each position after the first position, a line segment is rendered that connects the position to the previous position. Otherwise, if
Lines is used, a line segment is rendered for every two positions.
Each line segment is rendered with the same color and translucency, which is defined by the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Color and IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Translucency properties.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions (in the order x, y, z) for the polyline.

summary.para: Defines the positions and colors of a polyline. The polyline is rendered in it's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous positions and per-position colors. To update a subset of positions and colors, use IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.SetPartial.

If the polyline's IAgStkGraphicsPositionInterpolator is not
null, positions are interpolated before they are rendered. If the polyline's AgEStkGraphicsPolylineType is
LineStrip, for each position after the first position, a line segment is rendered that connects the position to the previous position. Otherwise, if
Lines is used, a line segment is rendered for every two positions.

Each color in colors corresponds to a position in positions with the same location. For example, the first color in colors is applied to the first position in positions. These colors override the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Color and IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Translucency properties. Accessing these properties will result in an Invalid Operation Exception.
To create translucent line segments, use the Color's alpha component. An alpha of 0 is completely transparent and an alpha of 255 is completely opaque.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions (in the order x, y, z) for the polyline.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of colors for the polyline. There must be one color for each position in positions. The first color is ignored, each additional color defines the color of the line segment ending at that position. In .NET a Color should be translated to a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: Defines the positions and colors of a polyline. The polyline is rendered in it's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame. renderPassHint is provided for efficiency.

remarks.para:
Calling this method with a renderPassHint of
Unknown is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set with just positions and colors. When a more specific renderPassHint is used, this method can be more efficient.
See IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions (in the order x, y, z) for the polyline.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of colors for the polyline. There must be one color for each position in positions. The first color is ignored, each additional color defines the color of the line segment ending at that position. In .NET a Color should be translated to a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: Defines the positions of a polyline using the positions of the specified surfaceShapesResult.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to to calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set with surfaceShapesResult.Positions. See IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: SurfaceShapesResult
param.para: The surface shapes result used to define the polyline.

summary.para: Defines the positions of a polyline using the boundary positions of the specified surfaceTriangulatorResult.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to to calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set with surfaceTriangulatorResult.BoundaryPositions. See IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: SurfaceTriangulatorResult
param.para: The surface triangulator result used to define the polyline.

summary.para: Defines the positions of a polyline using the outline positions of the specified solidTriangulatorResult.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to to calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set with solidTriangulatorResult.OutlinePositions. See IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: SolidTriangulatorResult
param.para: The solid triangulator result used to define the polyline.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions of a polyline using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions for the polyline, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions and colors of a polyline using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing new positions for the polyline, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: Colors

ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions and colors of a polyline using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. renderPassHint is provided for efficiency. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set.

param.name: Positions

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of colors for the polyline. There must be one color for each position in positions. summary.para: Defines the positions of a polyline using a subset of input positions.

remarks.para:
When the caller has an array of positions and wants to define a polyline primitive using a continuous subset of the array, calling
SetSubset is more convenient and efficient than copying the positions into a temporary array and calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.Set

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array of positions in the order x, y, z. The subset of this array defined by index and count define the new positions for the polyline.

param.name: Index
param.para: A zero-based index into positions that defines the first position copied to the polyline. Note that this index considers a set of x, y, and z coordinates as a single element.

param.name: Count
param.para: The number of elements in positions copied to the polyline. Note that is number considers a set of x, y, and z elements as a single element.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions of a polyline using a subset of input Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting the subset of positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.SetSubset.

remarks.para: See IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.SetSubset for a full discussion.

param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Count
param.para: The number of elements in positions copied to the polyline. Note that this number considers a set of latitude, longitude, and altitude as a single element.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsPrimitiveClass.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom value associated with this primitive.

summary.para: The primitive manager contains spatial data structures used to efficiently render primitives. Once a primitive is constructed, it must be added to the primitive manager before it will be rendered.
Adds a primitive to the manager. Primitives must be added to the manager to be rendered.

remarks.para: When a primitive is added to the manager, the scene is not automatically re-rendered, so the primitive doesn't immediately show up. The scene can be rendered explicitly using IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Render or IAgStkGraphicsScene.Render. For best performance, add several primitives to the manager before re-rendering.

When a primitive is added to the manager, it appears in all scenes by default. To limit the number of scenes, assign a IAgStkGraphicsSceneDisplayCondition to the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.DisplayCondition.

param.name: Primitive
param.para: The primitive to add to the manager.

summary.para: Removes a primitive from the manager. The primitive is no longer rendered unless it is added back into the manager.

remarks.para: If primitive does not exist in the manager, this call is ignored.

param.name: Primitive
param.para: The primitive to remove from the manager.

summary.para: Determines whether the manager contains a primitive.

param.name: Primitive
param.para: The primitive to locate in the manager.

summary.para: Removes all primitives from the manager.
Gets the number of primitives in the manager.

Gets or sets the exponent used to compute the maximum precision for primitive rendering. For example, a value of -3 indicates the maximum precision of 2^-3, 0.125 m along the x, y, or z axis. The worst case precision, taking into account all axes, is sqrt(3 * (2^-3)^2), 0.2165 m. The default is -2.

Gets or sets the sort order for translucent primitives in the primitive manager. This determines a trade-off between rendering speed and quality. It is only recommended to use AgEStkGraphicsPrimitivesSortOrder when translucent primitives along the same line of sight cause blending artifacts.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsPrimitiveManager._NewEnum
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection. The order of the primitives is not guaranteed to be the order that the primitives were added.

When a primitive is added to the manager, it appears in all scenes by default. To limit the number of scenes, assign a IAgStkGraphicsSceneDisplayCondition to the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.DisplayCondition.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsRasterImageGlobeOverlayClass.Extent
member.summary: Gets the cartographic extent that represents the area covered by the globe overlay. The array elements are arranged in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsRasterImageGlobeOverlayClass.Role
member.summary: Gets the globe overlay role of the globe overlay.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsRasterImageGlobeOverlayClass.UriAsString
member.summary: Gets the absolute URI specifying the location of the globe overlay.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsRasterImageGlobeOverlayClass.IsValid
member.summary: Gets whether or not the overlay is valid. It can be invalid because of a missing file, corrupt file, unlicensed file, or a file on the incorrect central body.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsRasterImageGlobeOverlayClass.DisplayCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets the display condition that controls whether or not the globe overlay is displayed.

summary.para: Gets or sets whether IAgStkGraphicsRasterImageGlobeOverlay.TransparentColor should be used.
Gets or sets the Color that will become transparent.

The rhumb line interpolator computes interpolated positions along a rhumb line. Rhumb lines are lines of constant bearing. They appear as straight lines on a Mercator 2D map projection and are well suited to navigation.

member.name: M:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsRhumbLineInterpolator.Interpolate(System.Array@)
member.summary: Computes interpolated positions based on the input positions. Returns an array of positions in the order x, y, z.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsRhumbLineInterpolator.PolylineType
member.summary: Gets the polyline type of positions returned from interpolate

summary.para: Gets or sets the central body used when interpolating with IAgStkGraphicsRhumbLineInterpolator.Interpolate.
Gets or sets the granularity, in radians, used when interpolating with IAgStkGraphicsRhumbLineInterpolator.Interpolate. Lower granularities are more precise but create more positions.

The rhumb line interpolator computes interpolated positions along a rhumb line. Rhumb lines are lines of constant bearing. They appear as straight lines on a Mercator 2D map projection and are well suited to navigation.

member.summary: Computes interpolated positions based on the input positions. Returns an array of positions in the order x, y, z.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsRhumbLineInterpolatorClass.PolylineType

A IAgStkGraphicsScene provides properties and functionality that are reflected in the rendering of the globe control that it is associated with. An globe control's IAgStkGraphicsScene is available from the Scene property. Any changes that are made to a IAgStkGraphicsScene will only affect the rendering of the particular globe control it is associated with. The static IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager class provides global properties and functionality that apply to all IAgStkGraphicsScene and thus affect the rendering of every globe control. A IAgStkGraphicsScene has a IAgStkGraphicsCamera, and various properties for changing the visual state of the scene and its IAgStkGraphicsScene.CentralBodies, including changes to IAgStkGraphicsLighting. To render a particular IAgStkGraphicsScene, use the IAgStkGraphicsScene.Render method. To render all Scenes, use use the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Render method.
Renders the scene. To render all the scenes within an application, use the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Render method.

Executes a pick at the given x, y and returns a depth sorted collection of IAgStkGraphicsPickResult. The coordinate origin is top, left. To pick IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay, use the IAgStkGraphicsScene.PickScreenOverlays method.

param.name: X
param.para: The x coordinate of the globe control.

param.name: Y
param.para: The y coordinate of the globe control.

summary.para: Executes a pick in the given rectangular region and returns a depth sorted collection of IAgStkGraphicsPickResult. The coordinate origin is top, left. To pick IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay, use the IAgStkGraphicsScene.PickScreenOverlays method.

param.name: Left
param.para: The left x coordinate of the rectangle in the globe control.

param.name: Bottom
param.para: The bottom y coordinate of the rectangle in the globe control.

param.name: Right
param.para: The right x coordinate of the rectangle in the globe control.

param.name: Top
param.para: The top y coordinate of the rectangle in the globe control.

summary.para: Executes a pick on IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay at the given x, y and returns a front to back sorted collection of IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayPickResult. The coordinate origin is top, left. To pick other objects in the scene, use the IAgStkGraphicsScene.Pick method.

param.name: X
param.para: The x coordinate of the globe control.

param.name: Y
param.para: The y coordinate of the globe control.

summary.para: Gets the IAgStkGraphicsCamera associated with the scene, which affects the view that is rendered by the scene.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsLighting associated with the scene.
Gets or sets whether sunshine is rendered by the Sun Central Body. Sunshine renders a halo effect around the sun when it is viewed in the scene.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsCentralBodyGraphics for a specified Central Body.
Gets or sets the background color of the scene.

Gets or sets whether the sky will be shaded based on IAgStkGraphicsCamera altitude. When IAgStkGraphicsScene.ShadeSkyBasedOnAltitude is set to true, the sky will become more blue as the Camera gets closer to the surface of the Central Body.
Gets or sets whether stars are shown or hidden in the scene.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsSceneGlobeOverlaySettings for the scene.
