member.name: E:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSceneClass.Rendering
member.summary: Raised when either render is called on the scene or Render is called on the scene manager. The event occurs immediately prior to rendering the scene.

summary.para: A display condition used to control what scene or scenes an object, such as a primitive, is rendered in. This is used to show an object in some scenes and hide it in others.
Allows or disallows rendering for in a particular scene for.

param.name: Scene
param.para: The scene to enable or disable rendering for.

param.name: On
param.para: True, if an object with this display condition should render in the given scene.

summary.para: Determines whether the display condition allows rendering rendering in the given scene.

param.name: Scene
param.para: The scene to check if rendering is enabled for.

summary.para: Allows rendering only in the given scene. The display condition will not allow rendering in other scenes, including newly created ones.

param.name: Scene
param.para: The scene to enable or disable rendering for.

summary.para: The static IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager class provides global properties and functionality that apply to all IAgStkGraphicsScene and thus affect the rendering of every globe control. It also provides a IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Textures property for creating new Texture 2D, and controls the Time of all IAgStkGraphicsScene within an application. The Animation property and Set Time method can be used to control Time. The IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Primitives and IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.ScreenOverlays properties allow you to add IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive and IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay to all IAgStkGraphicsScene. To render these objects in specific scenes, see the IAgStkGraphicsSceneDisplayCondition class. To render all IAgStkGraphicsScene within an application, call the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Render method.
Renders all IAgStkGraphicsScene within an application. To render a specific IAgStkGraphicsScene, use the IAgStkGraphicsScene.Render method.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsPrimitiveManager, which is used to add IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive to your IAgStkGraphicsScene.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayManager, which is used to add IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay to your IAgStkGraphicsScene.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsTexture2DFactory, which can be used to create Texture 2D from various sources.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlaySettings, which are used to set global settings for all IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay.
Gets a read-only collection of IAgStkGraphicsScene that are associated with the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.
Allows the user to create or initialize primitives, display conditions, tringulators and other types of objects.

summary.para: A visible element drawn in screen space. Overlays are useful for floating logos, heads up displays, and integrating user interfaces into the 3D window.

member.name: M:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.BringToFront
member.summary: Brings the overlay to the front of the z-order, so it is on top of all other overlays with the same parent

member.name: M:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.SendToBack
member.summary: Sends the overlay to the back of the z-order, so it is underneath all other overlays with the same parent

member.name: M:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.OverlayToControl(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Transforms a given position, specified relative to the overlay, into coordinates relative to the overall globe control...

member.name: M:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.ControlToOverlay(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Transforms a given position, specified relative to the overall globe control, into coordinates relative to this overlay...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the overlay relative to its parent. The array represents the position of the overlay and has a size of 4. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x screen overlay unit, y screen overlay unit.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.PinningPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the pinning position of the overlay, relative to the overlay, which determines the point on the overlay that corresponds to the position property. The array represents the pinning position of the overlay and has a size of 4...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the X position of the overlay relative to its parent. The unit in which the position is defined is specified by the x unit property. The position is measured horizontally from the origin, which is, by default, the lower-left corner.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.XUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit of the x property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the Y position of the overlay relative to its parent. The unit in which the position is defined is specified by the y unit property. The position is measured vertically from the origin, which is, by default, the lower-left corner.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.YUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit of the y property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the overlay. The array elements represent the size of the overlay in the order width, height, width screen overlay unit, height screen overlay unit.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the overlay. The unit in which the width is defined is specified by the width unit property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.WidthUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit of the width property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the overlay. The unit in which the height is defined is specified by the height unit property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.HeightUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit of the height property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.MinimumSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of the overlay. The overlay will never be smaller than this size, even if the overlay's size is specified as a percentage of its parent and its parent is very small...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.MaximumSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of the overlay. The overlay will never be larger than this size, even if the overlay's size is specified as a percentage of its parent and its parent is very large...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Bounds
member.summary: Gets the bounds of the overlay relative to its parent. The array contains the properties defining the bounds in the order left x location, top y location, width, height.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the overlay's border color. By default, the border color is white. However, also by default, the overlay has a border size of 0.0 so the border is not displayed.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.BorderSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the overlay's border. By default, this is 0.0 so the border is not displayed.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.BorderTranslucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the translucency of the overlay border. Translucency is a value between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is completely opaque and 1.0 is completely transparent.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.TranslationX
member.summary: Gets or sets the value with which the overlay will be translated from the X value of the position property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.TranslationY
member.summary: Gets or sets the value with which the overlay will be translated from the Y value of the position property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.RotationAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the counter-clockwise rotation of the overlay, in radians. The overlay is rotated around the point specified by the rotation point property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.RotationPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the point that the overlay is rotated around when the rotation angle property has a value other than 0.0. The array contains seven elements defining the properties of the rotation point...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Scale
member.summary: Gets or sets the fractional value used to scale the overlay's size property. A value greater than 1.0 will make the overlay larger while a value less than 1.0 will make it smaller.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.FlipX
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the overlay will be flipped along its X axis.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.FlipY
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the overlay will be flipped along its Y axis.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Origin
member.summary: Gets or sets the origin from which the overlay's position is defined. By default, the value of this property is bottom left...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.PinningOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets the origin of the pinning position property, relative to the overlay...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Parent
member.summary: Gets the overlay's parent. This may be another overlay if this overlay was added to that overlay's overlays collection. Or, it may be the screen overlay manager if this overlay was added to the scene manager'sscreen overlays collection.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Translucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the overlay's translucency. Translucency is a value between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is completely opaque and 1.0 is completely transparent.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the overlay's color. By default, the overlay is white.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.PickingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not picking on the overlay is enabled. If picking is disabled, this overlay will never show up in the result of PickScreenOverlay, even if it occupies the specified pick position.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.ClipToParent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the overlay will be clipped by the bounds of its parent. If this property is <see langword='false' />, part of this overlay may be visible outside of its parent's bounds.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Display
member.summary: Gets or sets if this overlay and the collection of overlays that are contained within this overlay should be <topic name='Glossary' anchor='Render'>rendered</topic>.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.ControlPosition
member.summary: Gets the position of the overlay in coordinates relative to the overall globe control. The array represents the position of the overlay and has a size of 4. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x screen overlay unit, y screen overlay unit.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.ControlSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the overlay in coordinates relative to the overall globe control. The elements are in the order width, height, width screen overlay unit, height screen overlay unit.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.ControlBounds
member.summary: Gets the bounds of the overlay in coordinates relative to the overall globe control. The array contains the properties defining the bounds in the order left x location, top y location, width, height.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.DisplayCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets the display condition that determines if the overlay should be <topic name='Glossary' anchor='Render'>rendered</topic>. Both this and display must evaulate to true for the overlay to be rendered.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Overlays
member.summary: Gets the collection of overlays that are contained within this overlay.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay.Padding
member.summary: Gets or sets the padding surrounding the overlays that are contained within this overlay. The array contains the components of the padding arranged in the order left, top, right, bottom.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value with which the overlay will be translated from the X value of the position property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.TranslationY
member.summary: Gets or sets the value with which the overlay will be translated from the Y value of the position property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.RotationAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the counter-clockwise rotation of the overlay, in radians. The overlay is rotated around the point specified by the rotation point property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.RotationPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the point that the overlay is rotated around when the rotation angle property has a value other than 0.0. The array contains seven elements defining the properties of the rotation point...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.Scale
member.summary: Gets or sets the fractional value used to scale the overlay's size property. A value greater than 1.0 will make the overlay larger while a value less than 1.0 will make it smaller.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.FlipX
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the overlay will be flipped along its X axis.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.FlipY
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the overlay will be flipped along its Y axis.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.Origin
member.summary: Gets or sets the origin from which the overlay's position is defined. By default, the value of this property is bottom left...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.PinningOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets the origin of the pinning position property, relative to the overlay...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.Parent
member.summary: Gets the overlay's parent. This may be another overlay if this overlay was added to that overlay's overlays collection. Or, it may be the screen overlay manager if this overlay was added to the scene manager'sscreen overlays collection.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.Translucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the overlay's translucency. Translucency is a value between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is completely opaque and 1.0 is completely transparent.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the overlay's color. By default, the overlay is white.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.PickingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not picking on the overlay is enabled. If picking is disabled, this overlay will never show up in the result of PickScreenOverlay, even if it occupies the specified pick position.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.ClipToParent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the overlay will be clipped by the bounds of its parent. If this property is <see langword='false' />, part of this overlay may be visible outside of its parent's bounds.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.Display
member.summary: Gets or sets if this overlay and the collection of overlays that are contained within this overlay should be <topic name='Glossary' anchor='Render'>rendered</topic>.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.ControlPosition
member.summary: Gets the position of the overlay in coordinates relative to the overall globe control. The array represents the position of the overlay and has a size of 4. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x screen overlay unit, y screen overlay unit.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.ControlSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the overlay in coordinates relative to the overall globe control. The elements are in the order width, height, width screen overlay unit, height screen overlay unit.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.ControlBounds
member.summary: Gets the bounds of the overlay in coordinates relative to the overall globe control. The array contains the properties defining the bounds in the order left x location, top y location, width, height.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.DisplayCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets the display condition that determines if the overlay should be <topic name='Glossary' anchor='Render'>rendered</topic>. Both this and display must evaulate to true for the overlay to be rendered.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.Overlays
member.summary: Gets the collection of overlays that are contained within this overlay.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayClass.Padding
member.summary: Gets or sets the padding surrounding the overlays that are contained within this overlay. The array contains the components of the padding arranged in the order left, top, right, bottom.

Describes a picked screen overlay as a result of a call to IAgStkGraphicsScene.PickScreenOverlays.

Gets the position that was picked within the picked IAgStkGraphicsOverlay. The array represents the picked position and has a size of 4. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

Gets the position that was picked within the overall globe control. This is essentially the same position that was passed to IAgStkGraphicsScene.PickScreenOverlays. The array represents the picked position and has a size of 4. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.
Gets the screen overlay that was picked.

The array represents the picked position and has a size of 4. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.
Gets the screen overlay that was picked.

Renders filled solid objects and their outlines. Example solids include boxes and ellipsoids. Various effects are supported, such as displaying the solid's silhouette, and hidding the outline of the backside of the solid. In cases where you just want to visualize a solid's fill or outline, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used for reduced overhead.
Defines the solid using the specified solidTriangulatorResult. The solid is rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

param.name: SolidTriangulatorResult
param.para: The triangulator used to define the solid.

summary.para: Defines the solid using the specified parameters. The solid is rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the positions of the solid in the order x, y, z.

param.name: Normals
param.para: An array containing the normals of the mesh in the order x, y, z.

param.name: Indices
param.para: An array of integers containing the indices into positions and normals. A set of x, y, and z elements is considered a single index.

param.name: OutlineIndices
param.para: An array of integers containing the indices into positions that define an outline of the solid. A set of x, y, and z elements is considered a single index.

param.name: WindingOrder
param.para: The orientation of front-facing triangles.

param.name: BoundingSphere
param.para: The bounding sphere that encompasses the solid.

param.name: Closed
param.para: Indicates if the solid is closed. For example, a box with six faces is closed. If one face is removed, the box is open.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive.ReferenceFrame
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference frame this primitive is defined and rendered in.

member.summary: Gets or sets the bounding sphere that encompasses the primitive. The center is defined in the primitive's reference frame.

member.summary: Gets or sets if the primitive's bounding sphere is automatically computed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive's color.

member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive's translucency. Translucency is between 0 and 1, where 0 is opaque and 1 is transparent.

summary.para: Gets or sets whether the primitive is affected by lighting.
Gets or sets whether the solid's fill is displayed.
Gets or sets whether the solid's silhouette is displayed.
Gets or sets the silhouette's color.

Gets or sets the silhouette's translucency. Translucency is between
0 and
1, where
0 is opaque and
1 is transparent.
Gets or sets the silhouette' width, in pixels.
Gets the minimum silhouette width, in pixels, supported by the video card.
Gets the maximum silhouette width, in pixels, supported by the video card.
Gets or sets whether the solid's outline is displayed.
Gets or sets the outline's color.

Gets or sets the outline's translucency. Translucency is between
0 and
1, where
0 is opaque and
1 is transparent.
Gets or sets the outline's width, in pixels.
Gets or sets the outline's appearance.
Gets or sets the back line's color.

Gets or sets the back line's translucency. Translucency is between
0 and
1, where
0 is opaque and
1 is transparent.
Gets or sets the solid's position. The position is defined in the solid's Reference Frame. The array contains the components of the position in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the rotation applied to the solid before rendering.

Gets or sets a non-uniform scale that is applied to the solid to increase or decrease its rendered size. The array contains the scale for each component of the size in the order x scale, y scale, z scale.
Gets or sets the back line's width, in pixels.
Gets the primitive's AgEStkGraphicsSetHint. See the Set Hint Performance Overview for selecting an appropriate value to construct the primitive with.

A triangle mesh primitive for meshes on the surface that need to conform to terrain.
Defines the surface mesh using the specified surfaceTriangulator. The mesh is rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

param.name: SurfaceTriangulator
param.para: The surface triangulator used to define the surface mesh.

summary.para: Defines the surface mesh using the specified surfaceTriangulator. The mesh is rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para:
Calling this method is more efficient than calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive.Set but the surface mesh will not render textures when this is used instead of IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive.Set. Therefore, only use
SetWithoutTexturing when the surface mesh's IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive.Texture will only ever be
null.

param.name: SurfaceTriangulator
param.para: The surface triangulator used to define the surface mesh.

summary.para: Determines whether or not the video card supports the surface mesh primitive with the given renderingMethod.

param.name: RenderingMethod
param.para: The rendering method to check support for.

summary.para: Determines whether or not the video card supports the surface mesh primitive. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive.Supported with AgEStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshRenderingMethod.

member.summary: Gets or sets the bounding sphere that encompasses the primitive. The center is defined in the primitive's reference frame.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitiveClass.AutomaticallyComputeBoundingSphere
member.summary: Gets or sets if the primitive's bounding sphere is automatically computed.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitiveClass.DisplayCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets the display condition that determines if the primitive should be <topic name='Glossary' anchor='Render'>rendered</topic>. Both this and display must evaluate to true for the primitive to be rendered.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitiveClass.Display
member.summary: Gets or sets if the primitive should be <topic name='Glossary' anchor='Render'>rendered</topic>. Both this and display condition must evaluate to true for the primitive to be rendered.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitiveClass.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive's color.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitiveClass.Translucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive's translucency. Translucency is between 0 and 1, where 0 is opaque and 1 is transparent.

summary.para: Gets or sets the texture applied to this primitive when rendering.
Gets or sets whether the primitive is rendered in wireframe. This is useful for debugging.
Gets the orientation of front-facing triangles in the mesh.
Gets the primitive's AgEStkGraphicsSetHint. See the Set Hint Performance Overview for selecting an appropriate value to construct the primitive with.
Gets the rendering method used to render the mesh.
Gets or sets the filter used when a IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive.Texture is applied to this primitive.
Gets or sets the matrix used to transform texture coordinates when a IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive.Texture is applied to this primitive.

Gets or set the boolean that defines if the color obtained from texture coordinates beyond the texture border should be considered transparent or not. This is typically used in conjunction with the a IAgStkGraphicsTextureMatrix.

member.summary: Gets or sets custom value associated with this primitive.

summary.para: A IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay which shows terrain.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay.CentralBody
member.summary: Gets the central body that the globe overlay is displayed on. It will return <see langword='null' /> if the globe overlay hasn't been added to a central body.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay.Extent
member.summary: Gets the cartographic extent that represents the area covered by the globe overlay. The array elements are arranged in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay.Role
member.summary: Gets the globe overlay role of the globe overlay.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay.UriAsString
member.summary: Gets the absolute URI specifying the location of the globe overlay.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay.IsValid
member.summary: Gets whether or not the overlay is valid. It can be invalid because of a missing file, corrupt file, unlicensed file, or a file on the incorrect central body.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay.DisplayCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets the display condition that controls whether or not the globe overlay is displayed.

summary.para: Gets or sets the value from which to offset the terrain height.
Gets or sets the value from which to scale the terrain height.
Gets whether the video card supports adding IAgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay objects. Video cards that support OpenGL 1.2 or higher support IAgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay objects.

Renders one or more strings in the 3D scene.
For best performance, avoid creating lots of batches with only a few strings each. See the Batching Performance Overview.
Defines the positions and text of strings in a text batch. The strings are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous strings. To update a subset of string, use IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive.SetPartial

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions (in the order x, y, z) for each string in the text batch.

param.name: Text
param.para: The text for strings in the text batch. Each element in this collection corresponds to a set of x, y, and z elements in positions.

summary.para: Defines the positions, text, and optional parameters of strings in a text batch. The strings are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: This call overwrites the primitive's previous strings. To update a subset of string, use IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive.SetPartial
See IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters for details on how to define per-batch and per-string parameters.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions (in the order x, y, z) for each string in the text batch.

param.name: Text
param.para: The text for strings in the text batch. Each element in this collection corresponds to a set of x, y, and z elements in positions.

param.name: OptionalParameters
param.para: Optional per-batch parameters or per-string parameters corresponding to positions. Each per-string parameter must have the same number of elements as positions.

summary.para: Defines the positions, text, and optional parameters of strings in a text batch. The strings are rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame. renderPassHint is provided for efficiency.

remarks.para:
Calling this method with a renderPassHint of
Unknown is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive.Set with just positions, text, and optionalParameters. When a more specific renderPassHint is used, this method can be more efficient.
See IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive.Set for a full discussion.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions (in the order x, y, z) for each string in the text batch.

param.name: Text
param.para: The text for strings in the text batch. Each element in this collection corresponds to a set of x, y, and z elements in positions.

param.name: OptionalParameters
param.para: Optional per-batch parameters or per-string parameters corresponding to positions. Each per-string parameter must have the same number of elements as positions.

param.name: RenderPassHint
param.para: An optimization hint indicating the AgEStkGraphicsRenderPass implied by per-strings colors defined in optionalParameters.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions and text of strings in a text batch using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive.Set.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions for each string in the text batch, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: Text
param.para: The text for strings in the text batch. Each element in this collection corresponds to a set of latitude, longitude, and altitude elements in positions.

summary.para: Gets the primitive's AgEStkGraphicsSetHint. See the Set Hint Performance Overview for selecting an appropriate value to construct the primitive with.
Gets or sets the scale applied to the radius of this primitive's bounding sphere.
Gets the font used to render the text batch.
Gets or sets the text's outline color.

Gets or sets the text's outline translucency.
Translucency is between
0 and
1, where
0 is opaque and
1 is transparent.
Gets or sets whether the screen space position of each string is aligned to a pixel.

Gets or sets a IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition that is evaluated per string in the text batch during rendering. This is different than IAgStkGraphicsDisplayCondition, which is evaluated once for the entire text batch. When
DistanceDisplayConditionPerString is
null, no per string display condition is evaluated.

Gets or sets whether individual text indices will be included in the IAgStkGraphicsPickResult returned from the IAgStkGraphicsScene's
Pick method. Each text index that is picked will be returned as a IAgStkGraphicsBatchPrimitiveIndex.
Gets or sets the filter used to filter the texture-based IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive.Font.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the new positions (in the order x, y, z) for each string in the text batch.

param.name: Text
param.para: The text for strings in the text batch. Each element in this collection corresponds to a set of x, y, and z elements in positions.

param.name: OptionalParameters
param.para: Optional per-batch parameters or per-string parameters corresponding to positions. Each per-string parameter must have the same number of elements as positions.

param.name: RenderPassHint
param.para: An optimization hint indicating the AgEStkGraphicsRenderPass implied by per-strings colors defined in optionalParameters.

summary.para: For convenience. Defines the positions and text of strings in a text batch using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive.Set.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body the positions are defined on.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitiveClass.ReferenceFrame
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference frame this primitive is defined and rendered in.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitiveClass.BoundingSphere
member.summary: Gets or sets the bounding sphere that encompasses the primitive. The center is defined in the primitive's reference frame.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitiveClass.AutomaticallyComputeBoundingSphere
member.summary: Gets or sets if the primitive's bounding sphere is automatically computed.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitiveClass.DisplayCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets the display condition that determines if the primitive should be <topic name='Glossary' anchor='Render'>rendered</topic>. Both this and display must evaluate to true for the primitive to be rendered.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitiveClass.Display
member.summary: Gets or sets if the primitive should be <topic name='Glossary' anchor='Render'>rendered</topic>. Both this and display condition must evaluate to true for the primitive to be rendered.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitiveClass.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive's color.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitiveClass.Translucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive's translucency. Translucency is between 0 and 1, where 0 is opaque and 1 is transparent.

summary.para: Gets the primitive's AgEStkGraphicsSetHint. See the Set Hint Performance Overview for selecting an appropriate value to construct the primitive with.
Gets or sets the scale applied to the radius of this primitive's bounding sphere.
Gets the font used to render the text batch.
Gets or sets the text's outline color.

Gets or sets the text's outline translucency.
Translucency is between
0 and
1, where
0 is opaque and
1 is transparent.
Gets or sets whether the screen space position of each string is aligned to a pixel.

Gets or sets a IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition that is evaluated per string in the text batch during rendering. This is different than IAgStkGraphicsDisplayCondition, which is evaluated once for the entire text batch. When
DistanceDisplayConditionPerString is
null, no per string display condition is evaluated.

Gets or sets whether individual text indices will be included in the IAgStkGraphicsPickResult returned from the IAgStkGraphicsScene's
Pick method. Each text index that is picked will be returned as a IAgStkGraphicsBatchPrimitiveIndex.
Gets or sets the filter used to filter the texture-based IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive.Font.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitiveClass.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom value associated with this primitive.

summary.para:
Optional per-string and per-batch parameters for IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive. To use optional parameters, create an instance of
TextBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then call the desired methods or properties to define per-string and per-batch parameters, and finally pass the object to the text batch's
Set or
SetPartial method.
Defines a collection of origins, one for each string in the batch.

remarks.para: The origin defines where the string is placed relative to its position.
Per-string origins override the per-batch origin. Therefore, when per-string origins are defined with this method, AgEStkGraphicsOrigin is ignored.

param.name: Origins
param.para:
An array containing a AgEStkGraphicsOrigin for each string in the batch. There must be one origin for each string passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of eye offsets, one for each string in the batch.

remarks.para:
Eye offsets define an eye-space translation in meters. In eye-space, the
x axis points to the right, the
y axis points up, and the
z axis points into the screen. Eye offsets are commonly used when more than one primitive is located at the same position. For example, if a string in a text batch is located at the same position as a model primitive, an eye offset in the positive
y direction can be applied to the string so it appears a specified number of meters above the model.
Per-string eye offsets override the per-batch eye offset. Therefore, when per-string eye offsets are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters.EyeOffset is ignored.

param.name: EyeOffsets
param.para:
An array containing the x, y, and z eye offset for each string in the batch. There must be one x eye offset, followed by one y eye offset, followed by one z eye offset for each string passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of pixel offsets, one for each string in the batch.

remarks.para:
The pixel offset defines a screen-space translation for a string from its position. Positive
x values translate to the right and positive
y values translate up. This is commonly used when more than one primitive is located at the same position. For example, if a string in a text batch and a point in a point batch have the same position, the string may have a pixel offset applied to it so it doesn't overlap the point.

Per-string pixel offsets override the per-batch pixel offset. Therefore, when per-string pixel offsets are defined with this method, IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters.PixelOffset is ignored.

param.name: PixelOffsets
param.para:
An array containing a X and Y pixel offset for each string in the batch. There must be one X pixel offset followed by one Y pixel offset for each string passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of colors, one for each string in the batch.

remarks.para: Per-string colors override the per-batch color. Therefore, when per-string colors are defined with this method, the text batch's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.Color property is ignored.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of a color for each string in the batch. There must be one color for each string passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive's
Set or
SetPartial method. In .NET a Color should be translated a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para: Gets or sets the per-batch origin, which is applied to each string in the text batch.
Gets or sets the per-batch eye offset, which is applied to each string in the text batch. The array contains the components of the offset arranged in the order x, y, z.
Gets or sets the per-batch pixel offset, which is applied to each string in the text batch. The array contains one x pixel offset followed by one y pixel offset.
Gets or sets the maximum length of each string in the text batch.

TextBatchPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then call the desired methods or properties to define per-string and per-batch parameters, and finally pass the object to the text batch's
Set or
SetPartial method.

member.name: M:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.BringToFront
member.summary: Brings the overlay to the front of the z-order, so it is on top of all other overlays with the same parent

member.name: M:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.SendToBack
member.summary: Sends the overlay to the back of the z-order, so it is underneath all other overlays with the same parent

member.name: M:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.OverlayToControl(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Transforms a given position, specified relative to the overlay, into coordinates relative to the overall globe control...

member.name: M:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.ControlToOverlay(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Transforms a given position, specified relative to the overall globe control, into coordinates relative to this overlay...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the overlay relative to its parent. The array represents the position of the overlay and has a size of 4. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x screen overlay unit, y screen overlay unit.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.PinningPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the pinning position of the overlay, relative to the overlay, which determines the point on the overlay that corresponds to the position property. The array represents the pinning position of the overlay and has a size of 4...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the X position of the overlay relative to its parent. The unit in which the position is defined is specified by the x unit property. The position is measured horizontally from the origin, which is, by default, the lower-left corner.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.XUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit of the x property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the Y position of the overlay relative to its parent. The unit in which the position is defined is specified by the y unit property. The position is measured vertically from the origin, which is, by default, the lower-left corner.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.YUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit of the y property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the overlay. The array elements represent the size of the overlay in the order width, height, width screen overlay unit, height screen overlay unit.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the overlay. The unit in which the width is defined is specified by the width unit property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.WidthUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit of the width property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the overlay. The unit in which the height is defined is specified by the height unit property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.HeightUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit of the height property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.MinimumSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of the overlay. The overlay will never be smaller than this size, even if the overlay's size is specified as a percentage of its parent and its parent is very small...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.MaximumSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of the overlay. The overlay will never be larger than this size, even if the overlay's size is specified as a percentage of its parent and its parent is very large...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.Bounds
member.summary: Gets the bounds of the overlay relative to its parent. The array contains the properties defining the bounds in the order left x location, top y location, width, height.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the overlay's border color. By default, the border color is white. However, also by default, the overlay has a border size of 0.0 so the border is not displayed.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.BorderSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the overlay's border. By default, this is 0.0 so the border is not displayed.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.BorderTranslucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the translucency of the overlay border. Translucency is a value between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is completely opaque and 1.0 is completely transparent.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.TranslationX
member.summary: Gets or sets the value with which the overlay will be translated from the X value of the position property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.TranslationY
member.summary: Gets or sets the value with which the overlay will be translated from the Y value of the position property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.RotationAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the counter-clockwise rotation of the overlay, in radians. The overlay is rotated around the point specified by the rotation point property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.RotationPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the point that the overlay is rotated around when the rotation angle property has a value other than 0.0. The array contains seven elements defining the properties of the rotation point...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.Scale
member.summary: Gets or sets the fractional value used to scale the overlay's size property. A value greater than 1.0 will make the overlay larger while a value less than 1.0 will make it smaller.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.FlipX
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the overlay will be flipped along its X axis.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.FlipY
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the overlay will be flipped along its Y axis.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.Origin
member.summary: Gets or sets the origin from which the overlay's position is defined. By default, the value of this property is bottom left...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.PinningOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets the origin of the pinning position property, relative to the overlay...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.Parent
member.summary: Gets the overlay's parent. This may be another overlay if this overlay was added to that overlay's overlays collection. Or, it may be the screen overlay manager if this overlay was added to the scene manager'sscreen overlays collection.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.Translucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the overlay's translucency. Translucency is a value between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is completely opaque and 1.0 is completely transparent.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the overlay's color. By default, the overlay is white.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.PickingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not picking on the overlay is enabled. If picking is disabled, this overlay will never show up in the result of PickScreenOverlay, even if it occupies the specified pick position.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.ClipToParent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the overlay will be clipped by the bounds of its parent. If this property is <see langword='false' />, part of this overlay may be visible outside of its parent's bounds.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.Display
member.summary: Gets or sets if this overlay and the collection of overlays that are contained within this overlay should be <topic name='Glossary' anchor='Render'>rendered</topic>.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.ControlPosition
member.summary: Gets the position of the overlay in coordinates relative to the overall globe control. The array represents the position of the overlay and has a size of 4. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x screen overlay unit, y screen overlay unit.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.ControlSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the overlay in coordinates relative to the overall globe control. The elements are in the order width, height, width screen overlay unit, height screen overlay unit.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.ControlBounds
member.summary: Gets the bounds of the overlay in coordinates relative to the overall globe control. The array contains the properties defining the bounds in the order left x location, top y location, width, height.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.DisplayCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets the display condition that determines if the overlay should be <topic name='Glossary' anchor='Render'>rendered</topic>. Both this and display must evaulate to true for the overlay to be rendered.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.Overlays
member.summary: Gets the collection of overlays that are contained within this overlay.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlay.Padding
member.summary: Gets or sets the padding surrounding the overlays that are contained within this overlay. The array contains the components of the padding arranged in the order left, top, right, bottom.

summary.para: Gets or sets the texture (image) to be drawn on the overlay. Textures can be obtained from IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Textures.

summary.para: A rectangular overlay that can be assigned a texture.

member.name: M:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.BringToFront
member.summary: Brings the overlay to the front of the z-order, so it is on top of all other overlays with the same parent

member.name: M:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.SendToBack
member.summary: Sends the overlay to the back of the z-order, so it is underneath all other overlays with the same parent

member.name: M:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.OverlayToControl(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Transforms a given position, specified relative to the overlay, into coordinates relative to the overall globe control...

member.name: M:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.ControlToOverlay(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Transforms a given position, specified relative to the overall globe control, into coordinates relative to this overlay...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the overlay relative to its parent. The array represents the position of the overlay and has a size of 4. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x screen overlay unit, y screen overlay unit.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.PinningPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the pinning position of the overlay, relative to the overlay, which determines the point on the overlay that corresponds to the position property. The array represents the pinning position of the overlay and has a size of 4...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the X position of the overlay relative to its parent. The unit in which the position is defined is specified by the x unit property. The position is measured horizontally from the origin, which is, by default, the lower-left corner.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.XUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit of the x property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the Y position of the overlay relative to its parent. The unit in which the position is defined is specified by the y unit property. The position is measured vertically from the origin, which is, by default, the lower-left corner.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.YUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit of the y property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the overlay. The array elements represent the size of the overlay in the order width, height, width screen overlay unit, height screen overlay unit.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the overlay. The unit in which the width is defined is specified by the width unit property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.WidthUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit of the width property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the overlay. The unit in which the height is defined is specified by the height unit property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.HeightUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit of the height property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.MinimumSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of the overlay. The overlay will never be smaller than this size, even if the overlay's size is specified as a percentage of its parent and its parent is very small...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.MaximumSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of the overlay. The overlay will never be larger than this size, even if the overlay's size is specified as a percentage of its parent and its parent is very large...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.Bounds
member.summary: Gets the bounds of the overlay relative to its parent. The array contains the properties defining the bounds in the order left x location, top y location, width, height.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the overlay's border color. By default, the border color is white. However, also by default, the overlay has a border size of 0.0 so the border is not displayed.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.BorderSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the overlay's border. By default, this is 0.0 so the border is not displayed.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.BorderTranslucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the translucency of the overlay border. Translucency is a value between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is completely opaque and 1.0 is completely transparent.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.TranslationX
member.summary: Gets or sets the value with which the overlay will be translated from the X value of the position property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.TranslationY
member.summary: Gets or sets the value with which the overlay will be translated from the Y value of the position property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.RotationAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the counter-clockwise rotation of the overlay, in radians. The overlay is rotated around the point specified by the rotation point property.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.RotationPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the point that the overlay is rotated around when the rotation angle property has a value other than 0.0. The array contains seven elements defining the properties of the rotation point...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.Scale
member.summary: Gets or sets the fractional value used to scale the overlay's size property. A value greater than 1.0 will make the overlay larger while a value less than 1.0 will make it smaller.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.FlipX
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the overlay will be flipped along its X axis.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.FlipY
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the overlay will be flipped along its Y axis.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.Origin
member.summary: Gets or sets the origin from which the overlay's position is defined. By default, the value of this property is bottom left...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.PinningOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets the origin of the pinning position property, relative to the overlay...

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.Parent
member.summary: Gets the overlay's parent. This may be another overlay if this overlay was added to that overlay's overlays collection. Or, it may be the screen overlay manager if this overlay was added to the scene manager'sscreen overlays collection.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.Translucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the overlay's translucency. Translucency is a value between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is completely opaque and 1.0 is completely transparent.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the overlay's color. By default, the overlay is white.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.PickingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not picking on the overlay is enabled. If picking is disabled, this overlay will never show up in the result of PickScreenOverlay, even if it occupies the specified pick position.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTextureScreenOverlayClass.ClipToParent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the overlay will be clipped by the bounds of its parent. If this property is <see langword='false' />, part of this overlay may be visible outside of its parent's bounds.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive time interval that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the current animation time .
Gets or sets the minimum time of the inclusive time interval.
Gets or sets the maximum time of the inclusive time interval.
Defines an inclusive time interval that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the current animation time .
Gets or sets the minimum time of the inclusive time interval.
Gets or sets the maximum time of the inclusive time interval.
Renders a triangle mesh in the 3D scene. Examples of triangle meshes includes polygons on the globe (e.g. states or countries), terrain and imagery extents, ellipses, and extrusions.
Defines the triangle mesh using an indexed triangle list specified by positions, normals, and indices. The mesh is rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) for the triangle mesh.

param.name: Normals
param.para: An array containing the normals (in the order x, y, z) used for lighting the triangle mesh. There must be one normal for each position in positions.

param.name: Indices
param.para: An array of integers containing the indices into positions and normals. A set of x, y, and z elements is considered a single index. Every 3 indices represent 1 triangle.

summary.para: Defines the triangle mesh using an indexed triangle list specified by positions, normals, indices, and optionalParameters. The mesh is rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

remarks.para: See IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitiveOptionalParameters for details on how to define parameters.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) for the triangle mesh.

param.name: Normals
param.para: An array containing the normals (in the order x, y, z) used for lighting the triangle mesh. There must be one normal for each position in positions.

param.name: Indices
param.para: An array of integers containing the indices into positions and normals. A set of x, y, and z elements is considered a single index. Every 3 indices represent 1 triangle.

param.name: OptionalParameters
param.para: Optional parameters corresponding to positions.

summary.para: Defines the triangle mesh using the specified triangulator. The mesh is rendered in the primitive's IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.

param.name: Triangulator
param.para: The triangulator used to define the triangle mesh.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.ReferenceFrame
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference frame this primitive is defined and rendered in.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.BoundingSphere
member.summary: Gets or sets the bounding sphere that encompasses the primitive. The center is defined in the primitive's reference frame.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.AutomaticallyComputeBoundingSphere
member.summary: Gets or sets if the primitive's bounding sphere is automatically computed.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.DisplayCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets the display condition that determines if the primitive should be <topic name='Glossary' anchor='Render'>rendered</topic>. Both this and display must evaluate to true for the primitive to be rendered.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.Display
member.summary: Gets or sets if the primitive should be <topic name='Glossary' anchor='Render'>rendered</topic>. Both this and display condition must evaluate to true for the primitive to be rendered.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive's color.

member.name: P:AGI.STKGraphics.AgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.Translucency
member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive's translucency. Translucency is between 0 and 1, where 0 is opaque and 1 is transparent.

summary.para: Gets or sets whether the primitive is rendered in wireframe. This is useful for debugging.
Gets or sets whether the primitive is rendered in two passes to improve the visual quality for translucent, convex meshes.
Gets or sets whether the primitive is lit.
Gets or sets the orientation of front-facing triangles. This is used in combination with AgEStkGraphicsCullFace for culling.
Gets or sets whether front and/or back-facing triangles may be culled. This is used in combination with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.TriangleWindingOrder for culling.
Gets or sets the shading model for the mesh.
Gets or sets the texture to be drawn on the triangle mesh. Textures can be obtained from IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Textures.
Gets or sets the filter used for the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.Texture associated with this triangle mesh.
Gets the primitive's AgEStkGraphicsSetHint. See the Set Hint Performance Overview for selecting an appropriate value to construct the primitive with.

summary.para:
Optional parameters for IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive. To use optional parameters, create an instance of
TriangleMeshPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then call the desired methods or properties to define the parameters, and finally pass the object to the triangle mesh's
Set method.
Defines a collection of texture coordinates.

param.name: TextureCoordinates
param.para:
An array containing the texture coordinates (in the order x, y) for the mesh. There must be one texture coordinate for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive's
Set method.

summary.para: Defines a collection of colors.

param.name: Colors
param.para:
An array containing the numeric representation of colors for each vertex in the mesh. There must be one color for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive's
Set method. In .NET a Color should be translated to a number by calling its
ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para:
Optional parameters for IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive. To use optional parameters, create an instance of
TriangleMeshPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then call the desired methods or properties to define the parameters, and finally pass the object to the triangle mesh's
Set method.

param.para:
An array containing the texture coordinates (in the order x, y) for the mesh. There must be one texture coordinate for each position passed to the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive's
Set method.

ToArgb method and casting the result as an unsigned integer.

summary.para:
Triangulates a box. It is recommended to visualize the box using a IAgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive. Although, if only the fill is desired for visualization, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.RenderBackThenFrontFaces set to
true can be used. Likewise, if only the outline is desired, a IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used.
Computes the triangulation for a box of the specified size, centered at the origin.

param.name: Size
param.para: An array containing the size along each axis of the box. The sizes are expected in the order x, y, z to correspond to the respective axis.

summary.para:
Triangulates a box. It is recommended to visualize the box using a IAgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive. Although, if only the fill is desired for visualization, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.RenderBackThenFrontFaces set to
true can be used. Likewise, if only the outline is desired, a IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used.
Computes the triangulation for a box of the specified size, centered at the origin.

param.name: Size
param.para: An array containing the size along each axis of the box. The sizes are expected in the order x, y, z to correspond to the respective axis.

summary.para:
Triangulates a cylinder. It is recommended to visualize the cylinder using a IAgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive. Although, if only the fill is desired for visualization, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.RenderBackThenFrontFaces set to
true can be used. Likewise, if only the outline is desired, a IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used.
Computes the triangulation for a cylinder centered at the origin.

param.name: Length
param.para: The length, in meters, of the cylinder along the z axis.

param.name: Radius
param.para: The radius, in meters, of the cylinder.

summary.para: Computes the triangulation for a cylinder centered at the origin.

param.name: Length
param.para: The length, in meters, of the cylinder along the z axis.

param.name: BottomRadius
param.para: The radius, in meters, of the cylinder's bottom cap.

param.name: TopRadius
param.para: The radius, in meters, of the cylinder's top cap.

param.name: Slices
param.para: The number of slices around the z axis.

param.name: CylinderFill
param.para:
Flags enumeration indicating what cylinder faces should be filled. Values can be logically
ored together.

summary.para:
Triangulates a cylinder. It is recommended to visualize the cylinder using a IAgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive. Although, if only the fill is desired for visualization, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.RenderBackThenFrontFaces set to
true can be used. Likewise, if only the outline is desired, a IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used.
Computes the triangulation for a cylinder centered at the origin.

param.name: Length
param.para: The length, in meters, of the cylinder along the z axis.

param.name: Radius
param.para: The radius, in meters, of the cylinder.

param.para: The length, in meters, of the cylinder along the z axis.

param.name: BottomRadius
param.para: The radius, in meters, of the cylinder's bottom cap.

param.name: TopRadius
param.para: The radius, in meters, of the cylinder's top cap.

param.name: Slices

ored together.

summary.para:
Triangulates an ellipsoid. It is recommended to visualize the ellipsoid using a IAgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive. Although, if only the fill is desired for visualization, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.RenderBackThenFrontFaces set to
true can be used. Likewise, if only the outline is desired, a IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used.
Computes the triangulation for an ellipsoid with the specified radii, centered at the origin, using 32 slices and 16 stacks.

param.name: Radii
param.para: The radii of the ellipsoid along each of its axes. The sizes are expected in the order x, y, z to correspond to the respective axis.

summary.para: Computes the triangulation for an ellipsoid with the specified radii, centered at the origin.

param.name: Radii
param.para: The radii of the ellipsoid along each of its axes. The sizes are expected in the order x, y, z to correspond to the respective axis.

param.name: Slices
param.para: The number of slices around the z axis.

param.name: Stacks
param.para: The number of stacks along the z axis.

summary.para:
Triangulates an ellipsoid. It is recommended to visualize the ellipsoid using a IAgStkGraphicsSolidPrimitive. Although, if only the fill is desired for visualization, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive with IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive.RenderBackThenFrontFaces set to
true can be used. Likewise, if only the outline is desired, a IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used.
Computes the triangulation for an ellipsoid with the specified radii, centered at the origin, using 32 slices and 16 stacks.

param.name: Radii
param.para: The radii of the ellipsoid along each of its axes. The sizes are expected in the order x, y, z to correspond to the respective axis.

summary.para: Computes the triangulation for an ellipsoid with the specified radii, centered at the origin.

param.name: Radii
param.para: The radii of the ellipsoid along each of its axes. The sizes are expected in the order x, y, z to correspond to the respective axis.

param.name: Slices
param.para: The number of slices around the z axis.

param.name: Stacks
param.para: The number of stacks along the z axis.

summary.para: Triangulates a polyline into an extrusion with bottom and top boundaries.

Computes an extrusion between bottomPositions and topPositions on the specified centralBody. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorInitializer with a
positionsWindingOrder of AgEStkGraphicsWindingOrder.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: BottomPositions
param.para: An array containing bottom positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

param.name: TopPositions
param.para: An array containing top positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

summary.para: Computes an extrusion between bottomPositions and topPositions on the specified centralBody.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: BottomPositions
param.para: An array containing bottom positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

param.name: TopPositions
param.para: An array containing top positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

param.name: PositionsWindingOrder
param.para: The winding order of bottomPositions and topPositions.

summary.para: For convenience. Computes an extrusion between bottomPositions and topPositions on the specified centralBody using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in bottomPositions and topPositions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorInitializer

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: BottomPositions
param.para: An array containing bottom positions, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: TopPositions
param.para: An array containing top positions, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para: For convenience. Computes an extrusion between bottomPositions and topPositions on the specified centralBody using Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in bottomPositions and topPositions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorInitializer

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: BottomPositions
param.para: An array containing bottom positions, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: TopPositions
param.para: An array containing top positions, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

param.name: PositionsWindingOrder
param.para: The winding order of bottomPositions and topPositions.

summary.para:
Computes an extrusion of positions on the specified centralBody with a constant bottomAltitude and topAltitude. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsExtrudedPolylineTriangulatorInitializer with a
positionsWindingOrder of AgEStkGraphicsWindingOrder.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the extrusion on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing the polyline positions (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame, that should be extruded.

param.name: BottomAltitude
param.para: The extrusion's bottom altitude, in meters, above the ellipsoid.

param.name: TopAltitude
param.para: The extrusion's top altitude, in meters, above the ellipsoid.

positionsWindingOrder of AgEStkGraphicsWindingOrder.
