summary.para: Triangulates an extent on a central body into a triangle mesh and a surrounding boundary. The mesh is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive. The boundary is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.

Computes a triangulation on the specified centralBody for the specified extent. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceExtentTriangulatorInitializer with an
altitude of
0 and a
granularity of
1 degree.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent to compute the triangulation for. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

summary.para: Computes a triangulation on the specified centralBody for the specified extent.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent to compute the triangulation for. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

param.name: Altitude
param.para:
The altitude of the triangulation. When
0, the mesh is computed to conform to the ellipsoid.

param.name: Granularity
param.para: The angular separation, in radians, of triangles in the triangulation. Lower granularities are more precise but create more triangles.

summary.para: Triangulates an extent on a central body into a triangle mesh and a surrounding boundary. The mesh is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive. The boundary is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.

Computes a triangulation on the specified centralBody for the specified extent. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceExtentTriangulatorInitializer with an
altitude of
0 and a
granularity of
1 degree.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent to compute the triangulation for. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

summary.para: Computes a triangulation on the specified centralBody for the specified extent.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent to compute the triangulation for. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude.

param.name: Altitude
param.para:
The altitude of the triangulation. When
0, the mesh is computed to conform to the ellipsoid.

param.name: Granularity
param.para: The angular separation, in radians, of triangles in the triangulation. Lower granularities are more precise but create more triangles.

summary.para: Triangulates a polygon, with an optional hole, on a central body, into a triangle mesh and a surrounding boundary. The mesh is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceMeshPrimitive. The boundary is commonly visualized with the IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive.

Computes the triangulation on the specified centralBody for a polygon whose boundary is defined by the specified positions. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfacePolygonTriangulatorInitializer with an
altitude of
0, a
granularity of
1 degree, and a
positionsWindingOrder of AgEStkGraphicsWindingOrder.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) defining the boundary of the polygon, in the centralBody's fixed reference frame, to triangulate.

summary.para: For convenience. Computes the triangulation on the specified centralBody for a polygon whose boundary is defined by the specified Cartographic positions. Longitude and latitude are in radians, and altitude is in meters. This is equivalent to converting each position in positions to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfacePolygonTriangulatorInitializer

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions defining the boundary of the polygon to triangulate, provided in the order latitude, longitude, altitude.

summary.para:
Computes the triangulation on the specified centralBody for a polygon whose boundary is defined by the specified positions with a hole specified by holePositions. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfacePolygonTriangulatorInitializer with an
altitude of
0 and a
granularity of
1 degree.

param.para: The central body to compute the triangulation on.

param.name: Positions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) defining the boundary of the polygon, in the centralBody's fixed reference frame, to triangulate.

param.name: HolePositions
param.para: An array containing positions (in the order x, y, z) defining the hole in the polygon, in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

summary.para: Computes the triangulation on the specified centralBody for a polygon whose boundary is defined by the specified positions with a hole specified by holePositions.

summary.para: Computes boundary positions for shapes on the surface such as circles, ellipses, and sectors.
Computes boundary positions for a circle on the specified centralBody with the specified center, radius and granularity.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the circle on.

param.name: Center
param.para: An array containing the center of the circle (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

param.name: Radius
param.para: The radius of the circle, in meters.

param.name: Granularity
param.para: The angular separation, in radians, of positions along the boundary.

summary.para:
Computes boundary positions for a circle on the specified centralBody with the specified center and radius. This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceShapesInitializer with a granularity of
1 degree.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the circle on.

param.name: Center
param.para: An array containing the center of the circle (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

param.name: Radius
param.para: The radius of the circle, in meters.

This is equivalent to converting center to Cartesian and calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceShapesInitializer

param.para: The angular separation, in radians, of positions along the boundary.

summary.para: Computes boundary positions for an ellipse on the specified centralBody.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body to compute the ellipse on.

param.name: Center
param.para: An array containing the center of the ellipse (in the order x, y, z), in the centralBody's fixed reference frame.

param.name: MajorAxisRadius
param.para: The radius of the ellipse's major axis, in meters.

param.name: MinorAxisRadius
param.para: The radius of the ellipse's minor axis, in meters.

param.name: Bearing
param.para: An angle, in radians, measured clockwise from north.

param.name: Granularity
param.para: The angular separation, in radians, of positions along the boundary.

summary.para:
Computes boundary positions for an ellipse on the specified centralBody This is equivalent to calling IAgStkGraphicsSurfaceShapesInitializer with a granularity of
1 degree.

summary.para: The Activator class provides methods to load COM plugins that implement custom image globe overlays. For more information about custom image globe overlays, see the STK Programming Interface.

The Activator class provides methods to load COM plugins that implement custom image globe overlays. For more information about custom image globe overlays, see the STK Programming Interface.
Initializes a new instance of the Activator type.

Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsGeospatialImageGlobeOverlay with the provided values.

param.name: Uri
param.para: The String that represents the Uri that points to the image.

Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsGeospatialImageGlobeOverlay with the provided values.

param.name: Uri
param.para: The String that represents the Uri that points to the image.

summary.para: A IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay which IAgStkGraphicsProjection a IAgStkGraphicsRaster onto the IAgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay or surface of the Central Body. You can also enable projection onto IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive by setting IAgStkGraphicsSceneGlobeOverlaySettings.ProjectedRasterModelProjection to true for a Scene. The IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay can also be used with IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream and IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream to stream IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream and other raster data to a IAgStkGraphicsProjection that moves with time.
Initializes a new instance.

param.name: Raster
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsRaster to be projected with projection.

param.name: Projection
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection that will project the raster.

summary.para: Gets whether or not the video card supports the IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.

A IAgStkGraphicsGlobeImageOverlay which IAgStkGraphicsProjection a IAgStkGraphicsRaster onto the IAgStkGraphicsTerrainOverlay or surface of the Central Body. You can also enable projection onto IAgStkGraphicsModelPrimitive by setting IAgStkGraphicsSceneGlobeOverlaySettings.ProjectedRasterModelProjection to true for a Scene. The IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay can also be used with IAgStkGraphicsRasterStream and IAgStkGraphicsProjectionStream to stream IAgStkGraphicsVideoStream and other raster data to a IAgStkGraphicsProjection that moves with time.
Initializes a new instance.

param.name: Raster
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsRaster to be projected with projection.

param.name: Projection
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection that will project the raster.

summary.para: Gets whether or not the video card supports the IAgStkGraphicsProjectedRasterOverlay.

A IAgStkGraphicsProjection represents a simplified camera with a IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Position, IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Orientation, and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewHorizontal and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewVertical. Unlike a real world camera, IAgStkGraphicsProjection has a nearest and farthest viewing distance, as defined by the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.NearPlane and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FarPlane properties. For example, IAgStkGraphicsProjection can be used to represent a UAV's camera, to allow for projecting video onto terrain. See the Raster and Projection Streams Overview for such an example.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the cartesian IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Position (in the order x, y, z) of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

param.name: Orientation
param.para: The Unit Quaternion defining the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.Orientation of the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

param.name: FieldOfViewHorizontal
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewHorizontal associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

param.name: FieldOfViewVertical
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewVertical associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

param.name: NearPlane
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection.NearPlane associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

param.name: FarPlane
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FarPlane associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance from another projection.

param.name: Projection
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection from which to initialize the new instance.

Unlike a real world camera, IAgStkGraphicsProjection has a nearest and farthest viewing distance, as defined by the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.NearPlane and IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FarPlane properties. param.name: FieldOfViewVertical
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsProjection.FieldOfViewVertical associated with the IAgStkGraphicsProjection.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive altitude interval, in meters, that determines when an object is rendered based on the camera's altitude relative to a Central Body.
Initializes a default altitude display condition. With this constructor, an object is always rendered regardless of the camera's altitude.

Initializes an altitude display condition with the inclusive altitude interval [minimumAltitude, maximumAltitude]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the camera's altitude, relative to the Central Body, is within the interval.

param.name: MinimumAltitude
param.para:
The minimum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MinValue to ignore checking the minimum altitude.

param.name: MaximumAltitude
param.para:
The maximum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum altitude.

summary.para: Initializes an altitude display condition with the inclusive altitude interval [minimumAltitude, maximumAltitude]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the camera's altitude, relative to the centralBody, is within the interval.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body to which the altitude is relative.

param.name: MinimumAltitude
param.para:
The minimum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MinValue to ignore checking the minimum altitude.

param.name: MaximumAltitude
param.para:
The maximum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum altitude.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive altitude interval, in meters, that determines when an object is rendered based on the camera's altitude relative to a Central Body.
Initializes a default altitude display condition. With this constructor, an object is always rendered regardless of the camera's altitude.

Initializes an altitude display condition with the inclusive altitude interval [minimumAltitude, maximumAltitude]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the camera's altitude, relative to the Central Body, is within the interval.

param.name: MaximumAltitude
param.para:
The maximum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum altitude.

summary.para: Initializes an altitude display condition with the inclusive altitude interval [minimumAltitude, maximumAltitude]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the camera's altitude, relative to the centralBody, is within the interval.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The Central Body to which the altitude is relative.

param.name: MinimumAltitude
param.para:
The minimum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MinValue to ignore checking the minimum altitude.

param.name: MaximumAltitude
param.para:
The maximum altitude, in meters, of the inclusive altitude interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum altitude.

summary.para: A composite of display conditions combined using a AgEStkGraphicsBinaryLogicOperation. For example, several IAgStkGraphicsTimeIntervalDisplayCondition objects can be added to a composite. The composite can then be assigned to an object so the object is only rendered when the current animation time is within one of the time intervals.
Initializes an empty composite display condition.

A composite of display conditions combined using a AgEStkGraphicsBinaryLogicOperation. For example, several IAgStkGraphicsTimeIntervalDisplayCondition objects can be added to a composite. The composite can then be assigned to an object so the object is only rendered when the current animation time is within one of the time intervals.
Initializes an empty composite display condition.

A primitive that is composed of multiple other primitives. Since composites can contain other composites, they are commonly used to build hierarchies of primitives to efficiently evaluate display conditions.
Primitives in a composite must have the same IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.
Initializes a default composite primitive.

A primitive that is composed of multiple other primitives. Since composites can contain other composites, they are commonly used to build hierarchies of primitives to efficiently evaluate display conditions.
Primitives in a composite must have the same IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive.ReferenceFrame.
Initializes a default composite primitive.

A display condition that evaluates to a user-defined value. This is commonly used to hide primitives by assigning to a primitive a display condition that always returns
false.

Initializes a default constant display condition. IAgStkGraphicsConstantDisplayCondition.Display is set to
false so when this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is not rendered.
Initializes a constant display condition with the value the display condition evaluates to.

param.name: Display
param.para: The value the display condition evaluates to. If true, when this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is always rendered. If false, the object is never rendered.

summary.para:
A display condition that evaluates to a user-defined value. This is commonly used to hide primitives by assigning to a primitive a display condition that always returns
false.

Initializes a default constant display condition. IAgStkGraphicsConstantDisplayCondition.Display is set to
false so when this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is not rendered.
Initializes a constant display condition with the value the display condition evaluates to.

param.name: Display
param.para: The value the display condition evaluates to. If true, when this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is always rendered. If false, the object is never rendered.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to the object.

Initializes a default distance display condition. IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition.MinimumDistance is set to
0 and IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition.MaximumDistance is set to
Double.MaxValue. With this interval, an object is always rendered regardless of its distance to the camera.

Initializes a distance display condition with the inclusive distance interval [minimumDistance, maximumDistance]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the distance, in meters, from the camera to the object is within the interval.

param.name: MinimumDistance
param.para: The minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

param.name: MaximumDistance
param.para:
The maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to the object.

Initializes a default distance display condition. IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition.MinimumDistance is set to
0 and IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition.MaximumDistance is set to
Double.MaxValue. With this interval, an object is always rendered regardless of its distance to the camera.

Initializes a distance display condition with the inclusive distance interval [minimumDistance, maximumDistance]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the distance, in meters, from the camera to the object is within the interval.

param.name: MinimumDistance
param.para: The minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

param.name: MaximumDistance
param.para:
The maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay. This is different from IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition because it is based on the camera's distance to a specified IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay, rather than the camera's distance to the object that uses this display condition.
Initializes a default distance to globe overlay display condition. With this constructor, an object is always rendered regardless of the camera's distance to the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay.

Initializes a distance display condition with the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay and the inclusive distance interval [minimumDistance, maximumDistance]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the distance, in meters, from the camera to the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay is within the interval.

param.name: GlobeOverlay
param.para: The globe overlay associated with this instance.

param.name: MinimumDistance
param.para: The minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

param.name: MaximumDistance
param.para:
The maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay. This is different from IAgStkGraphicsDistanceDisplayCondition because it is based on the camera's distance to a specified IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay, rather than the camera's distance to the object that uses this display condition.

param.name: MinimumDistance

param.name: MaximumDistance
param.para:
The maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive distance interval, in meters, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the distance, in meters, from the camera to a position defined in the given Reference Frame.

Initializes a default distance to position display condition. With this constructor, an object is always rendered regardless of the camera's distance to the IAgStkGraphicsDistanceToPositionDisplayCondition.Position.

Initializes a distance display condition with the inclusive distance interval [minimumDistance, maximumDistance]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the distance, in meters, from the camera to the position is within the interval.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array containing the position (in the order x, y, z) used to compute the distance from the camera.

param.name: MinimumDistance
param.para: The minimum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval.

param.name: MaximumDistance
param.para:
The maximum distance, in meters, of the inclusive distance interval. Use
Double.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum distance.

summary.para: IAgStkGraphicsPathPrimitive update policy that removes points from IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.RemoveLocation after a given IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.Duration.

Constructs a default update policy. This is equivalent to constructing a policy with IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.Duration set to 0 and a IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.RemoveLocation of
Front.
Initializes a policy with the specified duration and removeLocation.

param.name: Duration
param.para: Sets the amount of time that a point at IAgStkGraphicsDurationPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.RemoveLocation will be on the path.

param.name: RemoveLocation
param.para: Sets the remove location to the front or back of the path.

A font that is suitable for use with the IAgStkGraphicsTextBatchPrimitive. For best performance, avoid creating duplicate font objects. Instead assign the same font object to several text batch primitives.
Initializes a graphics font with the given arguments.

param.name: Name
param.para: The typeface name of the font.

param.name: Size
param.para: The size of the font.

param.name: FontStyle
param.para:
The style of the font. AgEStkGraphicsFontStyle enumeration values can be logically
ored together to apply more than one style.

param.name: Outline
param.para:
true if the font should be created with an outline around its characters; otherwise,
false.

summary.para: Initializes a graphics font with the typeface name and size.

param.name: Name
param.para: The typeface name of the font.

param.name: Size
param.para: The size of the font.

summary.para: The great arc interpolator computes interpolated positions along a great arc. A great arc is the shortest path between two positions on an ellipsoid.

Initializes a default great arc interpolator. This is equivalent to constructing a great arc interpolator with a IAgStkGraphicsGreatArcInterpolator.CentralBody equal to an instance of Earth Central Body and a IAgStkGraphicsGreatArcInterpolator.Granularity of
1 degree.

Initializes a great arc interpolator with the specified centralBody and a IAgStkGraphicsGreatArcInterpolator.Granularity of
1 degree.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body used when interpolating with Interpolate.

summary.para: Initializes a great arc interpolator with the specified centralBody and granularity.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body used when interpolating with Interpolate.

param.name: Granularity
param.para: The granularity, in radians, used when interpolating with Interpolate.

summary.para: The great arc interpolator computes interpolated positions along a great arc. A great arc is the shortest path between two positions on an ellipsoid.

param.para: The granularity, in radians, used when interpolating with Interpolate.

summary.para: Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster derived from the luminance of the raster's color bands.
Initializes a new instance.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster derived from the luminance of the raster's color bands.
Initializes a new instance.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster based on the value of its first pixel. All pixels in the source raster that are the same color as the first pixel will be made transparent.
Initializes a new instance.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster based on the value of its first pixel. All pixels in the source raster that are the same color as the first pixel will be made transparent.
Initializes a new instance.
Adds an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band to the source raster derived from the color bands or alpha of another raster. This filter can be used to apply an alpha mask to the source raster.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with the raster that the source raster will use to derive an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band.

param.name: Raster
param.para: The raster the source raster will use to derive an AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand band.

summary.para: Applies convolution to the source raster. Convolution is the modification of a pixel's value based on the values of its surrounding pixels. The IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel is the numerical matrix that is applied to each pixel in this process. The convolution operation is discussed in more detail in numerous texts on image processing and useful convolution kernels are widely available from various sources.
Initializes a new instance.
Initializes a new instance with the specified IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel.

param.name: Kernel
param.para: An array containing the 9 elements of the IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel of the convolution matrix. The elements should be provided as the entire first row, followed by the entire second row, followed by the entire third row, each from left to right.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance with the specified IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel and IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Divisor.

param.name: Kernel
param.para: An array containing the 9 elements of the IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel of the convolution matrix. The elements should be provided as the entire first row, followed by the entire second row, followed by the entire third row, each from left to right.

param.name: Divisor
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Divisor of the convolution.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance with the specified IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel, IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Divisor, and IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Offset.

param.name: Kernel
param.para: An array containing the 9 elements of the IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Kernel of the convolution matrix. The elements should be provided as the entire first row, followed by the entire second row, followed by the entire third row, each from left to right.

param.name: Divisor
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Divisor of the convolution.

param.name: Offset
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsConvolutionFilter.Offset of the convolution.

summary.para: Converts an image, such as a BMP, to a GeoJP2 file that can be used as an image globe overlay.
Converts an image, such as a BMP, to a GeoJP2 file that can be used as an image globe overlay. The extent of the image must be in the image, as in a GeoTIFF.

param.name: ImageUri
param.para: The image filename to be converted. Only file URIs are supported.

param.name: CompressionProfile
param.para: The compression profile.

param.name: CompressionRate
param.para: A higher compression rate results in smaller JPEG 2000 files. Use 1 for no compression. Valid values are 1 to 65535.

param.name: Jpeg2000Uri
param.para: The JPEG 2000 filename. Only file URIs are supported.

param.name: OverwriteExistingFile
param.para: If true and the JPEG 2000 file already exists, the file will be overwritten during the conversion.

summary.para: Converts an image, such as a BMP, to a GeoJP2 file that can be used as an image globe overlay. The extent of the image can be defined as an input parameter if necessary.

param.name: ImageUri
param.para: The image filename to be converted. Only file URIs are supported.

param.name: Extent
param.para: An array representing the Cartographic Extent of the image. The elements should be provided in the order west longitude, south latitude, east longitude, north latitude. The extent can be null if the image defines the extent as with a GeoTIFF image.

param.name: CompressionProfile
param.para: The compression profile.

param.name: CompressionRate
param.para: A higher compression rate results in smaller JPEG 2000 files. Use 1 for no compression. Valid values are 1 to 65535.

param.name: Jpeg2000Uri
param.para: The JPEG 2000 filename. Only file URIs are supported.

param.name: OverwriteExistingFile
param.para: If true and the JPEG 2000 file already exists, the file will be overwritten during the conversion.

The Activator class provides methods to load COM plugins that implement projection and raster streaming. For more information about the projection and raster plugins, see the STK Programming Interface.
Initializes a new instance of the Activator type.

The Activator class provides methods to load COM plugins that implement projection and raster streaming. For more information about the projection and raster plugins, see the STK Programming Interface.
Initializes a new instance of the Activator type.

A raster dataset. A raster consists of one or more AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand, or sets of values, which are most commonly associated with colors when the raster represents an image. For instance, a typical color image contains three sets of values, or bands (red, green, and blue) which define the color of pixels within the image. The following raster image formats can be read by the raster class: BMP, ECW, IMG, JP2, NTF, NITF, PNG, SID, TIF, TIFF, JPG, JPEG, PPM, PGM, CLDS, and TGA. To create a texture from a raster, pass it to the IAgStkGraphicsTexture2DFactory.FromRaster method.
Initializes a raster from a Uri, which can be a file, HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP source. See IAgStkGraphicsRaster for a list of supported formats.

param.name: Uri
param.para: The Uri of the raster.

summary.para: Initializes a raster from a Uri. Only the specified subsection of the raster is read. See IAgStkGraphicsRaster for a list of supported formats.

param.name: Uri
param.para: The Uri of the raster.

param.name: X
param.para: The X position of the subsection in pixels.

param.name: Y
param.para: The Y position of the subsection in pixels.

param.name: Width
param.para: The width of the subsection in pixels.

param.name: Height
param.para: The height of the subsection in pixels.

summary.para: Initializes a raster from another raster.

param.name: Raster
param.para: The IAgStkGraphicsRaster to create the raster from.

summary.para: The attributes describing a IAgStkGraphicsRaster dataset. IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes define the memory layout of a IAgStkGraphicsRaster, and includes properties defining the order of each AgEStkGraphicsRasterBand that the raster contains, as specified by the AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat. It also describes the type of data, or AgEStkGraphicsRasterType of the contained bands, the IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes.Height and IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes.Width of the raster in pixels, the IAgStkGraphicsRasterAttributes.RowAlignment of the raster, and other relevant properties.
Initializes a new instance with the width and height of the raster in pixels, and the given AgEStkGraphicsRasterFormat.

param.para: The width of the raster in pixels.

param.para: The height of the raster in pixels.

summary.para: Renders one or more markers in the 3D scene. Markers are 2D images that always face the viewer which can be sized in pixels or meters. Markers are also referred to as sprites or billboards.
For best performance, avoid creating lots of batches with only a few markers each. See the Batching Performance Overview.

Initializes a default marker batch primitive. This is equivalent to constructing a marker batch with a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSizeSource of
FromTexture, a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSortOrder of
ByTexture, a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent, and a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchRenderingMethod of
Automatic.

Initializes a marker batch primitive with the specified setHint. This is equivalent to constructing a marker batch with a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSizeSource of
FromTexture, a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSortOrder of
ByTexture, the specified setHint, and a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchRenderingMethod of
Automatic.

Initializes a marker batch primitive with the specified sizeSource. This is equivalent to constructing a marker batch with the specified sizeSource, a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchSortOrder of
ByTexture, a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent, and a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchRenderingMethod of
Automatic.

param.name: SizeSource
param.para: Determines the source used for the size of markers in the batch.

summary.para:
Initializes a marker batch primitive with the specified sizeSource and sortOrder. This is equivalent to constructing a marker batch with the specified sizeSource, the specified sortOrder, a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent, and a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchRenderingMethod of
Automatic.

param.name: SizeSource
param.para: Determines the source used for the size of markers in the batch.

param.name: SortOrder
param.para: The order in which markers in the batch should be sorted before rendering.

summary.para:
Initializes a marker batch primitive with the specified sizeSource, sortOrder, and setHint. This is equivalent to constructing a marker batch with the specified arguments and a AgEStkGraphicsMarkerBatchRenderingMethod of
Automatic.

param.name: SizeSource
param.para: Determines the source used for the size of markers in the batch.

param.name: SortOrder
param.para: The order in which markers in the batch should be sorted before rendering.

Optional per-marker parameters for IAgStkGraphicsMarkerBatchPrimitive that overrides the marker batch's per-batch parameters. Define per-marker parameters by creating an instance of

Set or
SetPartial method.

SetPartial method.

IAgStkGraphicsPathPrimitive update policy that removes points from IAgStkGraphicsMaximumCountPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.RemoveLocation when the number of points in the path exceeds IAgStkGraphicsMaximumCountPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.MaximumCount.

Constructs a default update policy. This is equivalent to constructing a policy with IAgStkGraphicsMaximumCountPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.MaximumCount set to 0 and a IAgStkGraphicsMaximumCountPathPrimitiveUpdatePolicy.RemoveLocation of
Front.

param.name: MaximumCount
param.para: Sets the maximum position count.

param.name: RemoveLocation
param.para: Sets the remove location.

Defines an inclusive interval, in pixels, that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the number of pixels the object's bounding sphere (or in the case of screen overlays, bounding rectangle) covers on the screen. This is commonly used to implement level of detail algorithms that take into account the field of view.

Initializes a default pixel size display condition. IAgStkGraphicsPixelSizeDisplayCondition.MinimumPixelSize is set to
0 and IAgStkGraphicsPixelSizeDisplayCondition.MaximumPixelSize is set to
Int32.MaxValue. With this interval, an object is always rendered regardless of how many pixels its bounding sphere or rectangle covers.

Initializes a pixel size display condition with the inclusive interval [minimumPixelSize, maximumPixelSize]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the number of pixels consumed by the object's bounding sphere, projected onto the screen, (or in the case of screen overlays, the area of its bounding rectangle) is within the interval.

param.name: MinimumPixelSize
param.para: The minimum pixel size of the inclusive interval.

param.name: MaximumPixelSize
param.para:
The maximum pixel size of the inclusive interval. Use
Int32.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum pixel size.

param.name: MinimumPixelSize
param.para: The minimum pixel size of the inclusive interval.

param.name: MaximumPixelSize
param.para:
The maximum pixel size of the inclusive interval. Use
Int32.MaxValue to ignore checking the maximum pixel size.

summary.para: Renders one or more points in the 3D scene. Each point in the batch has a unique position and an optional color. All points in the batch share the same pixel size. For best performance, avoid creating lots of batches with only a few points each. See the Batching Performance Overview.

Initializes a default point batch primitive. This is equivalent to constructing a point batch with a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent.
Initializes a new instance of a point batch primitive with the specified AgEStkGraphicsSetHint.
Gets the minimum pixel size supported by the video card.
Gets the maximum pixel size supported by the video card.

summary.para: The rhumb line interpolator computes interpolated positions along a rhumb line. Rhumb lines are lines of constant bearing. They appear as straight lines on a Mercator 2D map projection and are well suited to navigation.

Initializes a default rhumb line interpolator. This is equivalent to constructing a rhumb line interpolator with a IAgStkGraphicsRhumbLineInterpolator.CentralBody equal to an instance of Earth Central Body and a IAgStkGraphicsRhumbLineInterpolator.Granularity of
1 degree.

Initializes a rhumb line interpolator with the specified centralBody and a IAgStkGraphicsRhumbLineInterpolator.Granularity of
1 degree.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body used when interpolating with Interpolate.

summary.para: Initializes a rhumb line interpolator with the specified centralBody and granularity.

param.name: CentralBody
param.para: The central body used when interpolating with Interpolate.

param.name: Granularity
param.para: The granularity, in radians, used when interpolating with Interpolate.

summary.para: A display condition used to control what scene or scenes an object, such as a primitive, is rendered in. This is used to show an object in some scenes and hide it in others.

Initializes a default scene display condition. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object can be restricted to only render in certain scenes. Call IAgStkGraphicsSceneDisplayCondition.SetDisplayInScene or IAgStkGraphicsSceneDisplayCondition.DisplayOnlyInScene to limit the scenes.
A display condition used to control what scene or scenes an object, such as a primitive, is rendered in. This is used to show an object in some scenes and hide it in others.

Initializes a default scene display condition. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object can be restricted to only render in certain scenes. Call IAgStkGraphicsSceneDisplayCondition.SetDisplayInScene or IAgStkGraphicsSceneDisplayCondition.DisplayOnlyInScene to limit the scenes.

The static IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager class provides global properties and functionality that apply to all IAgStkGraphicsScene and thus affect the rendering of every globe control. It also provides a IAgStkGraphicsSceneManagerInitializer.Textures property for creating new Texture 2D, and controls the Time of all IAgStkGraphicsScene within an application. The Animation property and Set Time method can be used to control Time. The IAgStkGraphicsSceneManagerInitializer.Primitives and IAgStkGraphicsSceneManagerInitializer.ScreenOverlays properties allow you to add IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive and IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay to all IAgStkGraphicsScene. To render these objects in specific scenes, see the IAgStkGraphicsSceneDisplayCondition class. To render all IAgStkGraphicsScene within an application, call the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManagerInitializer.Render method.
Renders all IAgStkGraphicsScene within an application. To render a specific IAgStkGraphicsScene, use the IAgStkGraphicsScene.Render method.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsPrimitiveManager, which is used to add IAgStkGraphicsPrimitive to your IAgStkGraphicsScene.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlayManager, which is used to add IAgStkGraphicsScreenOverlay to your IAgStkGraphicsScene.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsTexture2DFactory, which can be used to create Texture 2D from various sources.
Gets the IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlaySettings, which are used to set global settings for all IAgStkGraphicsGlobeOverlay.
Gets a read-only collection of IAgStkGraphicsScene that are associated with the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.

To render these objects in specific scenes, see the IAgStkGraphicsSceneDisplayCondition class. To render all IAgStkGraphicsScene within an application, call the IAgStkGraphicsSceneManagerInitializer.Render method.

summary.para: Renders filled solid objects and their outlines. Example solids include boxes and ellipsoids. Various effects are supported, such as displaying the solid's silhouette, and hidding the outline of the backside of the solid. In cases where you just want to visualize a solid's fill or outline, a IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive or IAgStkGraphicsPolylinePrimitive can be used for reduced overhead.

Initializes a default solid primitive. This is equivalent to constructing a solid primitive with a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent.
Initializes a solid primitive with the specified setHint.
Gets the minimum silhouette width, in pixels, supported by the video card.
Gets the maximum silhouette width, in pixels, supported by the video card.

A 4 by 4 matrix applied to a texture coordinate.
Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsTextureMatrix to the identity matrix.
Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsTextureMatrix. The subscripts define [row][column].
Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsTextureMatrix from a Matrix. The upper left 2x2 matrix defines rotation and scaling. The top two elements of the last column define translation.

param.name: Matrix
param.para: An array representing the matrix of the texture. The elements should be provided row by row, from left to right.

summary.para: Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsTextureMatrix from texture corner points. Normally, a texture is mapped such that the lower left corner is texture coordinate (0, 0), the lower right is (1, 0), the upper right is (1, 1), and the upper left is (0, 1). This code remaps those corners to new corners. For example, remapping the lower left corner to (0.5, 0), the lower right to (1, 0.5), the upper right to (0.5, 1), and the upper left to (0, 0.5) would rotate the texture 45 degress.

param.name: Corner0
param.para: An array containing the new location of the texture's lower left corner in the order x, y.

param.name: Corner1
param.para: An array containing the new location of the texture's lower right corner in the order x, y.

param.name: Corner2
param.para: An array containing the new location of the texture's upper right corner in the order x, y.

param.name: Corner3
param.para: An array containing the new location of the texture's upper left corner in the order x, y.

summary.para: A 4 by 4 matrix applied to a texture coordinate.
Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsTextureMatrix to the identity matrix.
Initializes a IAgStkGraphicsTextureMatrix. The subscripts define [row][column].

For example, remapping the lower left corner to (0.5, 0), the lower right to (1, 0.5), the upper right to (0.5, 1), and the upper left to (0, 0.5) would rotate the texture 45 degress.

param.para: An array with a size of 4 that represents the size of the overlay. The elements are in the order width, height, width AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, height AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

summary.para: Initializes the overlay with a specified background texture. The size of the overlay will be the same as the size of the texture.

param.name: XPixels
param.para: The X position of the panel in pixels.

param.name: YPixels
param.para: The Y position of the panel in pixels.

param.name: Texture
param.para: The texture (image) to be drawn on the overlay. Textures can be obtained from IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Textures.

summary.para: Initializes the overlay with a specified background texture. The size of the overlay will be the same as the size of the texture.

param.name: Position
param.para: An array with a size of 4 that represents the position of the overlay. The elements are in the order x position, y position, x AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit, y AgEStkGraphicsScreenOverlayUnit.

param.name: Texture
param.para: The texture (image) to be drawn on the overlay. Textures can be obtained from IAgStkGraphicsSceneManager.Textures.

summary.para: Defines an inclusive time interval that determines when an object, such as a primitive, is rendered based on the current animation time .

Initializes a default time display condition. IAgStkGraphicsTimeIntervalDisplayCondition.MinimumTime is set to
JulianDate.MinValue and IAgStkGraphicsTimeIntervalDisplayCondition.MaximumTime is set to
JulianDate.MaxValue. With this interval, an object is always rendered regardless of the current animation time.

Initializes a time display condition with the inclusive time interval [minimumTime, maximumTime]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the current animation time, Time, is within the interval.

param.name: MinimumTime
param.para: The minimum time of the inclusive time interval.

param.name: MaximumTime
param.para: The maximum distance of the inclusive time interval.

summary.para: Initializes a time display condition with a Time Interval.

param.name: TimeInterval
param.para: An array containing the time interval to assign to the display condition, in the order start time, stop time.

Initializes a time display condition with the inclusive time interval [minimumTime, maximumTime]. When this display condition is assigned to an object, such as a primitive, the object is only rendered when the current animation time, Time, is within the interval.

param.name: MinimumTime

param.name: MaximumTime
param.para: The maximum distance of the inclusive time interval.

summary.para: Initializes a time display condition with a Time Interval.

summary.para: Renders a triangle mesh in the 3D scene. Examples of triangle meshes includes polygons on the globe (e.g. states or countries), terrain and imagery extents, ellipses, and extrusions.

Initializes a default triangle mesh primitive. This is equivalent to constructing a triangle mesh with a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent.
Initializes a triangle mesh primitive with the specified setHint .
Renders a triangle mesh in the 3D scene. Examples of triangle meshes includes polygons on the globe (e.g. states or countries), terrain and imagery extents, ellipses, and extrusions.

Initializes a default triangle mesh primitive. This is equivalent to constructing a triangle mesh with a AgEStkGraphicsSetHint of
Frequent.
Initializes a triangle mesh primitive with the specified setHint .

Optional parameters for IAgStkGraphicsTriangleMeshPrimitive. To use optional parameters, create an instance of
TriangleMeshPrimitiveOptionalParameters, then call the desired methods or properties to define the parameters, and finally pass the object to the triangle mesh's
Set method.
Initializes default triangle mesh primitive optional parameters.
